Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Carlos is one of the 6.7 million adults in the U.S. with heart failure. ​ After being admitted to the emergency room for troubling heart symptoms, Carlos soon learned that the coronary artery disease he’d been diagnosed with years earlier had progressed to congestive heart failure. ​ We're committed to advancing treatments for heart failure so patients like Carlos can lead full, active lives. For American Heart Month, read about Carlos’s journey and the strides we are making: https://social.jnj.com/3T5keKm:=:https://www.jnj.com/health-and-wellness/do-you-know-what-heart-failure-is

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Did you know: Humans are genetically 99.5-99.9% identical to one another. The remaining 0.1-0.5% of unique genetic material that differentiates us is about to be turbocharged. We're excited to share that UK Biobank has unveiled new data from whole genome sequencing of its half a million volunteers—an effort supported by a consortium including Johnson & Johnson. Approved researchers around the globe can now access this data to accelerate the pace of understanding of genetic diseases and develop new diagnostics and treatment options to treat them. Discover why we’re now at the forefront of understanding the power of DNA—and some key milestones in the quest to harness it to advance human health: https://social.jnj.com/410bVBU:=:https://www.jnj.com/innovation/human-genome-healthcare-jnj-forefront

Message: Did you know that our innovators were the first to create daily-use contact lenses, helping decrease cleaning time and the spread of germs? Check out a few other pharmaceutical and medical technologies that changed the trajectory of healthcare. 💡

Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Rare conditions like myasthenia gravis can be difficult to diagnosis. For Myasthenia Gravis Awareness Month, learn more from a patient living with the autoantibody disease and how we’re working to find potential treatments.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: “Knowing you’re paying it forward gives meaning to what you do. The best way I could see to do that was to be involved in projects that could benefit patients.” ​ Hear how one researcher found his life’s calling after being diagnosed with a rare blood cancer at a young age.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: People who identify as LGBTQIA+ are almost 3x more likely to report poor mental health, but accessing treatment proves to be challenging. We’re breaking down some of the mental health disparities faced by this community and how we’re providing support. 🏳‍🌈

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: The goal of achieving equity in prostate cancer starts with getting people to talk about it, which is why it’s important to normalize these tough conversations. For #MensHealthMonth, hear from a community urologist about the importance of early detection and the impact of health disparities in prostate cancer.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Every year, roughly 80,000 Americans are diagnosed with bladder cancer. The difficult and sometimes invasive treatments can be disruptive to patients' everyday lives. See how we’re working to address unmet needs when treating the disease.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Less than 5% of medical illustrations depict dark skin, which exemplifies the inequities in our healthcare system.​ Having representation in medicine can enhance the experience of patients of color and healthcare professionals. Together with Deloitte, Association of Medical Illustrators and Ebereillustrate, we’re launching Illustrate Change. This initiative aims to build the largest library of diverse medical illustrations and address systemic issues in our healthcare system. Click here to learn more and see the illustrations.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: In historically underserved communities, access to quality care and health resources can be hard to find. To help close the gap, we've launched #MyHealthCantWait so patients across the U.S. get the care they need. Learn more at MyHealthCantWait.com

Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Every year, millions of Americans donate blood to help save lives, but what happens to it once its drawn? Put your expertise to the test for World Blood Donor Day. 💪

Message: For more than a century, our foundation in diversity, equity and inclusion has built a culture of belonging. Thanks to the shared commitment of our employees, we’re driving positive change within our company and the world at large. Learn more:

Celebrate with us by dropping a ❤ in the comments below. ​https://social.jnj.com/3N6cFQD:=:https://www.jnj.com/tag/lgbt

Message: Shoulder replacement surgeries are on the rise. With repetitive sports like tennis and swimming, younger people are finding themselves on the operating table. Learn how we’re using cutting-edge technology to improve patient outcomes.

Message: Did you know May is Better Sleep Month? 😴 Take this quiz to test your insomnia IQ and see how you can improve your sleep habits.

Message: Like many adults living with schizophrenia, Patrick never wanted his diagnosis to deter him from achieving his goals. For World Schizophrenia Day, learn about his journey to find an effective treatment plan and how we’re helping him, and others like him, discover new ways to manage their symptoms.

Message: More than 6.8 million people in the world are living with inflammatory bowel disease (IBD), which is characterized by chronic inflammation of the digestive tract. For #WorldIBDDay, we’re taking a look at the impact of this condition—and some of the reasons why hope is on the horizon.

Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.

Ahead of #WorldIBDDay, see how his team is partnering with colleagues to leverage artificial intelligence to advance clinical trials, including for patients with autoimmune diseases.

Message: Behind every innovative medicine, treatment and therapy is a clinical trial. Here’s a closer look at how they work and why it’s important to have diverse participants.

Message: Imagine working on a medical innovation that would one day help with your own mother’s surgery. That's the reality of one of our employees who has made it her personal mission to give cataracts patients their sight back. Read her story.

They play a vital role in our health systems. ❤ For #InternationalNursesDay, we’re proud to continue our 125+ year history of support by celebrating and advocating for nurses as they work to improve healthcare for everyone. https://social.jnj.com/41CjldC:=:https://nursing.jnj.com/our-commitment

Message: Ever wonder how medical devices are tracked? The UDI system for medical devices is now fully adopted in the U.S. Learn more about the steps we have taken in service of product safety and patient protection by adding unique identifiers to nearly 70,000 medical devices.

Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: In under-resourced countries, one-third of all deaths could be prevented with simple access to health care. For National Volunteer Month, hear from one Johnson & Johnson employee about her family's time at sea bringing medical care to those who need it most.

Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Do you know the right questions to ask your dermatologist? Advocating for yourself is key – and can be particularly important for people of color to receive a proper diagnosis. This National Minority Health Month, view these three tips to help you prepare for your next visit to the dermatologist. #NMHM2023

Message: What do these Johnson & Johnson employees have in common? Their passion for improving both human health and the health of the planet. For #EarthDay, meet three trailblazers who are helping the company reach its #climate goals. #InvestInOurPlanet

Message: Johnson & Johnson is honored to be ranked in the top 15 on Fortune's 2023 list of America's Most Innovative Companies. For Women’s History Month, learn how the company is striving to: - Encourage #WomenInSTEM through programs and partnerships - Improve the health of women around the world - Elevate female employees into management positions

Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: For the last 20 years, Johnson & Johnson has committed to supporting global efforts in the fight against tuberculosis (TB). For World TB Day, meet four young leaders working to #endTB, from advancing research and development to advocating for new resources.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: To celebrate #WomensHistoryMonth, meet Edith Von Kuster, the first female scientist at Johnson & Johnson and a pioneer for women's equality at the company. Learn about her legacy and impact.

Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: The statistics are stark: People of color are vastly underrepresented in medical and scientific professions. With career support and development programs, Johnson & Johnson is aiming to help close the health equity gap. Hear from three professionals about how they advanced their careers in healthcare.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Children diagnosed with autoimmune diseases, like pediatric plaque psoriasis and juvenile idiopathic arthritis, can experience long-term detrimental effects if left untreated. For #AutoimmuneDisease Awareness Month, hear from two Johnson & Johnson researchers who are working to detect, diagnose and treat these conditions at an early age.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Black men are two times more likely to die of prostate cancer than most other men, according to the National Cancer Institute. Hear from a urologist about how screening and early detection can help address disparities in prostate care.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: When Johnson & Johnson was founded in 1886, eight of the original 14 employees were women. This #InternationalWomensDay, J&J continues to #EmbraceEquity and support women by expanding medical benefits and advancing healthcare solutions. Check out some of the milestones from the past 136 years.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: “To be part of a team that’s building something from scratch, across multiple diseases simultaneously with limited to no treatment options—something that’s never been done before—is amazing.”—Hetal Patel, Medical Director, Global Medical Affairs, Immunodermatology, Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson. Ahead of International Women’s Day, hear from a trailblazer at Johnson & Johnson about what inspires her to work toward bringing advanced treatments to patients living with autoantibody diseases. #WomenInSTEM

Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.

Message: People living with a rare disease have a harder time getting a diagnosis and treatment. For #RareDiseaseDay, learn how teams across Johnson & Johnson are tackling these challenges to provide patients with treatment options.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: More than 240 million people around the world are living with an autoantibody disease. This #RareDiseaseDay, hear how Johnson & Johnson researchers are working to help patients with abnormal immune responses that cause the body to attack itself. https://social.jnj.com/41AcS43:=:https://www.jnj.com/innovation/what-are-autoantibodies

Message: Peripheral artery disease impacts up to 12 million Americans, according to the American Heart Association, yet many don’t realize they have the condition. For #AmericanHeartMonth, learn more about this common circulatory condition and how advocates at Johnson & Johnson are spreading awareness to those with an increased risk.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Systemic disadvantages, including the ability to access healthcare, can be linked to severe health disparities. From providing healthcare professionals with educational resources to helping community organizers perform free mobile health screenings, Johnson & Johnson is making progress on Our Race to Health Equity. For #AmericanHeartMonth, learn more about the company’s goals to address racial disparities in heart health.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: “As a caregiver, I think the most important thing—and it sounds so clichéd—is to always keep hope alive.” On #NationalCaregiversDay, hear from one woman about her emotional journey caring for her husband after his cancer diagnosis and how families can support their loved ones in similar situations.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: “I’ll keep pushing until there’s something out there that can both prevent deaths and give those patients who do survive a better quality of life.”—Kerri Nottage, M.D., Global Medical Head, Oncology, The Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson. For some children with cancer, treatment can also lead to the development of life-threatening conditions. This International Childhood Cancer Day, read about one doctor’s experience as a pediatric hematologist and oncologist committed to helping young cancer patients.

Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: “I’ve always set the bar high for myself and believed that I could do anything, and I think as female researchers and women working in #STEM, we need to form a strong community and support each other. The sky is the limit for women in STEM!” For International Day of Women and Girls in Science, learn about the work of the Johnson & Johnson WiSTEM2D Scholars Award winners and see why J&J is proud to support women in the fields of science, technology, engineering, manufacturing and design. #WomenInScienceDay.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Recognized for his research on the human gut microbiome, Jeffrey Gordon, M.D. has been awarded the 2022 #DPJAward for Biomedical Research. Learn more about how Dr. Gordon’s work has tackled global public health issues, such as childhood malnutrition.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: This #AmericanHeartMonth, Johnson & Johnson is proud to spotlight Dr. Jay P., who provides real-time heart monitoring for his patients on cardiovascular medications, allowing for early intervention and improved health outcomes. Join J&J with National Association of Chain Drug Stores (NACDS), highlighting how pharmacists make an impact, improving heart health. #YouStandByUsAll

Message: For nearly 20 years, scientists at Johnson & Johnson have studied multiple myeloma, a rare blood cancer that impacts nearly 35,000 adults in the U.S. annually. For #WorldCancerDay, learn more about the company’s dedication to developing innovative treatments for the disease.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Johnson & Johnson is honored to be No. 1 on the Fortune 2023 World's Most Admired Companies Pharmaceutical Industry list for the 10th year in a row, and ranked on the All-Star list for the 21st consecutive year. Read how the company is working to advance global health innovation for those who need it most.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Experts at Johnson & Johnson are accelerating research to take on one of the WHO’s top-10 global health threats—dengue. For World NTD Day, learn more about the growing impact of the tropical disease and J&J’s commitment to combat it.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: 1️⃣ Acclinate: Educating BIPOC communities to increase awareness about current inequities in clinical trial design. 2️⃣ NX Prenatal Inc: Helping advance how we test and detect high-risk pregnancies. This #MaternalHealthAwarenessDay, see how the awardees of the Maternal-fetal Immune Disorders QuickFire Challenge are working to tackle maternal health disparities for women and birthing people.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: “I think that we are addressing such an immense unmet need. That's why I get out of bed every day, and I'm pretty sure it's why my team gets out of bed every day.”—Katie Abouzahr, M.D., Vice President, Autoantibody Portfolio Development Leader, Immunology, The Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson. Innovators at J&J like Abouzahr are committed to helping improve maternal and fetal health outcomes by studying conditions such as hemolytic disease of the fetus and newborn (HDFN), a rare disease that occurs when antibodies produced in a pregnant person’s immune system attacks and destroys their baby’s red blood cells. This #MaternalHealth Awareness Day, learn about the passion these innovators share for their work and the progress J&J is making to help pregnant people and their babies. https://social.jnj.com/3ReJgEF:=:https://www.jnj.com/innovation/about-hemolytic-disease-of-fetus-and-newborn

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: From launching clinical trials to driving groundbreaking research, learn how three Johnson & Johnson hematologists are working to advance treatment options for multiple myeloma patients.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Happy #NationalPharmacistDay! Pharmacists like Dr. Jay P. advocate for patients by working with their doctors to request longer prescriptions or treatment adjustments, as needed and on a case–by–case basis. In turn, these actions enhance medication adherence and can have a substantial impact on health outcomes, such as reducing the risk of stroke, heart attacks and seizures. Johnson & Johnson is grateful today and every day to pharmacists for keeping patients healthy. Join J&J with the National Association of Chain Drug Stores (NACDS), highlighting how pharmacists keep patients healthy. #YouStandByUsAll

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: ✅ Surgical Gauze Packed in Fruit Jars ✅ Medicated Plasters Packed in Cigar Boxes ✅ Art Deco Indigestion Relief Take a look back in time to see the creative ways Johnson & Johnson produced innovative packaging to match its products through the years.

Message: A new season of #FindingYourRoots begins tonight at 8/7c on PBS. Watch Henry Louis Gates, Jr. introduce #JuliaRoberts and Edward Norton to their hidden connection to American History⁠— each other.

Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Johnson & Johnson is tapping into advanced medical technology, like the CUPTIMIZE™ Hip-Spine Analysis from DePuy Synthes Companies, as a digital screening tool within VELYS™ Hip Navigation to help better personalize hip replacement surgeries for patients. Learn how the technology is enabling more accuracy and precision for surgeons who perform these procedures.

Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: As we approach 2023, read these incredible stories from 2022—from a Tuberculosis survivor who now researches the disease, to a physician working to boost clinical trial participation in underserved groups. https://bit.ly/3hK0a0o:=:https://www.jnj.com/personal-stories/meet-7-people-who-inspired-us-in-2022

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: In the 1950s, Johnson & Johnson put a holiday spin on adhesive tape by adding festive decorations to be used for wrapping presents. Read about the history of the vintage gift tape. 🎁 https://social.jnj.com/3G9PUrB:=:https://www.jnj.com/our-heritage/johnson-johnson-gift-tape-business

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Winter can be tough for patients with psoriasis and eczema. For National Healthy Skin Month, watch to learn what causes these conditions and how to find relief during the tough months. https://social.jnj.com/3W3oWHr:=:https://www.jnj.com/health-and-wellness/why-do-eczema-and-psoriasis-flare-up-in-winter

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: When Molly Pratt was diagnosed with Hodgkin's lymphoma at 16, it was the nurses at Beaumont Hospital that stood by her side. The care and compassion Molly received inspired her to pursue a career in the field. Molly is now in remission and graduating with her BSN. As she embarks on her journey as a pediatric oncology nurse, she hopes her story will encourage others as well. Watch this special segment with the Today Show to learn more.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Check out our segment with the Today Show tomorrow in 8AM hour to see how the care and compassion Molly Pratt received from nurses during her cancer battle inspired her to pursue a career in the field. She’ll share how nurses understand patients’ needs better than anyone and are uniquely positioned to change the global trajectory of health for humanity. https://social.jnj.com/3jc8p5S:=:https://nursing.jnj.com/our-commitment

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Eliminating racial health inequities requires investing in solutions that center community voices first. Watch below to learn more from Daymond John and health experts Dr. Uché Blackstock, Barbara Rhoden and Vanessa Broadhurst, Executive Vice President, Global Corporate Affairs, Johnson & Johnson, during a Black Entrepreneurs Day roundtable sponsored by J&J and #OurRaceToHealthEquity on addressing racial health equity.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson

Message: ✅ Identify areas to grow in ✅ Create a plan to achieve those goals As the new year approaches, see what experts suggest when it comes to building out goals and creating a plan that you’ll stick to in 2023.

Message: The holidays can be a challenge when you’re living with Type 2 Diabetes. Explore these strategies and ways to help keep your health in check during the festive season.

Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: In Kenya alone, around 1.5 million people, including children, struggle with vision impairment or blindness. That’s why Sight for Kids, a program co-founded by Johnson & Johnson Vision and Lions Clubs International Foundation, has administered free vision screenings and care to millions of children around the world. Learn how Johnson & Johnson is helping put students on the path to a brighter future.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Pharmacists like Dr. Jay P. are helping to close the racial mortality gap by working to identify and treat diseases that disproportionately impact their patients of color. Our Race to Health Equity wouldn’t be possible without the dedication of providers helping to address racial health disparities. Through the Johnson & Johnson Pharmacy Student Scholarship, we have made a commitment to increase the pipeline of pharmacists from historically marginalized backgrounds to help build healthier communities. #YouStandByUsAll

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: “There has been an explosion of new treatments for IBD (inflammatory bowel disease). The options are increasing at an accelerated pace.”—Tim Hoops, M.D., Global Medical Affairs Leader, Gastroenterology, the Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson. Although no one knows what exactly causes Crohn's disease, researchers at Johnson & Johnson are working to develop treatments that help manage the condition. For Crohn’s and Colitis Awareness Week, meet the experts working to advance our understanding of gastrointestinal diseases.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: NURSES are innovators, lifesavers, and fierce patient advocates. For healthcare to work, it takes nurses. That’s why Johnson & Johnson has proudly championed nurses for 125 years. Learn more. https://social.jnj.com/3VIlWju:=:https://nursing.jnj.com/

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: By fostering a welcoming environment and eliminating barriers, Johnson & Johnson is working to create a workplace that champions each employee’s unique perspective. In recognition of International Day of Persons with Disabilities, explore some of the ways the company is aiming to encourage a more diverse and inclusive setting.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: A long-acting treatment regimen could be potentially game-changing for young people with HIV, according to Kati Vandermeulen, Senior Director and Compound Development Team Leader, Infectious Diseases & Vaccines, Janssen R&D. Through research and advancements in antiretroviral therapy, people living with HIV now have more options for treatment. For #WorldAIDSDay, learn how an innovative regimen is giving young people hope for a healthier future. #MakeHIVHistory

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: As #LungCancerAwarenessMonth comes to an end, leaders across Johnson & Johnson share what motivates them every day to work toward changing the trajectory of this devastating disease. Learn more about our work here: https://social.jnj.com/3EOzt24:=:https://www.jnj.com/oncology

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: At Johnson & Johnson, we are applying 30 years of innovation in oncology to help make a difference for patients with lung cancer. This #LungCancerAwarenessMonth we reinforce our commitment to change the trajectory of this disease: https://bit.ly/3yLVoVg:=:https://www.jnj.com/oncology

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Metastatic bladder cancer is the sixth most common cancer, yet treatment options for it are limited. For National Bladder Health Awareness Month, retrace Johnson & Johnson’s 22-year journey to bring a potentially life-changing treatment to the patients who may benefit most.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: “The antibiotic crisis is increasing, and in some countries we’re now seeing resistance to the ‘last resort’ antibiotics for E. coli.”—Jan Poolman, Ph.D., head of Bacterial Vaccines Discovery and Early Development and Disease Area Stronghold Leader, Bacterial Vaccines at the Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson. From tuberculosis to surgical infections, Johnson & Johnson is innovating to protect today’s crucial antibiotics and to bring forth new tools to fight resistance to come. For World Antimicrobial Awareness Week, take a look at the latest efforts from J&J to combat antibiotic-resistant bacteria.

Message: 870 million children globally are infected with intestinal worms, a common yet preventable infection. To help protect children from this disease, Johnson & Johnson has been working since 2006 to donate doses of a worm-fighting medication to over 50 countries. As we reach a milestone of 2 billion doses donated this #WorldNTDDay, see how our values help create a healthier world. https://bit.ly/35ysf4x:=:https://www.jnj.com/caring-and-giving/how-johnson-johnson-is-helping-kids-with-intestinal-worms

Message: Like many of us, third-grader Robbie has experienced a lot of emotions over the past two years due to the pandemic such as anxiety, stress and anger. To help kids navigate these difficult times, Save the Children transitioned their Journey of Hope program into a virtual experience. Read how Robbie regained his confidence through this online community.

Message: As the world honors the life and legacy of Dr. Martin Luther King Jr., #JNJ recognizes Dr. King’s legacy as an advocate for health equity. In 1966, he stood before the Second National Convention of the Medical Committee for Human Rights in Chicago declaring that “Of all the forms of inequality, injustice in health is the most shocking and inhuman.” His words serve as a reminder about the importance of creating a healthy world where everyone, everywhere has an opportunity to thrive—through the pandemic and beyond: social.jnj.com/3KaTody:=:https://www.jnj.com/our-race-to-health-equity

Mark your calendars for all-new episodes starting Tuesday, Jan 4 at 8/7c on PBS.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: By expanding access to our multidrug-resistant #tuberculosis medication, educating frontline workers and advancing R&D efforts, Johnson & Johnson is working to combat this preventable and treatable disease to help bring us closer to our goal to #EndTB. See how our values help create a healthier world.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Respiratory syncytial virus (#RSV) can lead to serious complications in children and adults, with 177,000 adults aged 65+ in the U.S. hospitalized annually, according to National Foundation for Infectious Diseases. Read about some of the ways you can protect your family this season.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: In 2018, Johnson & Johnson launched the Lung Cancer Initiative by partnering with organizations aiming to advance early detection technology. By providing more effective screening options, the company’s goal is to diagnose the disease at an early stage, before it spreads through the body. Explore the progress that has been made toward a world without #LungCancer.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: One in every five new #HIV infections in sub-Saharan Africa occurs among adolescent girls and young women, despite this group representing just 10% of the population, according to UNAIDS. To help provide women with the power to reduce their HIV risk, International Partnership for Microbicides has developed a new, discreet vaginal ring using a Janssen-developed medicine. Learn more about the novel tool this #WorldAIDSDay, and see how our values help create a healthier world.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Johnson & Johnson is working to leverage our decades of research and experience to help #makeHIVhistory for the nearly 38 million people living with HIV/AIDS globally. This #WorldAIDSDay, discover how J&J has—and continues to—work to eliminate the disease, and see how our values help create a healthier world: social.jnj.com/31fZWFE:=:https://www.jnj.com/innovation/timeline-of-advances-hiv-aids-innovations-through-the-years

Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.

See how our values help create a healthier world: social.jnj.com/3d3IR4E:=:https://www.jnj.com/innovation/medical-drones-deliver-hiv-medicine?utm_source=facebook_feed&utm_medium=organic&utm_campaign=droneswordlaidsday_resurface&utm_content=livingourvaluespillar_equitablefuturepillar_innovatingpillar

It’s these moments that drive Jeff Infante, M.D., Global Head, Early Clinical Development and Translational Research, The Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson, to develop transformational treatments with a goal of eliminating cancer. Watch to see why Jeff is dedicated to helping J&J build a #WorldofWell for everyone, everywhere: social.jnj.com/3HrzYiW:=:https://www.jnj.com/world-of-well/greatest-health-challenges?utm_source=facebook_feed&utm_medium=organic&utm_campaign=jeff15secwhovideo_wow&utm_content=innovatingpillar#cancer-treatments

Today, Desi is channeling her experience into her job, where she designs and develops robotic surgery solutions and digital technology to help make procedures smarter, less invasive and more personalized. Watch to see why Desi is dedicated to helping J&J build a World of Well so patients can experience better outcomes. social.jnj.com/3wwJEnn:=:http://social.jnj.com/3wwJEnn

Message: Nearly one in ten LGBTQIA+ people are unemployed and are more likely to live in poverty than straight and cisgender people, meaning they cannot always afford the healthcare that they need or afford to engage in preventative health care measures, according to the Human Rights Campaign. Don’t miss your opportunity to join the Health Equity Innovation Challenge to help address health inequities like this. Applications close on November 12: social.jnj.com/3n0NIt7:=:https://www.jnj.com/health-equity-innovation-challenge

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.

Read as Patrick reflects on his journey navigating his diagnosis and how it has not deterred him from reaching his goals.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Black and Hispanic New Yorkers are less likely to have health insurance and adequate access to care, and more likely to experience food insecurity, complications with childbirth, chronic health conditions like diabetes and asthma and premature death, according to the New York State Health Foundation. Have an idea to address health inequities in New York City? Apply to the Health Equity Innovation Challenge to make an impact in your community before November 12.

Message: Harnessing the immune system to target cancer. It's the goal of a cutting-edge area of research called #celltherapy, which Johnson & Johnson has spent the past three decades researching in an effort to deliver potential new treatment options to people around the world. See how these innovations can help everyone thrive in a #WorldofWell.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: By 2050, half the world's population will be nearsighted, just like Jaclyn Hernandez, Senior Principal Engineer, Johnson & Johnson Vision Care, and her daughters. Her personal connection to the disease has ignited her passion to fight it, by developing products with a goal to intercept and slow the progression of myopia so patients can see better. Watch to see why Jaclyn is dedicated to helping J&J build a #WorldofWell for everyone, everywhere: https://social.jnj.com/3q0Dk6C

Message: Up to 80% of strokes can be prevented, according to the CDC. Even small lifestyle changes, such as exercising and not smoking, can help reduce your chances of suffering from a stroke. This #WorldStrokeDay, hear from top experts in the field on what you need to know to help safeguard your health.

For National Disability Employment Awareness Month, explore the steps J&J is taking to help create a safe space for everyone.

Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Social injustices have long plagued the health of communities of color across the United States. According to the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services, Black and Hispanic Americans have higher rates and mortality for chronic conditions like diabetes, hepatitis and HIV/AIDS. Community-based innovators—share your potential solutions to help advance health equity: https://social.jnj.com/3vPh0gU:=:https://www.jnj.com/health-equity-innovation-challenge

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Up to 20% of lung cancer patients have never touched a cigarette, according to the American Cancer Society. Since early detection is key, experts at Johnson & Johnson are researching how to identify cancerous cells before they spread through the body. Explore the promising lung cancer treatments and detection technology.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: The pandemic has illuminated the deeply rooted health inequities that communities of color have faced. That’s why the Health Equity Innovation Challenge is aiming to accelerate inclusive healthcare solutions for the community, by the community. Share your ideas here: https://social.jnj.com/2XCa0aG

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: X-Linked Retinitis Pigmentosa (XLRP), a rare genetic disease that can eventually lead to blindness, affects one in 40,000 people worldwide. To help fight this devastating disease, the Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson in collaboration with MeiraGTx, are working on an investigational gene therapy with the potential to improve vision for those with XLRP. Learn more about this revolutionary work and how J&J is leveraging it to help you build a #WorldofWell: https://social.jnj.com/3B2lbHh

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: While "BRCA mutations" are often associated with breast or ovarian cancer, these gene variants also play a very serious role in diseases such as prostate cancer. Meet a researcher from The Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson who is working on targeted therapies that involve blocking cancer cells from repairing their own damaged DNA—and learn why for her, helping build your #WorldofWell is personal.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Johnson & Johnson is proud to be recognized on the Fortune 2021 Change the World List, recognized for our work to help battle the #COVID19 pandemic worldwide. Read more on how J&J is helping create global impact through social responsibility and innovation.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: As the world’s largest healthcare company, Johnson & Johnson is committed to building a future where everyone can thrive in their own #WorldofWell. How are we working to achieve this goal? Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: In Los Angeles, the #COVID19 mortality rate for Hispanic individuals is nearly triple that of white residents, according to the Los Angeles County Department of Public Health. These social injustices have long plagued the health of communities of color across the United States. We’re calling on start-ups, entrepreneurs, innovators and local community-based organizations to help address these long-standing health inequities. Have an idea? Apply today: https://social.jnj.com/3BKyYDq:=:https://www.jnj.com/health-equity-innovation-challenge?utm_source=facebook_feed&utm_medium=organic&utm_campaign=lasocialfactcard_heic&utm_content=equitablefuturepillar

Message: For his research on how the sensations of heat or cold are detected by the body, 2013 Dr. Paul Janssen Award for Biomedical Research recipient David Julius, Ph.D., was awarded the Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine, along with Ardem Patapoutian, Ph.D., for his parallel work on how pressure and touch are perceived by nerve endings. Take a look back at the journey that led Dr. Julius to this prestigious moment: https://social.jnj.com/3aE1FGo:=:https://www.jnj.com/latest-news/johnson-johnson-award-winner-david-julius-ph-d-receives-a-2021-nobel-prize?utm_source=facebook_feed&utm_medium=organic&utm_campaign=nobelprizewinner_new&utm_content=innovatingpillar

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: “Understanding that I have Treatment-Resistant Depression (TRD) has actually been very positive. It’s made me think of my depression as a chronic illness—something I have to try and actively manage. I’ve stopped expecting to find one perfect medical solution or life experience that’s going to heal me.”–Imade Nibokun Borha, author of “Depressed While Black”. Read about Borha's experience living with mental health challenges and her commitment to advocating for herself as well as others.

Johnson & Johnson is proud to join the APhA - American Pharmacists Association in thanking pharmacists for their leadership and dedication. We will continue to support you all on the frontlines. This American #PharmacistsMonth, join us as we celebrate the contributions of pharmacists by sharing your stories about the valuable services pharmacists provide using #YouStandByUsAll. #APhM2021

Add to that her commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion (DE&I), and it’s easy to see why she remains on Fortune’s list of Most Powerful Women in Business,”–Joaquin Duato, Vice Chairman of the Executive Committee, Johnson & Johnson. Recognized for her innovative work and leadership, Johnson & Johnson is proud to congratulate Jennifer Taubert, Executive Vice President and Worldwide Chairman, Pharmaceuticals, Johnson & Johnson, on being named one of Fortune’s Most Powerful Women in Business. Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson

Message: "Receiving this award is a wonderful acknowledgment of the work resulting from my many years of working with Dr. Karikó, but the most important thing is the benefit the work has given to people." —Drew Weissman, M.D., Ph.D, co-recipient of the 2021 Dr. Paul Janssen Award for Biomedical Research. Learn how Dr. Katalin Karikó and Dr. Drew Weissman’s revolutionary work helped change the trajectory of the #COVID19 pandemic, and how it continues to pave the way for future vaccines and therapeutics.

I conquered open heart surgery. I am a fighter.” —Cat Oyler, Vice President, Clinical Transformation, Immunology, Janssen Research and Development, on her recovery after open heart surgery. Johnson & Johnson is launching the Health Equity Innovation Challenge with the ambition of accelerating innovative solutions developed for the community, by the community. Have an idea?
