Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: As part of its #HealthforHumanity goals, Johnson & Johnson is transitioning to using 100% renewable electricity across its facilities over the next five years. This #ClimateWeek, learn about the initiatives, like expanding the use of solar energy, to help reduce the company’s carbon footprint.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: As part of its commitment to advancing equitable access to medicine, Johnson & Johnson recently launched the Kalangala District Medical Drones Project—an innovative program using medical drones to deliver HIV treatments to people in Uganda. This National HIV/AIDS and Aging Awareness Day, discover how this initiative is being used to provide lifesaving HIV drugs to 20 landing sites across five islands, reaching more than 3,700 people in a single day: https://social.jnj.com/3lDI1z7:=:https://www.jnj.com/innovation/medical-drones-deliver-hiv-medicine

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Since the pandemic began, 80% of adults expressed that they intend to be more mindful about regularly practicing self-care, according to The Harris Poll. To help consumers enhance their self-care habits, Johnson & Johnson created the Future of Self Care team to identify upcoming wellness trends. Discover how their findings may impact how you prioritize your health: https://social.jnj.com/3CjuXpr:=:https://www.jnj.com/health-and-wellness/self-care-trends-that-could-change-your-approach-to-health?utm_source=facebook_feed&utm_medium=organic&utm_campaign=selfcare_new&utm_content=livingourvaluespillar_equitablefuturepillar

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: “I imagine that pharmacists and doctors who used our products were grateful for the personal touch offered by our Spanish-speaking salespeople, who could help them better communicate with customers and patients,”—Margaret Gurowitz, Chief Historian, Johnson & Johnson, on the company’s Hispanic salesforce in the early 1900s. From in-language communications to empowering Spanish-speaking doctors, this #HispanicHeritageMonth, read as Gurowitz traces how J&J has embraced and supported Hispanic populations for over a century.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Decades before our “Bridge to Employment” program, which provides young people with career coaching and job shadowing opportunities, Johnson & Johnson launched “A Day in Modern Industry,” designed to give local high school students a chance to shadow J&J staffers throughout the company. This #BackToSchool season, learn more about this trailblazing program and our longstanding legacy of supporting students.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: From supporting employee service members to expanding family care benefits, Johnson & Johnson has built a legacy providing their employees with security and opportunity. In honor of Labor Day, learn more about the initiatives that have made the company a pro-employee trailblazer for more than a century.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: With the rapid adoption of telehealth during the pandemic, how are companies working to help people get personalized care from wherever they are? Through investments in software that allows surgeons to monitor patients remotely to entrepreneurs and companies leveraging telemedicine to help close health equity gaps, read how Johnson & Johnson is investing to help put patients first: https://social.jnj.com/2Yh4M45

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: “I spent so much of my childhood ashamed of my skin and trapped in a cycle of self-loathing. It hasn’t been easy getting to a place of self-love, but I’m there now—and I’m on a mission to help other women get there, too.” When Alicia Bridges realized that she did not have to apologize for having psoriasis, she began a path to help educate and empower others with the autoimmune disease. This #PsoriasisAwarenessMonth, read as Bridges reflects on her journey to help other women learn to love themselves.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Joy Marini, Global Director of Insights, Global Community Impact, Johnson & Johnson, has traveled the world building partnerships to aid women, children and healthcare workers. Though her work frequently takes her overseas, she had the opportunity to give back to her Kentucky hometown—in one of the poorest counties in the Appalachian Mountains. Save the Children US, a J&J partner for more than 25 years, works to ensure that schoolchildren from disadvantaged families not only keep up, but thrive. Read how Marini’s visit to her roots with this organization brought her life of service full circle.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Since our inception where eight of our first 14 employees were women, to today, Johnson & Johnson has been committed to championing women. This #WomensEqualityDay, look back at how the company has worked to do this for more than a century—from providing industry-leading employee benefits to producing life-changing innovations: https://bit.ly/3stLIL0:=:https://www.jnj.com/our-heritage/how-johnson-johnson-has-supported-womens-empowerment-since-1886?utm_source=facebook_feed&utm_medium=organic&utm_campaign=ignitepowerofwomen_resurface&utm_content=equitablefuturepillar

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: “I knew I wanted to get back into the field, but the question was: How?"—Monica Cotton Rozelle, an engineer who paused her career in tech to focus on her family. To help STEM professionals re-enter their field after an extended leave, Johnson & Johnson created Re-Ignite—a program designed to give professionals in science, technology, engineering, math, manufacturing and design (STEM2D) the opportunity to resume their career. Read as Rozelle and three other participants reflect on how their “returnship” rekindled their passion for STEM2D.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Healthcare professionals play a critical role in keeping our communities healthy. As demand for their services rise, these frontline workers need training to build strong health systems. To improve #HealthforHumanity, Johnson & Johnson is committed to supporting at least one million frontline workers by providing resources and growth opportunities by 2030. Learn how the company is working toward this goal.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: “I learned to code, met friends, and learned that—through science—I can change the world.”—Jennifer Magana, a high school student on her experience participating in the Girls Who Code Summer Immersive Program. Johnson & Johnson teamed up with Girls Who Code, an organization on a mission to close the gender gap in tech, to teach high schoolers the basics of coding. Hear from two students as they share what they learned—from developing a mobile application to web design and robotics—and how this experience helped inspire them: https://bit.ly/3m8d6Nj:=:https://www.jnj.com/personal-stories/johnson-johnson-hosts-girls-who-code-for-summer-immersion-program?utm_source=facebook_feed&utm_medium=organic&utm_campaign=girlwhocodesummerimmersionprogram_resurface&utm_content=innovatingpillar

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: “COVID-19 has highlighted how critically important community-based primary health systems are in achieving global health priorities such as health for all,”—Lauren Moore, Vice President, Global Community Impact, Johnson & Johnson, on the company’s initiative to help build better-connected health systems. This #WorldHumanitarianDay, discover how J&J is working to help improve global health—from confronting pandemics and epidemics to strengthening health systems around the world.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: As a new wave of #COVID19 continues to spread worldwide, finding a way to deploy vaccines on a global scale is critical. Dr. Paul Stoffels, Vice Chairman of the Executive Committee and Chief Scientific Officer, Johnson & Johnson, shares how we can unite to reach this goal through cross-sector partnerships, a continued focus on innovation and more: https://bit.ly/3yXXcst:=:https://www.weforum.org/agenda/2021/08/vaccines-win-race-against-covid-19-variants/?utm_source=facebook_feed&utm_medium=organic&utm_campaign=covidpaulstoffelswefarticle_new&utm_content=innovatingpillar The Janssen COVID-19 Vaccine has not been approved or licensed by FDA. https://bit.ly/2NKFjLs:=:https://www.janssenlabels.com/emergency-use-authorization/Janssen+COVID-19+Vaccine-HCP-fact-sheet.pdf

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: To help keep the world healthy, it’s imperative that people who need lifesaving medications most are able to receive them. From a landmark communiqué to ensure that people everywhere have access to potential COVID-19 innovations to our ongoing efforts to help end the tuberculosis epidemic and outbreaks of Ebola, discover how Johnson & Johnson has remained committed to helping make access to medicines around the world more equitable.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: At least 1 billion people globally have a vision impairment due to limited access to eye care, according to the World Health Organization (WHO). Many of these conditions can be prevented or treated. This #NationalEyeExamMonth, learn how Johnson & Johnson Vision’s partnership with the Himalayan Cataract Project is providing cataract screenings and treatments in under-resourced communities. Discover more ways the company is working to help expand eye care across the world.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Today is #HealthAdvocateDay, dedicated to acknowledging and celebrating those who use their voices and collaborative efforts to make a difference for patients. From advocating for policy change to bringing awareness to health inequities, learn how Johnson & Johnson is working to meet the needs of patients, caregivers and healthcare workers.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: “I want to help other parents avoid the situation my wife and I found ourselves in. We could’ve lost our baby because of a lack of equipment. No parent should have to face that.”–Sigi Marmorstein, Neonatal Intensive Care Unit (NICU) nurse, on the inspiration behind her company, BabyLiveAdvice—a digital platform designed to educate and empower parents. August is the month when most babies are born, according to the CDC. To help improve neonatal care, Johnson & Johnson supported two nurses in turning their experiences into innovative tools and resources for parents and newborns to thrive. Discover how their work helps improve neonatal care to keep moms and babies healthy.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: “Thanks to a second opinion, my son didn't lose his vision."—Andrea Boyer, mom to 10-year-old son Christian, who was diagnosed with Marfan Syndrome at 2 months old. This National Eye Exam Month, meet two patients who took action to prioritize their vision as they reflect on their inspiring stories, and the huge impact that a single eye exam can make. #PrioritizeYourEyes

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: This #WorldLungCancerDay, Johnson & Johnson is recognizing the unprecedented advances seen in lung cancer research and optimistically looking ahead to the future. Watch as Avrum Spira, M.D., M.Sc., Global Head of the Lung Cancer Initiative, J&J, talks about the progress the company is making against the world’s leading cause of cancer mortality.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Over one million people receive joint replacement surgery each year. From finding the right specialist to what to expect from post-operation, we asked a certified Family Nurse Practitioner to share what patients need to know when considering, preparing for or recovering from orthopedic surgery.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: For the residents of Uganda’s Kalangala District, getting access to lifesaving HIV medication is challenging. Their remote location makes them part of an estimated 10 million people around the globe who are unable to access the medications they need. As part of its commitment to improving equitable access to medicines, Johnson & Johnson recently launched the Kalangala District Medical Drones Project, which uses drones to deliver essential HIV medications to those in need. Learn more about how the program can help change the way people receive treatment: bit.ly/3eKiNMP:=:https://www.jnj.com/innovation/medical-drones-deliver-hiv-medicine?utm_source=facebook_feed&utm_medium=organic&utm_campaign=dronemedicinedelivery_newstory&utm_content=livingourvaluespillar_equitablefuturepillar_innovatingpillar

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: “At Janssen, we are incredibly proud of this progress in achieving our goal to address some of the biggest health threats of our time. We will continue building on our 25-year commitment to make HIV history and to change the course of the epidemic through our passionate pursuit of innovation, from long-term remission to effective prevention of HIV.”—Paul Stoffels, M.D., Vice Chairman of the Executive Committee, Chief Scientific Officer, Johnson & Johnson, on the company’s HIV advancements. Thanks to modern advancements in medicine, HIV should no longer be considered a death sentence. Read more about our ambitious goals for the future, including expanding global access to HIV treatments by 2025.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: “HIV is becoming a forgotten disease—and that is one of my big worries. If we didn’t have the New Horizons pipeline, Kenyan children could lose hope.”—Dr. James Wagude. Hear more from Dr. Wagude, a physician who has been treating children with HIV in Kenya for 17 years, on how the relaunch of a Johnson & Johnson collaborative program with the ©Elizabeth Glaser Pediatric AIDS Foundation is helping provide access to life-saving medicine for those in need.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: “We want to help encourage everyone to be their personal best.”—Jennifer Bruno, Head, Global Health Services, Johnson & Johnson. This #SocialWellnessMonth, discover nine innovative benefits—such as free mental health resources for employees and their families—designed to help our employees take control of their overall health, including mental, physical and even fiscal well-being.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Did you know that BAND-AID® Brand has been decorating adhesive bandages for more than 60 years? This Independence Day, learn about Stars ‘n Strips—the iconic Johnson & Johnson brand’s first-ever decorated bandages which sparked a trend that’s still going strong today. bit.ly/3xbhiP9:=:https://www.jnj.com/our-heritage/band-aid-designs-from-history-stars-n-strips?utm_source=facebook_feed&utm_medium=organic&utm_campaign=starsnstrips_resurface&utm_content=livingourvaluespillar

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: We are proud to share that our single-shot COVID-19 vaccine generated strong, persistent activity against the rapidly spreading Delta variant and other highly prevalent SARS-CoV-2 viral variants. Building on those results, the data also suggest that humoral and cellular immune responses lasted through at least 8 months, the latest timepoint recorded in the study thus far. https://bit.ly/3qFzazh:=:https://www.jnj.com/positive-new-data-for-johnson-johnson-single-shot-covid-19-vaccine-on-activity-against-delta-variant-and-long-lasting-durability-of-response?utm_source=facebook_feed&utm_medium=organic&utm_campaign=deltavariant_pressrelease&utm_content=innovationpillar The Janssen COVID-19 Vaccine has not been approved or licensed by FDA. Read more: https://bit.ly/2NKFjLs:=:https://www.janssenlabels.com/emergency-use-authorization/Janssen+COVID-19+Vaccine-HCP-fact-sheet.pdf

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: “There is no way to prepare for the moment a doctor looks you straight in the eyes and tells you, ‘You probably have five years to live.’”—Ron Scolamiero, who was diagnosed with Prostate Cancer 18 years ago. This Men’s Health Month, hear more about one man’s story of resilience—and how he’s helping others impacted by the disease.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: “I’m proud that we took AIDS out of the shadows and made it human.”—nurse Cliff Morrison, who opened Ward 5B at San Francisco General Hospital in 1983, the first dedicated AIDS unit in the country. This Pride Month, Morrison reflects on the life-changing initiative to practice compassionate nursing—and how the legacy of Ward 5B lives on.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Johnson & Johnson is proud to be recognized on the new Fortune ROL100—a ranking of the top 100 companies on the 2020 Fortune 500 list by "return on leadership" (ROL). Recognized for our recent achievements in helping change the trajectory of human health, read about the initiatives that helped J&J earn a spot on this distinguished list—and the long-standing beliefs they are rooted in: https://bit.ly/2SDN1JQ:=:https://www.jnj.com/latest-news/johnson-johnson-ranks-on-2021-fortune-rol100-list?utm_source=facebook_feed&utm_medium=organic&utm_campaign=fortunerol100list_new&utm_content=livingourvaluespillar_equitablefuturepillar_frontlinepillar_innovatingpillar

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: “I’m proud of the many ways that Johnson & Johnson is creating an environment where everyone feels they belong,”—Ashley McEvoy, Executive Vice President, Worldwide Chairman, Medical Devices, Johnson & Johnson. This Pride Month, see how J&J stands behind its LGBTQIA+ employees and why a strong culture of diversity and inclusion is crucial to help solve problems in the healthcare system: https://bit.ly/3xkWeVV:=:https://www.jnj.com/caring-and-giving/meet-a-johnson-johnson-leader-whos-an-ally-for-the-lgbtq-community?utm_source=facebook_feed&utm_medium=organic&utm_campaign=everyonedeservestofeelsafestory_resurface

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: “Once we learned about these children and the hardships of their circumstances, our only thought was: ‘How can we not take them in and give them a safe and loving home?’”—Cameron Bernadsky, a Johnson & Johnson Medical Devices Company employee, and father to 11 adopted children. When Bernadsky and his wife decided to adopt internationally, they couldn’t help but open their hearts to special needs children. This Father’s Day, Bernadsky reflects on his journey of becoming a family of 19—and how J&J adoption benefits helped support them along the way.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: With the launch of OURTONE™, different shades of BAND-AID® Brand Adhesive Bandages are now giving people of color more options in the first-aid aisle. From product development to launch, learn about the latest addition to the iconic brand and see how Johnson & Johnson is using OURTONE™ as a platform to support the next generation of Black healthcare providers: https://bit.ly/3wD1Gnb:=:https://www.jnj.com/caring-and-giving/the-story-behind-band-aid-brand-ourtone-adhesive-bandages?utm_source=facebook_feed&utm_medium=organic&utm_campaign=bandaidourtonelaunch_new&utm_content=equitablefuturepillar

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: “There are organizations that say they care about their workers, but Johnson & Johnson didn’t just say it. They proved it."—Clark Musto, Janssen Pharmaceuticals. This Pride Month, Musto shares his journey of transitioning to live as his true self, one made possible, in part, thanks to the support he received through the inclusive policies for J&J LGBTQIA+ employees.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: As part of our just-announced Health for Humanity 2025 Goals, Johnson & Johnson is taking on two critical health challenges—pandemics and epidemics, and health equity—to help advance a healthier world where people and communities can thrive. Hear from leaders across the company to learn how we are working to achieve these objectives: https://bit.ly/2SkldtC:=:https://www.jnj.com/latest-news/johnson-johnson-plans-to-improve-global-health-by-2025?utm_source=facebook_feed&utm_medium=organic&utm_campaign=healthforhumanity2020_5waysstory&utm_content=valuespillar

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Taking on even the most daunting healthcare challenges has been at the core of who we are for over 135 years—and this past year was no different. In our 2020 #HealthforHumanity Report, discover how the power of our people, expertise and global partnerships helped us make great strides toward a healthier world.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: “Diversity and inclusion is at the heart of our culture and policies that enable all our people to feel valued and heard.” —Kristen Mulholland, Head of Human Resources, Global Total Reward, Johnson & Johnson, on the importance of diversity and inclusion in the workforce. From the Open&Out employee resource group to partnerships with nonprofits such as the Human Rights Campaign, discover the innovative ways J&J is working to remain a strong ally to the LGBTQIA+ community during Pride Month—and beyond: https://bit.ly/2TCRMU7:=:https://www.jnj.com/caring-and-giving/ways-johnson-johnson-supports-lgbtq-community

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Through advocacy, education and sustainable innovation, Johnson & Johnson Vision is determined to help expand eye care across the globe. See the progress the company has made toward this goal in their 2020 Vision for Good Impact Report: https://bit.ly/3fLaRMk:=:https://www.jnj.com/caring-and-giving/ways-johnson-johnson-vision-improves-global-eye-care

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: “Knowing you’re paying it forward gives meaning to what you do. The best way I could see to do that was to be involved in projects that could benefit patients.”—Brad Heidrich, Senior Scientist at the Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson, who was diagnosed with a rare bone cancer at age 13. For National Cancer Survivors Day, learn more about Heidrich’s incredible story and how his diagnosis inspired the person he would eventually become—a Janssen scientist dedicated to working on therapies for blood cancer.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Forty years ago, a mysterious disease emerged in California and New York—one that would soon become one of the most pressing health challenges of our time. In honor of the 40th anniversary of what would become the first AIDS diagnosis, take a look back at the decades-long work Johnson & Johnson has pioneered to aid in giving the world more hope in the face of HIV/AIDS: https://bit.ly/3uE2573:=:https://www.jnj.com/innovation/timeline-of-advances-hiv-aids-innovations-through-the-years

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Happy Pride Month! For more than 25 years, Johnson & Johnson has been a leader in supporting the LGBTQIA+ community through employee policies, business practice and public advocacy. Read how J&J works each day toward inclusivity and equality: https://bit.ly/3uFLnnT:=:https://www.jnj.com/tag/lgbt

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Twenty-one. That’s how old Lisa Deck was when she suffered her first stroke—and it wouldn't be her last. Fast forward to the age of forty—Deck has now survived four strokes, two brain surgeries and has been diagnosed with the rare moyamoya disease. This National Stroke Awareness Month, discover how Deck’s journey motivated her to become an advocate for other stroke survivors—and helped inspire Johnson & Johnson programs such as HealtheVoices, an annual conference aiming to educate and empower online patient advocates.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: “I actually found myself having debilitating panic attacks throughout most of 2020."—Nurse Charlene Grace Platon, former Johnson & Johnson Innovation Fellow, on the toll the pandemic has taken on her mental health while working on the front lines. This Nurses Month, Platon shares how she leveraged her personal experience to create a unique app designed to help reduce work-related stress and burnout.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: What do expectant parents need to know about hemolytic disease of the fetus and newborn (HDFN), a rare and potentially fatal condition that occurs in 3 to 80 of every 100,000 pregnancies? Learn more about the condition and how Johnson & Johnson is investigating a promising treatment option to help provide better outcomes for these children.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Nurses are a crucial part of caregiving and have played a vital role behind the scenes at Johnson & Johnson since its founding in 1886. As Nurses Month continues, meet some of the most heroic caregivers throughout history—including nursing crusaders who worked at J&J: https://bit.ly/3bA8b1x:=:https://www.jnj.com/our-heritage/7-superheroes-of-nursing-throughout-history

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: The quest for a new non-small cell lung cancer treatment began nearly 10 years ago when scientists from the Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson identified a novel approach to help improve patients’ quality of life. As the drug receives U.S. Food and Drug Administration approval, the team reflects on their journey.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: For millions of Americans who live with psoriatic arthritis (PsA), an incurable autoimmune disease, even the most basic daily activities can be challenging. This Arthritis Awareness Month, the “father” in his field of study, Daniel Cua, Ph.D., Vice President, Immunology, Pathway Biology Lead, Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson, shares what his work could mean for those with active PsA.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Animals play a critical role in our everyday lives. Unfortunately, many of them are increasingly at risk. The WWF reports that there’s been a 60% decline in wildlife populations in the last forty years. This #WorldBeeDay, discover five unique ways Johnson & Johnson is helping protect imperiled species around the world: https://bit.ly/3v8aD7u:=:https://www.jnj.com/caring-and-giving/unique-johnson-johnson-wildlife-conservation-programs

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Skin cancer is one situation where youth is not on your side: Just one sunburn as a child can double your risk of developing melanoma later in life. For Skin Cancer Awareness Month, Neutrogena’s new documentary “In the Sun” is sharing powerful stories to educate about the science behind skin health and inspire people to action.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: “When it comes to the healthcare system, it’s those frontline healthcare workers that really do make all the difference.”—Michael Sneed, Executive Vice President, Global Corporate Affairs and Chief Communications Officer, Johnson & Johnson. During Nurses Month, watch as Sneed speaks with Lisa Ling on the significant role those frontline workers, especially nurses and midwives, can play to help eliminate inequity and injustice in the healthcare system.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Seven years ago, Johnson & Johnson mobilized resources to respond to the deadliest Ebola outbreak ever—and our dedication to fighting the disease hasn’t stopped there. J&J is providing up to 200,000 courses of our vaccine to a World Health Organization (WHO) early access clinical program to address the recent outbreak in West Africa, and is excited to announce our vaccine regimen has been granted Prequalification status from the WHO. Learn more about these milestones and how they are marking progress in our decades long commitment to outsmarting pandemics and delivering for communities worldwide: https://bit.ly/3eIIEFt:=:https://www.jnj.com/latest-news/latest-facts-about-johnson-johnson-ebola-vaccine

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Throughout the pandemic, nurses have worked around the clock and taken on significant personal risks to fight COVID-19. From mental health and resilience programs to educational tools, see how Johnson & Johnson is working to back the frontline and champion nurses to support the incredible work they do: https://bit.ly/3w2n6cV:=:https://www.jnj.com/caring-and-giving/how-johnson-johnson-supports-nurse-innovators

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Approximately 21 million Americans don’t think much about eye health until there’s a problem, according to the CDC. This Healthy Vision Month, Johnson & Johnson Vision experts share their top advice—from how often you should see your eye doctor to what to look for in online contact lenses—to help better protect your eyes.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: During the Spanish influenza outbreak of 1918, Johnson & Johnson employee Katherine Hannan went out of her way to put her nursing skills to use on the front lines. For National Nurses Week, discover how Hannan's legacy of stepping up when it's needed most lives on today.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: "I was 20 years old and didn't understand what depression was."—Imade Nibokun Borha, mental health advocate and founder of “Depressed While Black.” This Mental Health Awareness Month, Imade shares the raw truth about living with treatment-resistant depression—and the surprising silver lining she’s found through her diagnosis.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Johnson & Johnson is proud to be recognized in Fast Company’s 2021 World Changing Ideas for our Center for Health Worker Innovation, which is helping ensure that the global health workforce emerges from this crisis better equipped and supported than ever before. Together with our partners, see how we're helping back the frontline: https://bit.ly/3ekexEl:=:https://chwi.jnj.com/

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Johnson & Johnson is proud to be named to the inaugural TIME 100 Most Influential Companies list. Recognized for our innovation and success in helping shape the trajectory of healthcare, learn more about the global impact of our work. #TIME100Companies

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: JUST IN: Johnson & Johnson has announced that vaccinations with its COVID-19 single-shot vaccine will resume for all adults aged 18 years and older in the United States, under Emergency Use Authorization, following a decision from the CDC and the U.S. Food and Drug Administration. Learn more: https://bit.ly/3sQJpjA:=:https://www.jnj.com/johnson-johnson-single-shot-covid-19-vaccinations-to-resume-in-the-u-s-for-all-adults-aged-18-and-older-following-cdc-and-fda-decision

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: How is Johnson & Johnson Consumer Health investing to help improve the health of people and the planet? This Earth Day, discover the ways eight of our iconic consumer brands have committed to making their products more sustainable by 2030: https://bit.ly/3vblT2h:=:https://www.jnj.com/latest-news/johnson-johnson-commits-800-million-to-making-more-sustainable-products

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: "I'm a Johns Hopkins-trained epidemiologist, and I couldn't even navigate the system."— Michigan State University epidemiologist Debra Furr-Holden, Ph.D., on her personal experience with racial discrepancies during COVID-19. This World Health Day, hear more about the challenges communities of color are facing and learn how Johnson & Johnson is urgently working to help address inequities through inclusive innovation, community-specific outreach and more: https://bit.ly/3rQf8B6:=:https://www.jnj.com/caring-and-giving/how-covid-19-is-bringing-racial-disparities-in-healthcare-to-light

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Johnson & Johnson announced it has begun vaccinating adolescent participants in the ongoing Phase 2a clinical trial for its investigational COVID-19 vaccine candidate. Read more: bit.ly/39zswmG:=:https://www.jnj.com/johnson-johnson-expands-phase-2a-clinical-trial-of-covid-19-vaccine-candidate-to-include-adolescents

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: “I'm so impressed by the recovery efforts and what healthcare professionals have been doing to help both people affected by COVID-19 and other patients.”—Ashley McEvoy, Executive Vice President, Worldwide Chairman, Johnson & Johnson Medical Devices Companies. As Women's History Month comes to a close, McEvoy reflects on leading a 70,000+–strong workforce while navigating a global pandemic.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: “I had to do my part as a doctor. I thought to myself: If the frontline isn’t safe, then nowhere is safe, so I must go.” — Dr. Dongchen Zhou, a doctor who traveled to Wuhan at the start of the pandemic to serve on the front line. This National Doctors’ Day, Dr. Zhou reflects on his journey—from answering the call to volunteer to treating patients.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: We’re proud to partner with IFPMA and share stories of the real people behind the development of #COVID19 vaccines. Watch as Abeda Williams, Senior Director, Medical Affairs at Johnson & Johnson, shares her story.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: The world doesn’t just need #COVID19 vaccines. We need people around the world to feel confident in getting them when it’s their turn. We’re proud to support #TeamVaccines and share stories of real people behind the vaccines, and why their work matters.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Vaccination is one of the most effective tools we have in the fight against #COVID19. That’s why Johnson & Johnson is partnering with the IFPMA on #TeamVaccines to support vaccine education. Learn more: teamvaccines.ifpma.org

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: In 1908, Johnson & Johnson made a new hire that forever changed the trajectory of the company. This Women's History Month, meet Edith Von Kuster, the company's first female scientist. Discover more on her pioneering role and how it has impacted J&J over a century later.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Did you know that tuberculosis (TB) kills more people each year than HIV/AIDS and malaria combined? This World TB Day, take a look back and learn about the innovations coming out of Johnson & Johnson to help combat this preventable and treatable disease, bringing us closer to our goal to end TB.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Despite being preventable and curable, tuberculosis (TB) is one of the world’s deadliest infectious diseases—and COVID-19 is making it even harder to diagnose and treat it. This World TB Day, discover the creative solutions of the healthcare visionaries from Johnson & Johnson Innovation’s DR-TB Lifeline QuickFire Challenge who have made it their mission to help end TB in the time of COVID-19.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: What causes autoimmune diseases in kids and how are scientists working to develop crucial treatment options? Two experts share what strides in research have been made this Autoimmune Disease Awareness Month.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Meet Dr. Veronica Garcia-Hansen, senior lecturer in architecture at the Queensland University of Technology and recipient of the 2020 Johnson & Johnson Women in STEM2D Scholars Award for Design. Discover how she literally saw the light through her research on hospital lighting design and its effects on patient health outcomes and overall energy efficiencies within hospitals. This Women’s History Month, read about more women in STEM like Garcia-Hansen and learn about our WiSTEM2D program here: https://www.jnj.com/wistem2d

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: “Thanks to the resilience, dedication, and resourcefulness of my colleagues all around the world, Johnson & Johnson didn’t just survive 2020 —our company pivoted with great agility.” — Alex Gorsky, Chairman and Chief Executive Officer, Johnson & Johnson. From a $100 million commitment to help advance health equity to our efforts in the fight against COVID-19, take a look back as Gorsky reflects on our work from this past year—and see what he envisions for the future.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Johnson & Johnson announces that the World Health Organization has issued Emergency Use Listing for its single-shot COVID-19 vaccine developed by Janssen, marking an important step forward to ensuring global access. Read more: https://bit.ly/3ckfzhe:=:https://www.jnj.com/johnson-johnson-single-shot-covid-19-vaccine-granted-emergency-use-listing-by-the-world-health-organization

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Colorectal Cancer is the third most common cancer in both men and women, according to the American Cancer Society. This National Colorectal Cancer Awareness Month, read as experts share the latest on who’s most at risk and how to help prevent the disease.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: “We try to use what has been achieved in Wuhan to inspire the rest of the world. With strong effort, discipline and team spirit, anything can be accomplished.” — Will Song, Chairman of Johnson & Johnson China and President of Johnson & Johnson Medical China. One year to the day when the World Health Organization (WHO) declared COVID-19 a global pandemic, Song reflects on how his team persevered since the city of Wuhan first shut down—and shares more on the innovative ideas that emerged from this health crisis.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Shortly after receiving a CHMP Positive Opinion, Johnson & Johnson announced today that the European Commission has granted a Conditional Marketing Authorization for our single-dose COVID-19 vaccine, to prevent COVID-19 in individuals 18 years of age and older. https://bit.ly/2OHePuy:=:https://www.jnj.com/johnson-johnson-single-shot-covid-19-vaccine-granted-conditional-marketing-authorization-by-european-commission

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: “This pandemic is something we have to combat all together.” — Dr. Paul Stoffels, Vice Chairman of the Executive Committee and Chief Scientific Officer, Johnson & Johnson. Johnson & Johnson is honored to collaborate with Merck and the Biden Administration to ramp up production and manufacturing of the Johnson & Johnson COVID-19 Vaccine. Vaccine is authorized for emergency use and not approved or licensed by the U.S. FDA. Read more: https://bit.ly/2NKFjLs:=:https://www.janssenlabels.com/emergency-use-authorization/Janssen+COVID-19+Vaccine-HCP-fact-sheet.pdf

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: “Our industry realized in the early days of the pandemic that vaccine development wasn’t a race against each other as competitors —it was a race against time to defeat a common enemy.” — Alex Gorsky, Chairman and Chief Executive Officer, Johnson & Johnson. As J&J joins Merck at The White House where President Biden announced that the United States will purchase an additional 100 million doses of the Johnson & Johnson COVID-19 Vaccine, learn more about the many strides the company has made since last March. Vaccine is authorized for emergency use & not approved or licensed by the U.S. FDA. https://bit.ly/2NKFjLs:=:https://www.janssenlabels.com/emergency-use-authorization/Janssen+COVID-19+Vaccine-HCP-fact-sheet.pdf

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: From chemists and product researchers to lab supervisors, this International Women’s Day discover more about three pioneering women and their modern day counterparts, who are not only innovating at Johnson & Johnson, but helping pave the way for the next generation of powerhouse women.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Scientist. Cook. Fantasy Literature Fan. All words that describe Ninkka Tamot, Scientist, Antibody Engineering, Janssen R&D. This International Women’s Day, take a look "Behind the Lab Coat" and learn more about one of our empowered scientists, Ninkka — from her love of momos (a Nepalese dumpling) to what it means to her to be a woman in STEM.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Imagine having a disease that many doctors have never seen before. This Amyloidosis Awareness Month, uncover more on what experts now know —and how new advancements in healthcare have the potential to help diagnose and treat this rare disease.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: As the U.S. government announces an agreement between Johnson & Johnson and Merck to collaborate on vaccine production, we trace the steps it takes to develop and manufacture a vaccine during a pandemic.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: “I would like to thank all of our collaborators around the world who did such a tremendous job.” — Dr. Paul Stoffels, Vice Chairman of the Executive Committee and Chief Scientific Officer, Johnson & Johnson. From the principal investigators, physicians, nurses and more who worked on the data submission to the volunteers who participated to help reach this milestone, we would like to thank our entire J&J community for their collaboration and continued efforts.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: The first shipment of our single-dose #COVID19 vaccine has officially left the warehouse. Achieving this milestone took lots of hard work, dedication, and sacrifice from the many involved in advancing our COVID-19 vaccine — and since the beginning of the pandemic, our team and participants have exhibited just that. This is a significant moment, as we are one step closer in the fight to end the COVID-19 pandemic. The Janssen COVID-19 Vaccine has not been approved or licensed by FDA. Read more: https://bit.ly/2NKFjLs:=:https://www.janssenlabels.com/emergency-use-authorization/Janssen+COVID-19+Vaccine-HCP-fact-sheet.pdf

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Did you know that 9 worldwide manufacturing sites are activating to produce our single-dose COVID-19 vaccine? Learn more about our vaccine including how it works, how it was studied and manufacturing & distribution. https://bit.ly/2NLjtHy:=:https://www.jnj.com/latest-news/things-to-know-about-johnson-johnson-janssen-covid-19-vaccine

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Johnson & Johnson announced that the CDC Advisory Committee recommends our single-dose COVID-19 vaccine for individuals age 18 and older, under the Emergency Use Authorization issued by the U.S. FDA. Read more: https://bit.ly/3r8ovfO:=:https://www.jnj.com/johnson-johnson-announces-u-s-cdc-advisory-committee-recommends-first-single-shot-covid-19-vaccine-for-adults-18-and-older-in-u-s The Janssen COVID-19 Vaccine has not been approved or licensed by FDA: https://bit.ly/2NKFjLs:=:https://www.janssenlabels.com/emergency-use-authorization/Janssen+COVID-19+Vaccine-HCP-fact-sheet.pdf

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Johnson & Johnson announced that the U.S. Food and Drug Administration has issued Emergency Use Authorization for our single-dose COVID-19 vaccine. Read more: https://bit.ly/3q3ldJr:=:https://www.jnj.com/media-center/press-releases/johnson-johnson-covid-19-vaccine-authorized-by-u-s-fda-for-emergency-usefirst-single-shot-vaccine-in-fight-against-global-pandemic The Janssen COVID-19 Vaccine has not been approved or licensed by FDA: https://bit.ly/2NKFjLs:=:https://www.janssenlabels.com/emergency-use-authorization/Janssen+COVID-19+Vaccine-HCP-fact-sheet.pdf

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Black people are far more likely to live with cardiovascular diseases than other U.S. populations. This American Heart Month, uncover three eye-opening heart disease statistics and see how Johnson & Johnson is helping address them with improved education, diagnosis and treatment.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: “We need to go where these people are and help support them.” — Lauren Moore, Vice President, Global Community Impact, Johnson & Johnson. One of the most harrowing aspects of the COVID-19 outbreak has been the toll it has taken on communities of color. Discover how J&J is helping address these disparities through a mobile vans initiative aimed at providing COVID-19 testing and other crucial health services to underserved communities across the country.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Did you know that simple things like physical activity, ice cream and hormonal changes can all trigger an atrial fibrillation (AFib) episode? This American Heart Month, take our quiz to discover more about the condition that affects approximately 33 million people across the globe.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: In 2017 over 1.6 million people were diagnosed with cancer, according to American Cancer Society. This Cancer Prevention Month, hear from two leading experts as they share common misconceptions about the disease—and what the latest science says about cancer prevention truths.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Ever felt like you couldn’t find makeup and skincare solutions meant for you? See how one Neutrogena® employee turned this all-too-common experience into the Black Innovators in Skin Health QuickFire Challenge, a unique initiative designed to find innovations that could create more inclusive skincare for people of color.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Johnson & Johnson is proud to sponsor the PBS documentary “The Black Church: This Is Our Story, This Is Our Song,” airing tonight, February 16, at 9/8c. Tune in as Henry Louis Gates, Jr. acclaimed Harvard University Professor for African and African American Research, examines the deep history of the Black church and culture of African American faith Communities. http://to.pbs.org/3tOYy6y:=:https://www.pbs.org/show/black-church/

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: The first HealtheVoices for HCPs session of 2021 featured a live discussion with HCP expert, Wendy Sue Swanson, MD, MBE, FAAP, on using social media and digital innovation to help better serve and connect with patients. Watch this event or any of the previous sessions on-demand at healthevoices.com/hcp:=:http://healthevoices.com/hcp.html.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Scientist. Adventurer. Mother. These are three words that describe Sabrina Henry, Principal Scientist, Skin Health, Aveeno®, and one of the many dedicated scientists who work at Johnson & Johnson across the globe. On the International Day of Women and Girls in Science, take a look "Behind the Lab Coat" and learn more about Sabrina—from the skincare product she can’t live without to why she wants young scientists to dream big.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: From a virtual reality game that helps children with remote physical therapy to a clever way to upgrade personal protective equipment for healthcare workers, discover the winning ideas from the Johnson & Johnson Nurses Innovate QuickFire Challenge that came out of medical conundrums posed by the pandemic.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: "Receiving a vaccine was an incredibly emotional experience for me." — Dr. Uché Blackstock. Hear more as Dr. Blackstock speaks to “The Road to a Vaccine” host Lisa Ling about her experience, why she feels vaccination is important and how she hopes to be a role model for her patients and peers.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Johnson & Johnson announced that Janssen has submitted an application to the U.S. Food and Drug Administration requesting Emergency Use Authorization for its investigational single-dose COVID-19 vaccine candidate. Read more: http://bit.ly/2N016Oj:=:https://www.jnj.com/johnson-johnson-announces-submission-of-application-to-the-u-s-fda-for-emergency-use-authorization-of-its-investigational-single-shot-janssen-covid-19-vaccine-candidate

Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: With season 3 of “The Road to a Vaccine” underway, we want to hear from you. Have a question for our host Lisa Ling or one of our expert guests? Share here and we may answer it LIVE!

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: In recognition of World Cancer Day, we are spotlighting employees from across our company who are committed to helping change the trajectory of cancer. Watch and see how their work at Johnson & Johnson inspires them each day.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Nominations for the 2021 Dr. Paul Janssen Awards are live through February 28. To honor Dr. Janssen’s continued legacy, we’re searching for “What’s New” in biomedical research. If you know a scientist who has made a significant, transformational contribution, nominate them here: http://bit.ly/39eF2Zc:=:http://www.pauljanssenaward.com/nominations/open

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: LIVE IN 1 HOUR: On "The Road to a Vaccine," Dr. Paul Stoffels, Vice Chairman of the Executive Committee & Chief Scientific Officer, Johnson & Johnson, Dr. Uché Blackstock & Harvard Medical School's Dr. Dan Barouch join host Lisa Ling to discuss where we are in the fight against COVID-19 and what’s next for vaccine development, here on Facebook.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Looking forward to season 3 of “The Road to a Vaccine” when it returns LIVE tomorrow at 12 PM ET? Catch up on the latest from host Lisa Ling and expert guests as they answer your most pressing COVID-19 questions in these key moments from seasons 1 and 2: http://bit.ly/3ce4Lmn:=:https://www.facebook.com/watch/jnj/278693723151270/

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: From our work on an investigational COVID-19 vaccine to a $100 million commitment to help advance health equity solutions for people of color in the United States, discover the innovative achievements that helped us place in the top 20 on Fortune's prestigious Most Admired Companies list.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Interested in learning more about our investigational single-dose COVID-19 vaccine candidate? Watch here.

Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Alex Gorsky, Chairman & CEO, Johnson & Johnson, reflects on our commitment from the start, to provide solutions during times of crisis, as the Company shares topline data from our Phase 3 COVID-19 ENSEMBLE clinical trial: http://bit.ly/3r2I5JT

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: JUST IN: Johnson & Johnson announces topline interim data analysis from our Phase 3 ENSEMBLE clinical trial for our investigational single-dose COVID-19 vaccine candidate: http://bit.ly/3ck3LwX

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: The scientific community’s progress toward a COVID-19 vaccine since the start of the pandemic has been inspiring, but the road is not over yet. Join host Lisa Ling on “The Road to a Vaccine” as the groundbreaking series that over 135 million worldwide watched returns LIVE on Tuesday, February 2 at 12 PM ET, here on Facebook.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Johnson & Johnson is proud to once again rank among the top 3 companies working to expand access to medicine in low- and middle-income countries (LIMCs) globally, according to the Access to Medicine Foundation. Learn how J&J is drawing from its 130+ years of experience to deliver equitable access and strengthen health systems: http://bit.ly/3qUfXbM:=:https://www.jnj.com/latest-news/how-johnson-johnson-helps-improve-global-access-to-medicines

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Did you know that independent experts analyze the safety and efficacy data of clinical trials and provide unbiased evaluations based on their findings? Learn more COVID-19 Vaccine Facts from our partner Biotechnology Innovation Organization - BIO: https://www.covidvaccinefacts.org/

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: How, and where, is COVID-19 spreading? Who is most at risk of serious complications? When will it be safe to go back to work? Hear from Johnson & Johnson scientists as they share the ways the Company is leveraging data science—such as using data to forecast COVID-19 hotspots—to help answer these questions and inform solutions: http://bit.ly/39NXk2y:=:https://www.jnj.com/innovation/how-johnson-johnson-uses-data-science-to-fight-covid-19-pandemic

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: “I don’t mind being in jail, as long as I know one day, when I have children of my own, they will have privilege and can do the things we are fighting so hard for today.” —Tillie Bing Bryant, mother of Wanda Hope, Chief Diversity & Inclusion Officer, Johnson & Johnson, who was one of the brave college students arrested during a lunch counter sit-in in 1961 in Sumter, South Carolina. During her time in jail, Mrs. Bryant detailed her fight for equality and freedom on a roll of toilet paper—which she passed on to her daughter. This Martin Luther King Jr. Day, read about Ms. Bryant’s brave actions and how they inspire her daughter and her work everyday at J&J.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: From leveraging data science to harnessing tools like telemedicine to advance digital healthcare solutions, hear from Chris Picariello, President, Johnson & Johnson Innovation – JJDC, Inc., at the J.P. Morgan Healthcare Conference, as he shares 4 key ways J&J Innovation helped accelerate innovation last year—and future plans to further deliver on these investments in 2021 and beyond.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: A potential COVID-19 vaccine, passionate efforts toward helping combat racial and social injustice and smarter, more sustainable product packaging are just a few of the healthcare and health equity advancements Johnson & Johnson leaders hope to make this year. Hear from these leaders as they share their 2021 healthcare resolutions—and how they and their teams hope to bring them to fruition: https://bit.ly/38JW0hJ:=:https://www.jnj.com/innovation/johnson-johnson-leaders-on-advancing-healthcare-in-2021

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: What is an adenovirus vaccine and how does it work? As Johnson & Johnson announces full enrollment in our ENSEMBLE 1 study, Dr. Mathai Mammen, Global Head of Janssen Research & Development, answers this important question and more in this in-depth Q&A.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: One thing this year’s winners of Johnson & Johnson’s WiSTEM2D Scholars Award Program have in common? They won’t let anything—even a pandemic—stop their resolve to help progress science and healthcare. Meet five of this year’s winners and learn about the areas of work they are focused on including a foldable, 3-D printed robot that can serve as a heart stent and research on the formation of—and the possibility of life on—other planets.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Cold temps and dry air can wreak havoc on already stressed skin, especially for those with inflammatory skin diseases. As winter sets in, learn how to manage conditions like psoriasis and eczema from Dr. Lloyd S. Miller, Vice President, Immunodermatology, Janssen Research & Development, as he advises how to keep both in check this season.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: “Each one of us has a role in preventing the spread of the virus. Doing so not only protects yourself and your loved ones, but also crucially takes into account the most at-risk individuals and communities who are disproportionately impacted by COVID-19.” — Sean Penn, co-founder of CORE and Academy Award-winning actor, on the need for communities to unite and step up in the fight against COVID-19. As “The Road to a Vaccine” guests Penn and his co-founder Ann Lee reflect on their work over the past nine months, discover what they see as the biggest obstacles to managing the pandemic in the U.S.—and how their organization pivoted to help the fight.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: “Now that I know better, I’m able to do better—and I’m so grateful for that.” — Vusumuzi Christopher Mnqayi, a South African-based healthcare worker who through the Masked Heroes program, received training and tools to help take care of himself while engaging with people in crisis. This month, Johnson & Johnson announced fulfillment of its $50 million commitment to help support healthcare workers worldwide battling COVID-19 through funding of organizations like the Masked Heroes campaign. Read more about Mnqayi’s journey and how this critical support helped change his life.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Johnson & Johnson is honored to be included in the 2020 Drucker Institute Company Ranking, featured as a top 10 company and the highest-ranked healthcare company. The Drucker Institute, Claremont Graduate University evaluates varying touchstones of corporate performance, including innovation, employee engagement and social responsibility. We are proud of everyone who has contributed to these efforts at Johnson & Johnson. https://bit.ly/2Jbu78f:=:https://www.drucker.institute/2020-drucker-institute-company-ranking/

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: What is it like to participate in a clinical trial? As COVID-19 and the clinical studies for investigational vaccines continue to make the news, three people across the country share their experience enrolling in a research study and reflect on how it feels to be on the cutting edge of medicine.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: For patients undergoing chemotherapy, dry skin can be a lesser-known side effect. To help address this, Johnson & Johnson scientists teamed up with oncodermatology experts to create a new science-backed line of cleansers, moisturizers and balms from Aveeno® designed with cancer patients in mind. Learn more about the Restorative Skin Therapy line and hear from project leads on what they learned from the multi-year endeavor: http://bit.ly/3gW1atw:=:https://www.jnj.com/innovation/latest-science-behind-chemotherapy-skin-care

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Despite being a preventable and treatable disease, tuberculosis (TB) killed over 1.4 million people in 2019. See how Johnson & Johnson is working to reduce this startling statistic and help bring us closer to a TB-free world by stepping up our R&D efforts, educating frontline healthcare workers and the public and expanding access to our multi-drug resistant TB medicine.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: As the World Health Organization (WHO)'s Year of the Nurse and Midwife comes to a close, Jennifer Taubert, Executive Vice President, Worldwide Chairman, Pharmaceuticals, Johnson & Johnson, reflects on our long legacy of supporting nurses—and how COVID-19 has strengthened our commitment to give back to these essential healthcare workers.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: From a $50 million commitment to support front line healthcare workers battling the pandemic to our investigational Janssen COVID-19 vaccine work, Johnson & Johnson was recognized for our efforts to help protect people and vulnerable communities globally in 2020. Learn more about these achievements and the recognition received from companies like Fast Company and Fortune: https://bit.ly/2IBz8XA:=:https://www.jnj.com/latest-news/johnson-johnson-recognitions-for-covid-19-in-2020

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Take a look back at the scientists and thought leaders from seasons 1 and 2 of “The Road to a Vaccine” who helped host Lisa Ling shine a light on science at a time when we need it most. What topics are you most interested in learning about in season 3? Share your questions below and our expert guests may answer them LIVE when “The Road to a Vaccine” returns.

Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: As 2020 comes to a close, join us for this year’s final session of HealtheVoicesHCP featuring top HCP experts, Dr. Esther Choo and Dr. Uché Blackstock, to discuss how to be an activist while promoting health equities through social media. Register today: https://bit.ly/HeVforHCPsRegister:=:https://primetime.bluejeans.com/a2m/register/gqgfjbcq

Message: A safe COVID-19 vaccine is needed for all generations. Hear from Debbie Allen on the importance of clinical trial participation among people ages 60 and older—and learn more about diversity in vaccine research. https://bit.ly/33Yzb7n:=:https://www.researchincludesme.com/

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Johnson & Johnson is aspiring to help eradicate racial and social injustice as a public health threat by eliminating health inequities for communities of color in the U.S. Hear from Henry Louis Gates, Jr. and others why now is such a critical time for J&J to start Our Race to Health Equity and the steps we are taking to reach this goal.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: In a year of unprecedented challenges, nurses have continued to inspire and innovate in-real time to help develop solutions for COVID-19. Watch to see how as over 400 nurses, computer scientists, engineers and other innovators united to collaborate to reach this goal at NurseHack4Health, proudly hosted by Johnson & Johnson and others.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: The pandemic has significantly impacted communities around the world, with Black Americans facing a disproportionate impact. Johnson & Johnson is proud to partner with Ice-T to help educate people about the importance of diversity in clinical trials underway for investigational COVID-19 vaccines. It is essential that diverse populations are represented in these studies to help ensure safe and effective vaccines. https://bit.ly/36X0fWs:=:https://www.ensemblestudy.com/

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Hear from Dr. Uché Blackstock as she shares the importance of diversity in clinical trials to help achieve health equity and ensure a COVID-19 vaccine is safe and effective for diverse populations. https://bit.ly/36X0fWs:=:https://www.ensemblestudy.com/

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Transparency and access to information are key to helping build public trust during a pandemic, according to former Vice President of Taiwan, Dr. Chen Chien-Jen. Learn more as he reflects on his time helping lead Taiwan through COVID-19 with host Lisa Ling in this clip from “The Road to a Vaccine.”

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Co-founder of CORE and Academy Award-winning actor, Sean Penn, joins “The Road to a Vaccine” to share how his disaster response organization was able to provide additional resources and support to local governments to help increase COVID-19 testing in California, and around the country. Watch to hear more.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: What if you could live without illness as you age? It’s a bold goal that inspired Johnson & Johnson and the National Academy of Medicine's U.S. Healthy Longevity Catalyst Awards, which just announced their first set of awardees. Meet these innovative researchers as they share how their big ideas—such as detecting brain aging through a simple eye exam—could help revolutionize the field of healthy longevity.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: In the 1980s when many viewed patients with AIDS with fear, a group of courageous nurses at San Francisco General Hospital’s Ward 5B defied convention and found innovative ways to provide them with compassionate care. This World AIDS Day, hear from the inspiring nurses who led this trailblazing unit in a rebroadcasted podcast episode of SEE YOU NOW from Johnson & Johnson Nursing and the American Nurses Association. Listen and subscribe here: https://apple.co/36pXfBH

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: When COVID-19 reached pandemic status, life as most of the world knew it changed. Yet, for the scientists, activists and advocates working on HIV/AIDS research, education and awareness, their work marched forward. This World AIDS Day, meet three inspiring women on a quest to make HIV history, even as COVID-19 continues.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: In the last episode of the year, Lisa Ling asks Taiwan’s former Vice President how the island has completely eliminated the disease. And Sean Penn and Ann Lee from the non-profit CORE talk about their efforts to fight COVID through improved testing.

Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Watch the season finale of “The Road to a Vaccine” TODAY to break down the science behind the headlines. Learn directly from the former Vice President of Taiwan, Dr. Chen Chien-Jen, to discuss Taiwan's success battling the pandemic, plus the latest on vaccine development from Johnson & Johnson Chief Scientific Officer Paul Stoffels, M.D. Tune in LIVE here on Facebook at 12 PM ET.

She’ll also be joined by the former Vice President of Taiwan, Dr. Chen Chien-Jen, and Johnson & Johnson Chief Scientific Officer Paul Stoffels, M.D., who will share updates on vaccine progress. Watch LIVE here on Facebook Tuesday at 12PM ET.

Message: Nurse Charlene Grace Platon knew she wanted to create something for nurses working on the front lines of the fight against COVID-19. The result? WellNurse©, an app designed for nurses to battle burnout. See how this Johnson & Johnson Nurse Innovation Fellow brought her idea to life: https://bit.ly/2UZJenu:=:https://www.jnj.com/caring-and-giving/meet-nurse-entrepreneur-behind-wellnurse-app

Message: “It really is not as much about you, but about everyone in the community.”—Alison Schwartz, D.O. A doctor on the frontlines in the COVID-19 hotspot of Wisconsin shares advice for how communities can keep themselves and everyone around them safe through simple practices such as mask wearing, hand hygiene and physical distancing in this clip from “The Road to a Vaccine.”
