Message: Calling all health advocates: HealtheVoices—a collection of leadership programs created exclusively for those using social platforms to advocate for patients—is hosting SUPER HealtheVoices LIVE on Saturday, November 21. This full-day program features educational and inspirational segments, and opportunities to connect with the advocacy community. Join us for another day of engaging speakers, meaningful workshops and powerful storytelling: https://bit.ly/3nM8H0h:=:https://healthevoices.com/healthevoices-live.html

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Imagine getting so sick from a preventable disease that you can't play or attend school—multiple times a year. It’s this reality that 40% of children in Peru who are affected by intestinal worm infections experience. See how Johnson & Johnson is innovating a new formulation of a medication to help improve the health of children in Peru and around the world: https://bit.ly/3fmFDcz:=:https://www.jnj.com/caring-and-giving/how-deworming-medicine-helps-treat-children-globally

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: How has COVID-19 exposed and amplified deeply rooted structural racial inequities in the healthcare system? In this clip from “The Road to a Vaccine,” emergency physician and founder of Advancing Health Equity, Dr. Uché Blackstock, explains the factors that have predisposed these communities to being infected.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: “I cannot emphasize how important and how critical it is for communities to do their part.” — Nurse Alice Benjamin Watch as Nurse Alice shares how frontline health workers are harnessing learnings from the pandemic to improve patient care, and the simple ways communities can support in the fight against COVID-19.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Nationwide, Black people have been dying from COVID-19 at around 2.1 times the rate of white people. Recognizing the critical opportunity to expand and accelerate its commitment and momentum to address racial and social injustice, Johnson & Johnson announced its platform that aims to eliminate health inequities for people of color and committed $100 million over the next five years to invest in and promote health equity solutions. Take a look at the ways that J&J is working to pave the way for lasting change and progress.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: With the holidays coming soon, the U.S. is seeing its highest number of novel coronavirus cases to date. Dr. Alison Schwartz and Johnson & Johnson’s Dr. Paul Stoffels share tips on staying protected and quarantining effectively.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: JUST IN: Johnson & Johnson commits $100 million over the next five years to invest in and promote health equity solutions. At this pivotal moment in history, J&J recognizes the urgent need to expand and accelerate its commitment and momentum to address racial and social injustices and promote health equity solutions for Black people and other communities of color in the U.S. Read more about our efforts: https://bit.ly/3ntAYsj:=:https://www.jnj.com/our-race-to-health-equity

This World Diabetes Day, read about Dr. Chiara Magnone, Vice President, Metabolic Complications, Janssen Research & Development, and her team’s passionate mission to help change that statistic by harnessing precision medicine to help treat and prevent potentially fatal diabetes-related diseases.

This Veteran’s Day, learn how this commitment lives on more than a century later through the support the company offers to those who serve.

We are committed to ensuring the well-being of all those involved in our trials. https://bit.ly/3kqKICn

Message: Due to the COVID-19 pandemic, many Americans are continuing to delay medical appointments and procedures. Experts fear that this may lead patients to experience negative health outcomes in the future. Johnson & Johnson Medical Devices Companies created “My Health Can’t Wait”—an educational resource hub with tools for patients and healthcare professionals to engage in meaningful conversations about how and when to prioritize needed care. Discover more about this innovative platform.

Laurencin, M.D., Ph.D., University Professor and CEO of the Connecticut Convergence Institute at the University of Connecticut, to discuss the importance of diversity in clinical trials and a possible breakthrough in testing availability. Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson

Message: Watch as Dr. Glenda Gray, President & CEO, South African Medical Research Council, shares how a focus on sharing scientific facts has helped build trust in vaccines in South Africa as she speaks to host Lisa Ling in this clip from “The Road to a Vaccine.”

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: “We should be physically distanced but socially connected.” — Robin Cogan, MEd, RN, NCSN. School nurse Robin Cogan joined “The Road to a Vaccine” to explain how being socially separated from classmates and teachers has been the biggest challenge faced by kids during the COVID-19 pandemic.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: On Global Handwashing Day, Dr. Paul Soffels, Vice Chairman of the Executive Committee and Chief Scientific Officer, Johnson & Johnson, shares a lesson on how to thoroughly wash your hands. Proper handwashing is one simple way to help stay healthy as the COVID-19 pandemic continues.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: In addition to our scientists hard at work fighting COVID-19, Johnson & Johnson is dedicated to fostering “curiosity-driven” research to help advance innovative solutions for the pandemic. William N. Hait, M.D., Ph.D., Global Head, J&J External Innovation, provides an in-depth look at this groundbreaking work happening across the globe—from San Francisco to Seoul: https://bit.ly/378hogd:=:https://www.jnj.com/innovation/ways-johnson-johnson-is-cultivating-health-innovations-for-covid-19

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: “Even good clinicians won’t be able to differentiate from COVID-19 and the flu. The symptoms are very much the same.“ — Dr. Samuel Maldonado, MD MPH, FAAP. Dr. Maldonado joined “The Road to a Vaccine” to explain the impact flu season will have when coupled with the COVID-19 pandemic—and the importance of testing and self-quarantining to prevent spread.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: What has it been like being a working parent during the COVID-19 pandemic? As Johnson & Johnson celebrates its recognition as a great place to work for working parents by Working Mother Magazine, our Working Mother and Working Dad of the year share their stories of strength in the face of adversity.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Whether you’re a frontline healthcare worker or a parent working from home, the pandemic has caused anxiety, stress and fear around the world. Learn what you can do to address these mental challenges, plus, how to know if your child needs help right now.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Close to one billion people have a mental disorder and anyone, anywhere, can be affected. It’s time to champion scientists, advocates and global experts who are working tirelessly to ensure stigma does not stand in the way of people living with mental illness seeking the care and treatment they need. Join us LIVE on October 15 at 12 PM ET for “Champions of Science: Breaking the Stigma of Mental Illness” here: https://bit.ly/3nEnVFk:=:https://www.jnj.com/champions-of-science/dr-guislain-award

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Johnson & Johnson first recognized the immense potential of this year's Nobel Prize in Chemistry duo's groundbreaking work in 2014, when the Company honored Drs. Charpentier and Doudna with the Dr. Paul Janssen Award for Biomedical Research. Learn more about these inspiring collaborators and how their work is helping to reshape the future of medicine: https://bit.ly/34JQ9G0:=:https://www.jnj.com/latest-news/4-things-to-know-about-the-women-who-won-the-2020-nobel-prize-in-chemistry

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Different forms of depression can present unique challenges and varied symptoms, including a subtype known as treatment-resistant depression (TRD). Women, seniors, people with anxiety disorders and those with severe depression can be at higher risk for developing treatment resistance. Yet by knowing the various symptoms and outputs of this complex disease, people can recognize and treat it sooner. Read more about what to look out for this World Mental Health Day and Mental Illness Awareness Week: https://bit.ly/2F2Puqp:=:https://www.jnj.com/health-and-wellness/facts-about-depression

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Did you know that in 1898 Johnson & Johnson began to translate ads and other materials into Spanish? J&J continued to make immigrants feel welcome by encouraging pharmacist to greet local immigrant customers in their own languages. This Hispanic Heritage Month, J&J celebrates its history of supporting its diverse medical community and customers, which continues today.

Message: Lisa Ling talks to UNICEF’s Henrietta Fore about global efforts to get all kids vaccinated. Harvard's Dr. Vikram Patel discusses children’s mental health during the pandemic. Plus, parents ask the experts their pressing questions about COVID-19.

Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: As the COVID-19 crisis continues, its unique effects on children—both mental and physical—are still being uncovered. Tune in LIVE TODAY here on Facebook at 12 PM ET to watch as “The Road to a Vaccine” host Lisa Ling explores these effects and their impact along with experts including Peter Hotez, Director, Center for Vaccine Development, Texas Children's Hospital.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: “The single biggest risk factor for spreading is bringing large numbers of people indoors for long periods of time, i.e. schools.” —Dr. Ashish K Jha, MPH, Director, Harvard Global Health Institute. Ahead of the next “The Road to a Vaccine,” highlighting the impact this pandemic has had on some of the youngest members of society, watch Dr. Jha discuss what the state of COVID-19 will mean for safely opening schools. “The Road To A Vaccine” airs LIVE TODAY, July 21 at 12 PM ET here on Facebook.

Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Social distancing measures and economic closures are forcing healthcare workers and families across the globe to be more resilient—especially in developing countries. Learn more about the challenges these vulnerable populations are facing when Henrietta H. Fore, Executive Director, UNICEF, joins “The Road to a Vaccine” LIVE Tuesday, July 21 at 12 PM ET here on Facebook.

Message: How is COVID-19 Affecting Children? What Parents Worldwide Should Know Lisa Ling talks to UNICEF’s Henrietta Fore about global efforts to get all kids vaccinated. Harvard's Dr. Vikram Patel discusses children’s mental health during the pandemic. Plus, parents ask the experts their pressing questions about COVID-19. Learn more about these guests ahead of tomorrow’s show: https://bit.ly/2CghJk5:=:https://www.jnj.com/latest-news/the-road-to-covid-19-vaccine-live-video-series?utm_source=facebook_organic&utm_medium=social&utm_campaign=rtavseason2organicfblivestreamreminder

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: When Ramon Polo, PharmD, Ph.D., Vice President of Regulatory Affairs for Infectious Diseases and Vaccines and Global Public Health, Johnson & Johnson, first started working on solutions for COVID-19 back in January, nothing could’ve prepared him for the global spread of the virus—or his wife’s diagnosis of the disease. Read more as Dr. Polo shares the crucial work he and his team are doing to develop a potential COVID-19 vaccine—and how his wife’s experience with the disease will forever motivate him to help others: https://bit.ly/38YYJlT:=:https://www.jnj.com/personal-stories/meet-covid-19-vaccine-researcher-whose-wife-got-sick-with-coronavirus

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Is it safe for teachers and students to return to school this fall? And how will education look once they do? Join “The Road to a Vaccine” host Lisa Ling and top parenting experts on the next episode as they answer the unprecedented questions that are on the minds of families across the country during the COVID-19 pandemic. Tune in LIVE on TUESDAY, July 21 at 12 PM ET, here on Facebook.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: An imperative step in creating the most optimal vaccine for the population? Diversity in clinical trials, Macaya Douoguih, M.D., M.P.H., Head of Clinical Development & Medical Affairs, Janssen Vaccines explains on “The Road to a Vaccine.” Watch to learn more about the need for representation as Douoguih speaks to host Lisa Ling.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: A groundbreaking Johnson & Johnson innovation that harnesses 3-D printing could mean reducing the chances that a patient might need follow-up surgeries after a traumatic bone injury such as a fall from a great height, a bone tumor or a vehicular accident. Learn more about this cutting-edge technology and how its poised to help people suffering from traumatic injuries by exploring a virtual journey of the process—from day 1 through to the day a patient is sent home to begin recovery: https://bit.ly/2OeVZqS:=:https://www.jnj.com/innovation/trumatch-graft-cage-long-bone-3d-printed-medical-device

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: According to actress and advocate Laverne Cox, members of the transgender community often have less access to healthcare or are hesitant to seek it due to fear of being stigmatized. Watch as Cox speaks to “The Road to a Vaccine” host Lisa Ling about how the community is dealing with these unique challenges during the COVID-19 pandemic.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: From the scientists working on a potential vaccine to the medically trained employees who helped treat patients on the frontlines, the COVID-19 pandemic has impacted Johnson & Johnson employees throughout the globe in unique and meaningful ways. Meet 7 of these dedicated employees as they share what most resonates with them about the virus—including how underrepresented populations are disproportionately affected by COVID-19—and how the pandemic has inspired them to think differently about their work.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Lisa Ling talks with Dr. Francis Collins, Director, NIH about the latest on treatments and vaccines. Also, Harvard's Dr. Ashish Jha shares how the virus affects the body and Johns Hopkins' Dr. Tom Inglesby explains what data on spread means for people.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: LIVE TODAY at 12 PM ET: Why are some blood types more susceptible to COVID-19 and what treatments may work best until a vaccine is developed? Tune in here on Facebook in 1 hour to watch LIVE as Dr. Francis Collins, Director, National Institutes of Health (NIH), joins “The Road to a Vaccine” to answer your most pressing COVID-19 questions.

Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Lisa Ling talks with Dr. Francis Collins, Director, NIH about the latest on treatments and vaccines. Also, Harvard's Dr. Ashish Jha shares how the virus affects the body and Johns Hopkins' Dr. Tom Inglesby explains what data on spread means for people.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: How can COVID-19 affect the body long-term? In the next episode of “The Road to a Vaccine,” host Lisa Ling sits down with leading scientific experts including Dr. Ashish Jha, Director, Harvard Global Health Institute, to discuss the disease’s impact from initial exposure to recovery, plus much more. Tune in LIVE on TUESDAY, July 14 at 12 PM ET, here on Facebook.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: “It feels incredible to achieve this milestone in light of the current challenges associated with the COVID-19 situation.” — Maria Grazia Pau, Senior Director, Compound Development Team Leader for HIV vaccine programs at the Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson, on completing full immunizations for the Imbokodo study, which is evaluating an investigational preventive HIV vaccine in sub-Saharan Africa. Learn what this means for the future of fighting the disease—and for the creation of a potential vaccine for COVID-19: https://bit.ly/2CnnNGR:=:https://www.jnj.com/latest-news/johnson-johnson-marks-milestone-in-imbokodo-hiv-vaccine-trial

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: As the world comes together to battle COVID-19, Alex Gorsky, Chairman and Chief Executive Officer, Johnson & Johnson, has been inspired by unprecedented levels of collaboration between companies, government entities and NGOs. At the Fortune Brainstorm Health Conference, Gorsky discussed how J&J is responding to the pandemic, the Company's rapid progress in developing a COVID-19 vaccine—and how new ways of partnering and sharing information could continue to transform healthcare for years to come. Read more: https://bit.ly/3iPb0h8:=:https://www.jnj.com/latest-news/alex-gorsky-on-johnson-johnson-covid-19-response-at-fortune-brainstorm-health

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: As COVID-19 continues to spread across the globe, many questions remain unanswered. What treatments are safe and effective? What does the road to recovery look like? Host Lisa Ling sits down with leading scientific experts to explore these questions and more on the next episode of “The Road to a Vaccine.” Tune in LIVE Tuesday, July 14 at 12 PM ET, right here on Facebook.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: “I believe it’s essential to share what progress we’ve made and to reassure the world that we’re not losing sight of our goal: to develop a global HIV vaccine that can be offered to women and men around the world.” — Macaya Douoguih, M.D., M.P.H.Head of Clinical Development & Medical Affairs, Janssen Vaccines. Even as the world continues to battle COVID-19, activists, educators and researchers like Douoguih remain more emboldened than ever on their mission to help end the HIV/AIDS epidemic. Meet three attendees of the 2020 International AIDS Conference as they share their inspiring work helping make HIV history, and discuss the ways it has been influenced by the COVID-19 pandemic.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: In the Season 2 premiere of “The Road to a Vaccine,” journalist Lisa Ling checks into the 2020 International AIDS Conference to talk with HIV advocate Laverne Cox and Johnson & Johnson Chief Scientific Officer Dr. Paul Stoffels about how HIV vaccine research is informing work on COVID-19 vaccines.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Due to learnings from their HIV vaccine research, scientists are able to accelerate the development of a COVID-19 vaccine. Find out how on the season 2 premiere of “The Road to a Vaccine,” as Dr. Paul Stoffels, Vice Chairman of the Executive Committee and Chief Scientific Officer, Johnson & Johnson, actress and advocate Laverne Cox and more speak to host Lisa Ling about the parallels between the COVID-19 and AIDS pandemics. Don’t miss the exciting LIVE premiere of “The Road to a Vaccine,” TODAY at 12 PM ET right here on Facebook.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: In the Season 2 premiere of “The Road to a Vaccine,” journalist Lisa Ling checks into the 2020 International AIDS Conference to talk with HIV advocate Laverne Cox and Johnson & Johnson Chief Scientific Officer Dr. Paul Stoffels about how HIV vaccine research is informing work on COVID-19 vaccines.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Since the height of the West African Ebola epidemic in 2014—the worst outbreak in the disease’s history—Johnson & Johnson has worked to accelerate efforts to develop an Ebola vaccine. The Company has now received the first approval of its Ebola vaccine regimen from the Marketing Authorization from the European Commission, which is the executive arm of the European Union. Discover the steps that J&J has taken toward enabling broader access to its vaccine regimen for the people who need it most, and the lessons learned from the vaccine’s development that could help in the fight against COVID-19: https://bit.ly/2Bkga4b:=:https://www.jnj.com/latest-news/latest-facts-about-johnson-johnson-ebola-vaccine

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Everyone has an important role to play in the fight to end racism and injustice in America. As part of this fight, Johnson & Johnson has committed $10 million—a pledge that will span the next three years. Discover ways you can educate yourself and support the Black community from our partner Love Has No Labels: www.lovehasnolabels.com:=:https://lovehasnolabels.com/

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: COVID-19 continues to spread across the world, with more than 10 million confirmed cases in 188 countries. Journalist Lisa Ling returns LIVE with top scientists, medical professionals and world leaders to answer your most pressing questions about the disease including vaccine timing, your mental health, the economy and healthcare disparities in all new episodes of “The Road to a Vaccine.” The groundbreaking series that over 20 million viewers watched returns Tuesday, July 7 at 12pm ET. Watch right here on Facebook as we broadcast LIVE from the 2020 International AIDS Conference.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: When Valarie Tucker received a diagnosis of atrial fibrillation (AFib) in 2018, she was shocked. Although up to six million Americans struggle with AFib—a type of irregular heart rhythm that occurs when the heart’s upper and lower chambers don’t beat in sync, raising the risk of stroke five-fold, according to the American Heart Association—many people with the condition don’t show symptoms and may go undiagnosed for years. That’s why Johnson & Johnson, in collaboration with Apple, has launched the Heartline™ Study, a first-of-its-kind virtual research study exploring how wearable technology and innovative apps can help detect AFib. Learn more as Tucker shares the importance of studies like this as she reflects on her experience learning she had the condition—and the unexpected positive impact it has had on her life: https://bit.ly/3837Lh7:=:https://www.jnj.com/personal-stories/living-with-afib-one-womans-diagnosis-story

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: "The Road to a Vaccine” hosted by journalist Lisa Ling is back LIVE with all new episodes on Tuesday, July 7, and we want to hear from you. Tell us what you want to learn more about in the comments below and we may feature it in Season 2.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: How does the skin microbiome—the ever-changing mix of good and bad bacteria on your skin—work to fend off potential invaders and help manage conditions such as eczema, atopic dermatitis and acne? It’s a relationship that Kimberly Capone, Ph.D., Head of the Microbiome Platform, Johnson & Johnson Consumer Health, set out to explore when she launched a study of 30 mothers and their 31 children 10 years ago. Read more to learn how Capone’s scientific discoveries provide strong evidence of the evolving nature of our skin microbiome—and how she hopes that these findings can help inform products that could support the microbiome from infancy through adulthood: https://bit.ly/37YnBK0:=:https://www.jnj.com/innovation/questions-for-researcher-who-spent-decade-studying-human-skin-microbiome

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Did you know that Black women are 3-4 times more likely to die during pregnancy and childbirth than white women? On Saturday, June 27 at 2:47pm EST, join Dr. Robyn Jones, Senior Medical Director, Johnson & Johnson, and Emmy-winning journalist Mara Schiavocampo at the 2020 Essence Festival Experience as they discuss the drivers of health inequalities and share tools for how women can advocate for themselves while receiving care in “The Fight for Black Mamas: Eliminating Racial Disparities in Maternal Health.” Tune in for this critical conversation: https://bit.ly/2NtQiFi:=:https://www.essencestudios.com/events/signin/signin?ref=/events//signin?ref=/Essence-Festival-2020

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: At Johnson & Johnson, we believe in the Essence Festival’s mission: to promote the Black community’s well-being. That’s why J&J, Aveeno and Neutrogena are proud to sponsor the 2020 Essence Festival of Culture™: Unstoppable Virtual Experience. This year, the festival has gone digital with 2 back-to-back weekends of music, entertainment, empowerment and culture, streaming June 25-28 and July 2-6. Learn more and register: www.EssenceFestival.com.:=:https://www.meredith.com/

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: “This is a perpetual journey—no company can ever be diverse or inclusive enough.” — Michael Sneed, Executive Vice President, Global Corporate Affairs and Chief Communication Officer, Johnson & Johnson. From the start of his career at J&J in 1983, Sneed has watched the company evolve to be more inclusive and diverse, but he recognizes that there is still work to be done. From helping address the high maternal mortality rate among women of color in the U.S. to working to diversify COVID-19 clinical trial representation, learn more as Sneed reflects on the state of racism and inequality in America and what is needed to help build a more equitable healthcare system—and society: https://bit.ly/2N8nBxl:=:https://www.jnj.com/latest-news/conversation-with-michael-sneed-on-racial-inequity

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: True or False: COVID-19 has currently been detected on all seven continents. Answer: False. According to the CDC, COVID-19 has been detected in Africa, the Americas, Europe, Asia and Australia, but not in Antarctica. Learn more about COVID-19—and what it might take to help fight the pandemic from researchers around the world—in this interactive quiz: https://bit.ly/2YpFGfJ:=:https://www.jnj.com/innovation/covid-19-quiz-how-much-do-you-know-about-coronavirus

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: If you could help those most critically ill with COVID-19, would you? For Laura Gador, a Health Economics & Access Manager at Johnson & Johnson Medical GmbH and former general nurse, the answer was yes, when she decided to dust off her scrubs and volunteer at a hospital in Germany. Learn more as Gador reflects on what her life on the front lines has been like—including the challenges, the blessings and how J&J nurtured and encouraged her desire to make a difference.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: From inclusive benefits such as assistance with fertility treatments, adoption and surrogacy to our Open&Out Employee Resource Group, which unites over 3,400 LGBTQ+ members around the world to help foster an inclusive work environment, J&J has long worked to support the LGBTQ+ community. This Pride Month, learn more about the employee policies, business practices and public advocacy initiatives that make J&J an ally and leader for the community.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: ✔ A program designed to support the mental health of nurses working around the clock to care for COVID-19 patients. ✔ A $3 million donation to The International Federation of the Red Cross and Red Crescent to help provide on-the-ground medical relief in hot spot countries. These are just two of the many ways a $50 million commitment from Johnson & Johnson is helping make a difference in the fight against COVID-19. Learn more about how J&J is supporting organizations and health workers around the world facing challenges while battling the virus.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: JUST IN: Johnson & Johnson announces that it has accelerated the initiation of the Phase 1/2a first-in-human clinical trial of its COVID-19 lead vaccine candidate. Initially scheduled to begin in September, the Company will now begin trials in the second half of July. Learn more about this milestone announcement and how J&J is making significant investments to increase manufacturing capacity around the world to ensure global access: https://bit.ly/37jyo0Z:=:https://www.jnj.com/johnson-johnson-announces-acceleration-of-its-covid-19-vaccine-candidate-phase-1-2a-clinical-trial-to-begin-in-second-half-of-july

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Johnson & Johnson stands with Black academics and scientists calling for an end to racism in STEM2D fields. J&J will dedicate today, and every day, to identifying and implementing actions to address racism and support Black children, students and professionals interested in STEM2D fields. Learn more: https://bit.ly/2BMQrB2:=:https://www.shutdownstem.com/

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: "In many ways, blacks in America are experiencing a double pandemic with the disease of racism.” —Cato T. Laurencin, M.D., Ph.D., University Professor and CEO of the Connecticut Convergence Institute at the University of Connecticut. Watch to learn more as Dr. Laurencin shares why racism is a public health crisis and discusses the impact of added stress spurred by recent events in the midst of the COVID-19 pandemic.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: At Johnson & Johnson, we believe the ability to live and thrive in a community where you feel accepted and safe is a basic human right. Racism in any form is unacceptable. Black Lives Matter, and we must do more now. J&J is committing $10 million to fight racism and injustice in America—a pledge that will span the next three years. Please read the message that Alex Gorsky, Chairman and Chief Executive Officer, Johnson & Johnson, sent to our employees globally to learn more about how we’re taking action: https://bit.ly/2AvSRn1:=:https://www.jnj.com/latest-news/a-message-from-johnson-johnson-ceo-alex-gorsky-about-recent-events-in-the-united-states

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Virologist Peter Piot, M.D., Ph.D., talks with Johnson & Johnson’s Dr. Paul Stoffels, M.D., about what it was like to personally battle COVID-19. World-renowned expert Cato Laurencin, M.D., Ph.D., discusses why racism is a public health crisis. Plus, other COVID-19 news.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: In the season one finale, watch as virologist Peter Piot, M.D., Ph.D., talks with Paul Stoffels, M.D., about what it was like to personally battle COVID-19. Plus, experts discuss efforts to protect children, refugees and other at-risk populations around the world from the coronavirus.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: From a conversation with Former FDA Commissioner Dr. Mark McClellan on what reopening could look like to an update on COVID-19 vaccine trials from Dr. Paul Stoffels, Vice Chairman of the Executive Committee and Chief Scientific Officer, Johnson & Johnson, episode 7 of “The Road to a Vaccine” shared the latest news on how the scientific community is working at record speeds to overcome this pandemic. Watch to learn more before episode 8 of “The Road to a Vaccine” airs LIVE on Tuesday, June 2, at 12 PM EDT right here on Facebook.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: In the season 1 finale of “The Road to a Vaccine,” two world-renowned virus hunters will come together for a groundbreaking interview—Peter Piot, Director, London School of Hygiene & Tropical Medicine, who recently beat COVID-19, and Dr. Paul Stoffels, Vice Chairman of the Executive Committee and Chief Scientific Officer, Johnson & Johnson. Plus, host Lisa Ling reflects on the key learnings and milestones made in the quest toward a COVID-19 vaccine. Don’t miss the exciting conclusion of “The Road to a Vaccine” season 1, airing LIVE on Tuesday, June 2 at 12 PM EDT, right here on Facebook.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: To help tackle some of the biggest challenges nurses are facing on the frontlines of COVID-19 today, nearly 500 healthcare professionals, engineers, tech enthusiasts and others from around the world joined the NurseHack4Health, hosted by Johnson & Johnson and others, to innovate real-time solutions that address patient care challenges driven by the global pandemic. As National Nurses Month comes to a close, learn more from Lynda Benton, Senior Director, Corporate Equity, J&J, about the hackathon and how it helped empower nurses to lead the next wave of healthcare innovation: https://bit.ly/3dfKg6x:=:https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/nursehack4health-powering-up-nurse-led-innovation-help-lynda-benton/?trackingId=Yz9WFvAcF22DD5BcyfXpMg%3D%3D

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Each week on “The Road to a Vaccine,” host Lisa Ling highlights an extraordinary way the global community is giving back to those impacted by COVID-19. Watch to meet an inspiring Miami artist who used her creativity to create a one-of-a-kind tribute to the heroic healthcare workers on the frontlines. “The Road to a Vaccine” airs LIVE Tuesdays at 12 PM EDT right here on Facebook.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Dr. Jonathan Quick, Managing Director, Pandemics, The Rockefeller Foundation, shares what we have learned from COVID-19 and how we can use that to better prepare for future outbreaks. Watch to learn more as Dr. Quick speaks to “The Road to a Vaccine” host Lisa Ling about innovations in testing and what you need to know about pandemic literacy. “The Road to a Vaccine” airs LIVE Tuesdays at 12 PM EDT right here on Facebook.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: “COVID-19 is a real public health threat unlike any that we've faced in a long time—a century or more.”—Mark McClellan, M.D., Ph.D., Former FDA Commissioner. Learn more as Dr. McClellan shares his expert opinion on what makes COVID-19 more dangerous than a typical flu, and why your actions have an impact on those around you. Tune in to watch “The Road to a Vaccine” LIVE Tuesdays at 12 PM EDT right here on Facebook.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Once a successful COVID-19 vaccine comes out of trials, what happens next? Dr. Paul Stoffels, Vice Chairman of the Executive Committee and Chief Scientific Officer, Johnson & Johnson, shares the steps that will need to be taken with “The Road to a Vaccine” host Lisa Ling.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: "My hope is that this global pandemic brings people together, because that is how we’ll get through this." — Dr. Ed Kuffner, Chief Medical Officer, Consumer, Johnson & Johnson. When Dr. Kuffner decided to return to Coney Island Hospital in Brooklyn, New York to help treat patients at the peak of the outbreak, he didn’t realize the impact it would have on him. In honor of Mental Health Month, Dr. Kuffner—who used the J&J COVID-19 Medical Personnel Leave Policy, which enables medically trained employees to donate their time and expertise on the frontlines—shares what this experience taught him about resilience and finding hope during a challenging time.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Lisa Ling speaks with Johnson & Johnson’s Dr. Paul Stoffels, former FDA Commissioner Dr. Mark McClellan and global health leader Dr. Jonathan Quick about where we stand in the fight against the novel coronavirus, how reopening is going around the world and other COVID-19 news.

Message: Lisa Ling speaks with Johnson & Johnson’s Dr. Paul Stoffels, former FDA Commissioner Dr. Mark McClellan and global health leader Dr. Jonathan Quick about where we stand in the fight against the novel coronavirus, how reopening is going around the world and other COVID-19 news.

Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Tomorrow, Tuesday, May 26, join Dr. Paul Stoffels, Vice Chairman of the Executive Committee and Chief Scientific Officer, Johnson & Johnson, as he sits down with “The Road to a Vaccine” host Lisa Ling to discuss the latest updates in the global quest to develop a COVID-19 vaccine. Plus, leading scientific experts share insight into what a “new normal” could look like and how global communities can be prepared for future pandemics. Watch “The Road to a Vaccine” LIVE, Tuesday, May 26, at 12 PM EDT right here on Facebook.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Michael Sneed, Executive Vice President, Global Corporate Affairs and Chief Communication Officer, Johnson & Johnson, discusses how “The Road to a Vaccine” is a major leap forward in our commitment to public engagement and education. Learn more about the series and how it is providing an unprecedented look into the ways that the global scientific community is working to safely and effectively introduce a COVID-19 vaccine: https://bit.ly/3cmlQaU:=:https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/sharing-our-road-vaccine-michael-sneed

Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: In episode 7 of “The Road to a Vaccine,” Dr. Paul Stoffels, Vice Chairman of the Executive Committee and Chief Scientific Officer, Johnson & Johnson, returns to the show and joins host Lisa Ling to share live updates from the scientific community on how they are coordinating efforts around the globe to develop a COVID-19 vaccine. Tune in right here on Facebook on Tuesday, May 26, at 12 PM EDT to watch “The Road to a Vaccine” LIVE.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: From HIV to Ebola, companies like UPS have worked to ensure that critical medicines can reach people who need them most all over the world. Watch to learn how UPS is preparing to distribute a potential COVID-19 vaccine from Laura Lane, President, Global Public Affairs, UPS, as she speaks to “The Road to a Vaccine” host Lisa Ling. “The Road to a Vaccine” airs LIVE every Tuesday at 12 PM EDT right here on Facebook.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: "Everything about this pandemic is unprecedented.” — Jane Halton, Chair, Coalition for Epidemic Preparedness Innovations (CEPI). Watch to learn how companies like CEPI are investing in the complex process of developing a COVID-19 vaccine, while in parallel working to ensure that efficacy and safety remain a top priority. Tune in to “The Road to a Vaccine” LIVE every Tuesday at 12 PM EDT right here on Facebook.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: “The incredible response just reinforces for me that my colleagues at Johnson & Johnson are part of the fabric of my life.”—Melissa Surdez, Head, Global Experience, Johnson & Johnson Human Resources. When Surdez received an urgent call from her sister—a physician battling on the front lines of COVID-19—she immediately reached out to hundreds of J&J employees across the globe for their help. Read more about Surdez’s inspiring story, and how she helped mobilize her colleagues to help produce over 1,000 cloth masks to preserve medical-grade masks for where they are needed most.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: According to Seema Kumar, Vice President, Innovation, Global Health and Science Policy Communication, Johnson & Johnson, demystifying the science behind COVID-19 vaccine development is imperative during this pandemic. Watch to learn as Kumar speaks to “The Road to a Vaccine” host Lisa Ling about the ways that scientists can work to achieve this goal. “The Road to a Vaccine” airs LIVE every Tuesday at 12 PM EDT right here on Facebook.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Have you ever wondered how a vaccine is transported throughout the world to reach patients safely? Watch as Remo Colarusso, Vice President, Janssen Supply Chain, Johnson & Johnson, explains the complex process of “cold chain” distribution to “The Road to a Vaccine” host Lisa Ling. “The Road to a Vaccine” airs LIVE every Tuesday at 12 PM EDT right here on Facebook.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Watch as Lisa Ling speaks with the Chair of the Coalition for Epidemic Preparedness Innovations (CEPI), a Janssen supply chain expert, and the head of Global Public Affairs at UPS about what it will take to get a vaccine to the people who need it. Plus, a young Nigerian activist on her outreach efforts.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: In episode 6 of “The Road to a Vaccine,” host Lisa Ling will share the latest breaking updates from the global scientific community on progress toward a COVID-19 vaccine. Plus, Ling will sit down with leading scientific experts including Jane Halton, Chair, Coalition for Epidemic Preparedness Innovations, to dive deeper into what it will take to distribute a COVID-19 vaccine globally. Tune in LIVE for this meaningful discussion today, May 19, at 12 PM EDT right here on Facebook.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Watch as Lisa Ling speaks with the Chair of the Coalition for Epidemic Preparedness Innovations (CEPI), a Janssen supply chain expert, and the head of Global Public Affairs at UPS about what it will take to get a vaccine to the people who need it. Plus, a young Nigerian activist on her outreach efforts.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: “The thing that makes drug development a years-long process is that you have to demonstrate it is safe to be used in patients. With these compounds, we already know they're safe.” — Sandra De Meyer, Senior Director and Head of Clinical Microbiology and Immunology, The Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson, who is working to screen a library of thousands of existing drug compounds in an effort to expedite the search for potential COVID-19 treatment. Learn more about her unique job as a molecular investigator—and how scientists like De Meyer are working around the clock to impact the trajectory of the current pandemic.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: From a critical conversation with Arianna Huffington on how the COVID-19 pandemic is impacting mental health to a moving discussion about evolving care during the pandemic with two nurses on the frontlines, episode 5 of “The Road to a Vaccine” provided a unique perspective on some of today’s key issues. Watch to learn more before episode 6 of “The Road to a Vaccine” airs LIVE on Tuesday, May 19, at 12 PM EDT right here on Facebook.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: How will the scientific community work to quickly scale a COVID-19 vaccine once it’s approved? Find out on this week’s episode of “The Road to a Vaccine,” when host Lisa Ling speaks to leading scientific experts around the world about the importance of collaboration, large-scale manufacturing and distribution capabilities. “The Road to a Vaccine” airs LIVE on Tuesday, May 19 at 12 PM EDT, right here on Facebook.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: How will a COVID-19 vaccine allow nurses to do their job more safely and further protect their loved ones at home? Rebecca Love, President, SONSIEL, reflects on what this breakthrough could provide to those on the frontlines of care as she speaks to “The Road to a Vaccine” host Lisa Ling. “The Road to a Vaccine” airs every Tuesday at 12 PM EDT right here on Facebook.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: “As a scientist, I can say that we are learning things every day, and we are using that knowledge to help guide us in finding potential treatments and in fine-tuning vaccine development.”—Hanneke Schuitemaker, Ph.D., Vice President and Global Head of Viral Vaccine Discovery and Translational Medicine, Janssen Vaccines & Prevention B.V. After years of investigating infectious diseases like HIV and Ebola, Dr. Schuitemaker and her team are focusing their efforts on producing a potential vaccine for COVID-19. Learn more about the crucial work her team is doing, what stands out to her about the behavior of this novel coronavirus and how her past experience with viruses may help fight this new pandemic: https://bit.ly/2Ln2FlB:=:https://www.jnj.com/innovation/meet-scientist-developing-potential-coronavirus-vaccine

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Arianna Huffington, Founder and CEO of Thrive Global, shares her expert tips on how to reduce stress from news overexposure during this unprecedented time. Watch to learn more as Huffington speaks with “The Road to a Vaccine” host Lisa Ling, and tune in for the LIVE show every Tuesday at 12 PM EDT right here on Facebook.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Dr. Macaya Douoguih, Clinical Development and Medical Affairs, Vaccines, The Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson, walks “The Road to a Vaccine” host Lisa Ling through the three phases of a vaccine trial, from small studies to efficacy studies, and the important considerations for each stage. “The Road to a Vaccine” airs every Tuesday at 12 PM EDT right here on Facebook.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: “Nurses are the most courageous people I know.”—Nicole Lincoln, MS, RN, FNP-BC, CCNS, Senior Manager of Nursing Innovation at Boston Medical Center. As the COVID-19 crisis continues, nurses on the frontlines are innovating new ways to care for patients who are separated from their families. Watch to learn more as Lincoln describes the selfless ways she’s seen nurses step up for patients in these uncertain times, and don’t forget to tune in to “The Road to a Vaccine” LIVE each Tuesday at 12 PM EDT right here on Facebook.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: How has COVID-19 impacted “The Road to a Vaccine” host Lisa Ling and why does she believe the groundbreaking series is a unique way for parents and kids to educate themselves on the disease? Learn the answer to this and more as Ling speaks to People about her experiences during this unprecedented time in history, and don’t forget to tune in to “The Road to a Vaccine” airing each Tuesday at 12 PM EDT right here on Facebook: https://bit.ly/35UgUYi:=:https://people.com/parents/lisa-ling-daughters-drive-her-nuts-family-coronavirus-exclusive/

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Two nurses—one on the frontlines in the ICU, and one leading the charge to advocate for her profession—talk about what caring for patients, and each other, really means right now. Plus, Arianna Huffington discusses the other COVID-19 crisis: how it's impacting mental health. #inittogether Lisa Ling interviews Rebecca Love RN, BS, MSN, FIEL, Nicole Lincoln MS, RN, FNP-BC, CCNS, Arianna Huffington, Husseini K. Manji, M.D., FRCPC, Macaya Douoguih, M.D., MPH, and Michelle Elman.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Two nurses—one on the frontlines in the ICU, and one leading the charge to advocate for her profession—talk about what caring for patients, and each other, really means right now. Plus, Arianna Huffington discusses the other COVID-19 crisis: how it's impacting mental health.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: As demand for a COVID-19 vaccine continues to increase, scaling up the number of vaccine units needed globally to achieve herd immunity is of the utmost importance. Hear from Dr. Johan Van Hoof, M.D., Global Therapeutic Area Head, Vaccines, Johnson & Johnson, on how companies are already ramping up production efforts. “The Road to a Vaccine” airs LIVE today, May 12 at 12 PM EDT right here on Facebook.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: After surviving Ebola, Dr. Adaora Okoli, Internal Medicine Resident Physician, Tulane University School of Medicine, shares her unique perspective on the way the world has reacted to COVID-19, and how we can be better prepared for pandemics and outbreaks overall. Stories like Dr. Okoli’s are shared each week on “The Road to a Vaccine.” Tune in today, May 12 at 12 PM EDT right here on Facebook to watch LIVE.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: From two nurses on the frontlines of care working to provide medical and emotional support for patients, to a conversation with Arianna Huffington exploring how #COVID19 has impacted mental health, host Lisa Ling will be tackling some of today’s most important issues on episode 5 of “The Road to a Vaccine.” Watch to learn more about this week’s featured guests, and don’t forget to tune in LIVE on Tuesday, May 12 at 12 PM EDT, right here on Facebook.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: ✔️A doctor who survived Ebola and is now treating COVID-19 patients in the U.S. ✔️A Johnson & Johnson scientist leading a team working on a potential vaccine candidate These are just two of the inspiring guests featured in episode 4 of “The Road to a Vaccine.” Watch to learn more before tuning in LIVE for episode 5 of “The Road to a Vaccine” on Tuesday, May 11 at 12 PM EDT right here on Facebook.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: In episode 5 of “The Road to a Vaccine,” we’re celebrating National Nurses Week by speaking to nurses on the frontlines of the COVID-19 crisis about the brave and innovative ways they’re caring for patients. Plus, host Lisa Ling will sit down with Arianna Huffington and other experts to explore the unprecedented mental health effects of the current pandemic, and an inspiring COVID-19 survivor shares her story. Tune in this Tuesday, May 12 at 12 PM EDT right here on Facebook to watch LIVE.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: As a doctor who recently returned to the frontlines of the pandemic at the Coney Island Hospital in Brooklyn, New York, Dr. Ed Kuffner, Chief Medical Officer, Consumer, Johnson & Johnson, has seen firsthand how COVID-19 can impact people from all walks of life. Watch to learn more as Dr. Kuffner shares an inside look at his experience. “The Road to a Vaccine” airs LIVE every Tuesday at 12 PM EDT right here on Facebook.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: ✔️A digital education platform designed to empower parents so they can feel confident and knowledgeable about pregnancy, delivery, breastfeeding and infant care. ✔️A battery- and solar-powered neonatal intensive care incubator that is disposable and able to be used at home at an affordable rate. These are the two groundbreaking ideas that won Johnson & Johnson’s Nurses Innovate QuickFire Challenge in Maternal and Newborn Health, designed to recognize those who never stop innovating. This National Nurses Week, meet the nurses behind these inventions as they share more about the impact they're already having on the health of moms and babies—and how they are adapting their technology since the start of the COVID-19 pandemic.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Scientists may have been anticipating a global pandemic like COVID-19 for some time, but the effects of this disease have been much more devastating than they expected. Watch as Dr. Larry Brilliant, M.D., MPH, Founder, and CEO of Pandefense Advisory, Epidemiologist and Philanthropist, shares the ways that COVID-19 can uniquely impact the body. “The Road to a Vaccine” airs LIVE on Facebook every Tuesday at 12 PM EDT.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: “Experiencing Ebola and what it did to people, made me so empathetic. And when I look at my patients here in New Orleans who have COVID-19, they're asking the same questions that I asked when I was in isolation.”—Dr. Adaora Okoli, Internal Medicine Resident Physician, Tulane University School of Medicine. After surviving Ebola in 2014, Dr. Okoli’s life changed forever. Watch to learn how her experience both treating and contracting Ebola provided her with the empathetic outlook she uses to care for her patients with COVID-19 today.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: This World Hand Hygiene Day, learn one simple way to help stay healthy as the COVID-19 pandemic continues: Wash your hands. Join Dr. Paul Soffels, Vice Chairman of the Executive Committee and Chief Scientific Officer, Johnson & Johnson, for a quick and thorough handwashing.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: This week we hear from three physicians about what they’ve learned from caring for COVID-19 patients. Plus, a leading scientist talks about how long vaccine immunity could last. #covid19 #coronavirus #pandemic #health #coronavirusvaccine #frontlinehealthcareworkers #covid19testing

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Episode 4 of “The Road to a Vaccine” premieres LIVE Tuesday, May 5 at 12 PM EDT right here on Facebook, but there’s still time to catch up on Episode 3. Watch to discover some of the key learnings from last week’s guests. Learn about the complex process of developing a COVID-19 vaccine from former FDA Commissioner Dr. Margaret Hamburg, why vaccines are safe and effective from Dr. Paul Stoffels, Vice Chairman of the Executive Committee and Chief Scientific Officer, Johnson & Johnson, and why there are racial disparities surrounding COVID-19.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Tune in this Tuesday, May 5, at 12 PM EDT LIVE here on Facebook for Episode 4 of “The Road to a Vaccine,” where host Lisa Ling will sit down with some of the doctors courageously caring for patients hardest hit by the pandemic, as well as leading scientists to discuss the process for scaling up manufacturing capacity in order to produce a COVID-19 vaccine. Host Lisa Ling will be joined by Larry Brilliant, M.D., MPH, Founder, and CEO of Pandefense Advisory, Epidemiologist and Philanthropist, Adaora Okoli, M.D., MPH, Internal Medicine Resident Physician, Tulane University School of Medicine, Dr. Ed Kuffner, Chief Medical Officer, Johnson & Johnson Family of Consumer Companies, Dr. Johan Van Hoof, Global Head, Vaccines, The Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson, and Caleb Hernandez, DO, FACEP, Founder of Certa Dose, Inc., and an Emergency Medicine Physician.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: A recent study from Cato T. Laurencin, M.D., Ph.D., University Professor and CEO of the Connecticut Convergence Institute at the University of Connecticut, revealed several disparities in COVID-19 care and impact for minority groups. Watch to learn more about these findings as Dr. Laurencin sits down with “The Road to a Vaccine Host” Lisa Ling. "The Road to a Vaccine" airs LIVE every Tuesday at 12 PM EDT right here on Facebook.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: In episode 4 of “The Road to a Vaccine,” host Lisa Ling will speak to doctors on the frontlines of care helping treat those hardest hit by the COVID-19 pandemic. Plus, leading scientific experts will join to discuss the latest in vaccine development and manufacturing. Tune in this Tuesday, May 5 at 12 PM EDT right here on Facebook to watch LIVE.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: “We’re moving at record speed.”—Dr. Margaret Hamburg, Former FDA Commissioner, on the rapid global mobilization and collaboration in response to the urgency of COVID-19. Watch to learn more as Dr. Hamburg speaks to “The Road to a Vaccine” host Lisa Ling about the specific steps the scientific community is taking to develop a vaccine for this pandemic, and don’t forget to tune in LIVE each Tuesday at 12 PM EDT for a new episode of “The Road to a Vaccine,” right here on Facebook.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: “Vaccines have been one of the most important technologies in helping eliminate diseases from our society.”—Dr. Paul Stoffels, Vice Chairman of the Executive Committee and Chief Scientific Officer, Johnson & Johnson. Watch to learn more in this clip from “The Road to a Vaccine” as Dr. Stoffels discusses how we can ensure vaccines are safe and why they are an essential part of helping protect against global pandemics like COVID-19.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: “I really felt like I had a duty to come back.”—Dr. Ed Kuffner, Chief Medical Officer, Consumer, Johnson & Johnson, who recently returned to the emergency room at Coney Island Hospital in Brooklyn, New York to work on the frontlines of the COVID-19 crisis. Dr. Kuffner’s inspiring act was made possible as part of the J&J COVID-19 Medical Personnel Leave Policy, which allows employees to donate their time and expertise on the frontlines. Watch to learn more about Dr. Kuffner’s firsthand experience on the frontlines as he recounts it to NBC News.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Lisa Ling interviews National Academies Member and University of Connecticut professor Cato Laurencin, M.D., Ph.D., to learn what his new coronavirus study reveals. Plus, what’s needed to mass-produce a vaccine.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: As COVID-19 continues to spread, Johnson & Johnson has worked to provide support to the communities impacted—from the healthcare workers battling the crisis on the front lines, to the hospitals caring for the sick, to the research partners racing to find solutions that could help bring this pandemic to a halt. Learn more about our efforts to respond to the global crisis, including a landmark partnership with the U.S. Government's Biomedical Advanced Research and Development Authority to together commit over $1 billion of investment to co-fund vaccine research, development and clinical testing: https://bit.ly/3a66cyH:=:https://www.jnj.com/latest-news/ways-johnson-johnson-helping-to-fight-covid-19

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Tune in this Tuesday, April 28, at 12 PM EDT LIVE here on Facebook for Episode 3 of “The Road to a Vaccine.” Host Lisa Ling will speak with Dr. Paul Stoffels, Vice Chairman of the Executive Committee and Chief Scientific Officer, Johnson & Johnson, Margaret Hamburg, M.D., Former FDA Commissioner, and Cato T. Laurencin, M.D., Ph.D. University Professor and CEO of the Connecticut Convergence Institute at the University of Connecticut to discuss the scientific community’s progress toward a potential COVID-19 vaccine.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Johnson & Johnson is proud to honor the frontline health workers courageously leading our communities through the COVID-19 crisis. Watch to meet some of these fearless frontline heroes, and learn how you can join J&J in our relentless commitment to never stop supporting them: https://bit.ly/2Y0fo50:=:https://www.jnj.com/our-company/backthefrontline “The Road to a Vaccine” airs every Tuesday at 12 PM EDT right here on Facebook.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Have you ever wondered how a vaccine is manufactured? In episode 3 of “The Road to a Vaccine,” leading scientific experts join host Lisa Ling to explore the answer to this, and discuss the steps that the scientific community is taking to accelerate the production of a potential COVID-19 vaccine. Tune in at 12pm EDT this Tuesday, April 28 on Facebook to watch LIVE.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: In Episode 2 of “The Road to a Vaccine,” host Lisa Ling and Dan Carucci, MD, MSC, PhD, Global Medical Director at McCann Health, reflect on life before COVID-19, how the world has changed since the outbreak, and ways to adapt to this cultural shift. Watch to learn more, and don’t forget to tune in LIVE every Tuesday at 12 pm ET for a new episode of “The Road to Vaccine" here on Facebook.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: "The Road to a Vaccine" host Lisa Ling speaks with Dan Barouch, MD, PhD, from Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center, about the 72-hour journey scientists took the minute China released the sequence of the COVID-19 virus. Watch to learn more about the scientists’ journey to find a viable vaccine candidate, and don’t forget to tune LIVE in every Tuesday at 12 pm ET for a new episode of “The Road to Vaccine” here on Facebook.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: The latest Johnson & Johnson Innovation healthcare incubator poised to help advance breakthrough ideas aimed at safeguarding people around the world from pandemics like COVID-19? JLABS @ Washington, D.C., launched in collaboration with The U.S. Government’s Biomedical Advanced Research and Development Authority and Children’s National Hospital. In advance of the innovation hub’s opening, learn how the researchers and scientists at this new JLABS will aim to work toward helping transform the health and well-being of people around the world, and help protect the communities we all live in from pandemics—today and into the future.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Hanneke Schuitemaker, Ph.D., Vice President and Global Head of Viral Vaccine Discovery and Translational Medicine, Janssen Vaccines & Prevention B.V., shares how her team is working at accelerated speeds to help develop a COVID-19 vaccine. Hear firsthand how the team is leveraging their extensive experience with Ebola and Zika to speed up the process.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: “What I love about working on vaccines is that they can help improve human health equally for people in developed and developing nations.” — Roland Zahn, Ph.D., Senior Scientific Director of Preclinical Immunology of Viral Vaccines, The Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson. Weeks before many people had even heard of COVID-19, Dr. Zahn and his team were already working at record speed to study the virus—and how it could be stopped. Learn more about his experience working on what may prove to be the biggest challenge of his career: helping to develop and test a vaccine for the novel coronavirus.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Three leading scientists who have been on the frontlines of Zika, malaria and HIV give you the inside scoop on vaccine development and the process of going from lab to clinic.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: In today's episode of “The Road to a Vaccine,” host Lisa Ling will speak to Johnson & Johnson scientist Hanneke Schuitemaker, Dr. Dan Barouch of Harvard Medical School and Dr. Daniel Carucci of McCann as they discuss leveraging the latest technologies to accelerate the development and manufacturing of a COVID-19 vaccine. Tune in today, April 21, at 12pm EDT to watch LIVE here on Facebook.

Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Together with Global Citizen, Johnson & Johnson presented a night of music and action to battle COVID-19 on April 18. The event is over, but the crisis isn’t, and the efforts of the World Health Organization (WHO) continue as our scientists work 24/7 on our lead COVID-19 vaccine. Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: In episode 2 of “The Road to a Vaccine,” host Lisa Ling and leading scientific experts will discuss how they are leveraging the latest technologies to accelerate the development and manufacturing of a COVID-19 vaccine. Tune in at 12 PM EDT this Tuesday, April 21, here on Facebook to watch LIVE.

Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Together with Global Citizen, Johnson & Johnson is presenting a night of music and action tomorrow, April 18, to battle COVID-19. Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: What can we do to mitigate the spread and impact of COVID-19? Dr. Tom Ingelsby, Director, Center for Public Health at Johns Hopkins Bloomberg School of Public Health and “The Road to a Vaccine” host Lisa Ling discuss the collective global measures needed to help contain the virus and what a potential roadmap to recovery could look like.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Healthcare workers on the frontlines of the COVID-19 crisis need our support. That’s why Johnson & Johnson is joining forces with Global Citizen and the World Health Organization (WHO) for One World: Together At Home—a one-night special event on April 18. Tune in and take action: https://glblctzn.me/34aQLUB:=:https://www.globalcitizen.org/en/connect/togetherathome/?utm_source=social_platform&utm_medium=platformglobal_partner&utm_campaign=oneworld_launch&utm_content=signup

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: What exactly is a vaccine, and how would a coronavirus vaccine work? Watch as “The Road to a Vaccine” host Lisa Ling speaks to Dr. Rinke Bos, Principal Scientist, Vaccines, Johnson & Johnson, about the difference between a vaccine and a medication, the approach to creating a vaccine unique to this novel coronavirus and the key role your immune system’s memory plays in prevention.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: After Johnson & Johnson identified a lead COVID-19 vaccine candidate, the decision to make the vaccine available on a not-for-profit basis was a “no brainer” for Alex Gorsky, Chairman & CEO, J&J. Guided by Our Credo, learn how Gorsky has used a people-first approach to lead J&J—from his start at the company in 1988 through to today’s global pandemic: https://bit.ly/3bavHQB:=:https://www.jnj.com/latest-news/johnson-johnson-ceo-alex-gorsky-financial-times-on-potential-covid-19-vaccine

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: “There will be a lot of activity in the scientific community to make sure this never happens again.” — Dr. Paul Stoffels, Vice Chairman of the Executive Committee and Chief Scientific Officer, Johnson & Johnson, on how COVID-19 will influence pandemic preparedness worldwide. From diagnostic networks to help quickly understand new viruses that emerge to vaccine platforms and therapeutics that can treat these viruses, watch as Dr. Stoffels speaks to "The Road to a Vaccine" host Lisa Ling on what life will look like before a vaccine and once a vaccine is developed, as well as the steps the scientific community will take to ensure they are equipped to help combat global viruses moving forward.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: In this episode of The Road to a Vaccine, host Lisa Ling interviews scientists and healthcare workers about how vaccines work, the impact of the novel coronavirus and what’s being done globally to create a COVID-19 vaccine.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Thank you so much for watching The Road to a Vaccine. We apologize for the technical issues that you may have experienced, which we’re currently working to address. We will replay the show soon here. Please stay tuned for updates.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Join journalist and host Lisa Ling as she interviews scientists and healthcare workers about how vaccines work, the impact of the novel coronavirus and what’s being done globally to create a COVID-19 vaccine.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Each week Lisa Ling, the host of our new series “The Road to a Vaccine,” will be joined by leading scientists and experts who will provide their unique perspectives into the COVID-19 pandemic and the search for a critical solution. Tune in LIVE here on Facebook every Tuesday starting April 14 at 12 PM ET.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: In “The Road to a Vaccine”—a new live video series hosted by Lisa Ling—Johnson & Johnson will share a behind-the-scenes look into the complex process of developing a COVID-19 vaccine. Tune in LIVE here on Facebook every Tuesday starting on April 14 at 12 PM ET and learn more about the show: https://bit.ly/3c5kxfX:=:https://www.jnj.com/latest-news/the-road-to-covid-19-vaccine-live-video-series

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Johnson & Johnson is proud to introduce "The Road to a Vaccine"—a groundbreaking new live series hosted by journalist Lisa Ling, exploring the complex process of developing a COVID-19 vaccine. Starting on April 14, join us every Tuesday at 12 PM ET as leading scientists and experts discuss helping combat the global pandemic. Learn more: https://bit.ly/3c5kxfX:=:https://www.jnj.com/latest-news/the-road-to-covid-19-vaccine-live-video-series

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: From before the Spanish Flu to the COVID-19 pandemic of today, Johnson & Johnson has worked to champion the leadership, needs and impact of frontline health workers. This World Health Worker Week, learn how J&J remains committed to doing our part through the recent commitment of $50 million to help fulfill the immediate needs of these health workers, from Lauren Moore, Vice President, Global Community Impact, J&J: https://bit.ly/3au4eJp:=:https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/best-humanity-supporting-frontlines-covid-19-pandemic-lauren-moore/?trackingId=STgRt8InQLeMWnAP4lyANw%3D%3D

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Johnson & Johnson remains committed to doing our part to make a COVID-19 vaccine available and affordable globally as quickly as possible, but there is one simple way to stay healthy today: Wash your hands. Join Dr. Paul Stoffels, Vice Chairman of the Executive Committee and Chief Scientific Officer, J&J, for a quick and thorough handwashing.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: This World Health Day, Johnson & Johnson is proud to join the World Health Organization (WHO) in championing the nurses and midwives courageously working on the frontlines of the COVID-19 pandemic. Learn more about the ways J&J is helping support these health workers, including a $50 million pledge to fulfill their immediate needs: https://bit.ly/39wVelm:=:https://www.jnj.com/covid-19/frontline-workers

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: "We have to flatten the curve in order to allow healthcare systems to deal with the number of people getting sick.
