This will take effort from all of us." — Dr. Paul Stoffels, Vice Chairman of the Executive Committee and Chief Scientific Officer, Johnson & Johnson, on the state of COVID-19 in Europe. Learn more about our efforts to help address this global pandemic: jnj.com/coronavirus:=:https://www.jnj.com/coronavirus

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Alex Gorsky, Chairman and Chief Executive Officer, Johnson & Johnson, shares his thoughts on the Company’s selection of a lead vaccine candidate for COVID-19 and that the Company could have the first batches of a vaccine available for emergency-use authorization in early 2021. Read more: https://bit.ly/2Jpf8UL:=:https://www.jnj.com/latest-news/johnson-johnson-ceo-alex-gorsky-announces-coronavirus-vaccine-candidate

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: JUST IN: Johnson & Johnson announces a lead vaccine candidate for COVID-19 along with a landmark partnership with the U.S. Government's Biomedical Advanced Research and Development Authority to together commit over $1 billion dollars of investment to co-fund vaccine research, development and clinical testing and expects to initiate human clinical studies of its lead vaccine candidate at the latest by September 2020. As part of this, the Company will also expand its manufacturing capacity to ensure global supply of more than one billion doses of a safe and effective vaccine. Learn more: https://bit.ly/3atDBEv:=:https://www.jnj.com/media-center/press-releases/johnson-johnson-announces-a-lead-vaccine-candidate-for-covid-19-landmark-new-partnership-with-u-s-department-of-health-human-services-and-commitment-to-supply-one-billion-vaccines-worldwide-for-emergency-pandemic-use

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: “I had to do my part as a doctor. I thought to myself: If the frontline isn’t safe, then nowhere is safe, so I must go.” —Dongchen Zhou, M.D., a practicing cardiologist in Hangzhou, Zhejiang Province, China, who traveled to Wuhan to serve on the frontlines of the COVID-19 outbreak. To support healthcare providers like Dr. Zhou and help them provide safe and effective care to those who need it most, Johnson & Johnson has mobilized quickly to provide over $3.7 million in personal protective equipment to frontline health workers. This National Doctors' Day, learn more about Dr. Zhou’s experience at the epicenter of the outbreak, and how personal protective equipment helped him do what he does best—care for patients.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: As part of our commitment to championing those on the frontlines of the COVID-19 response, Johnson & Johnson is proud to pledge $50 million to fulfill the immediate needs of frontline health workers. Learn more about the ways J&J is helping support those who are courageously delivering care to the most vulnerable patients around the world: https://bit.ly/3dCP4Dp:=:https://www.jnj.com/latest-news/johnson-johnson-announces-a-50-million-commitment-to-support-frontline-health-workers-battling-covid-19

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: At Johnson & Johnson, we are doing all we can to help people everywhere during this global pandemic. From research and manufacturing, to our experience in HIV, Ebola and Zika, to our dedicated scientists worldwide, learn how J&J is stepping up to address COVID-19 from Dr. Paul Stoffels, Executive Vice President and Chief Scientific Officer, J&J. More: http://bit.ly/2tP2qL0:=:https://www.jnj.com/latest-news/what-you-need-to-know-about-coronavirus-and-a-potential-johnson-johnson-vaccine

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: How is Johnson & Johnson working to hold steady and meet consumer and patient needs during the COVID-19 pandemic? Kathy Wengel, Chief Supply Chain Officer, J&J, shares how our supply chain team is working tirelessly to meet the needs of those who rely on our products—all while ensuring the well-being of our employees remains a top priority.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Just a year after starting All Girls Code—a nonprofit initiative helping introduce women in the Middle East to STEM in an empowering environment—90% of the girls who've attended Aya Mouallem's programs, and applied to universities, have chosen to pursue STEM fields. Learn more about the Knight-Hennessy Scholars Program recipient and how she is working to make a difference for women in science.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Listen as two of the first healthcare providers to treat the Ebola virus in the U.S.—members of Emory University’s Serious Communicable Diseases Unit, Sharon Vanairsdale, APRN, and Colleen Kraft, MD—share their innovative approaches for helping create a culture of safety and an affinity for preparedness to prevent the spread of deadly infections in this episode of See You Now, a podcast from Johnson & Johnson and the American Nurses Association: seeyounowpodcast.com

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: As the COVID-19 pandemic continues to expand, Johnson & Johnson is committed to helping ensure and protect the personal health of our employees and their families around the world. Guided by this commitment, J&J has instituted an expanded policy allowing all employees in medium- to high-risk areas who can perform their duties from home to work remotely. These concrete individual actions are one step in helping support the collective response to this global threat. We are also committed to protecting those employees whose continued physical presence at work is necessary to advancing our science—including work to combat this new virus—and ensuring that patients and consumers around the world have consistent access to our most essential medicines and products. We are taking all measures possible to ensure their continued health and safety while they perform their essential jobs. Learn more about our response to this outbreak: jnj.com/coronavirus:=:https://www.jnj.com/coronavirus

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: True or false: Storing medications on a high shelf will keep kids safe. False. In about 50% of OTC poisoning cases, a child climbed on a chair or some other item to reach the medication. This National Poison Prevention Week, learn the best ways to store your OTC and prescription medication and how to keep little ones out of harm's way with these safety tips.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: “I wake up every day and say, ‘Wow, I love my life. What a gift.’” — Gary Siler (left), who at age 23 received a shocking rheumatoid arthritis diagnosis while he was working to pursue his lifelong dream of becoming a firefighter. Over time, thanks to an intravenous biologic treatment, Siler was able to finely-tune his condition, eventually becoming captain of his fire department. This National Autoimmune Disease Awareness Month, meet more inspiring people like Siler who are part of the 50 million Americans living with chronic autoimmune conditions—and learn about the battle to get their lives back after debilitating diagnoses.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Did you know that new research from the American Cancer Society suggests that colorectal cancer is now being diagnosed in adults under the age of 50 at record rates? Learn how you can help protect yourself from the cancer no matter what your age, as we share the latest science-backed information on who’s most at risk, how best to prevent the disease and why there’s growing hope for people who receive a diagnosis.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: What can we learn about past pandemics to fight future outbreaks? The CNN Film “Unseen Enemy: Pandemic,” brought to you by Johnson & Johnson, airs tonight at 11 PM ET. Learn more about the documentary: http://bit.ly/3aLmm14:=:https://www.jnj.com/latest-news/unseen-enemy-film-looks-at-why-zika-ebola-and-influenza-are-so-prevalent

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Stained-glass windows may be synonymous with a soaring Renaissance cathedral, a university library or a grand estate. But for many years, a glorious series of 12 stained-glass windows featuring Johnson & Johnson employees proudly putting in a day’s work adorned the walls of a building at J&J headquarters. The works of art were commissioned by then Chairman and CEO General Robert Wood Johnson in the 1930s, who believed that stained-glass artwork was one of the most permanent and beautiful ways of creating a lasting memorial for our employees. Learn more about the unique history behind these art pieces from Margaret Gurowitz, Chief Historian, J&J.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: “Nearly half of all people with type 2 diabetes develop chronic kidney disease (CKD), putting themselves at increased risk of kidney failure and cardiovascular disease.” — Chiara Magnone, Ph.D., Vice President, Metabolic Complications, Janssen Research & Development. This World Kidney Day, learn how Magnone and her team are innovating to help change how common complications like CKD are treated—from working to create a treatment that could repair some of the early damage from CKD to exploring the idea of a once-in-a-lifetime treatment for type 2 diabetes complications.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: ✔ Embarked on the next phase of testing a promising investigational HIV vaccine regimen. ✔ Committed to providing up to 700,000 courses of an investigational vaccine regimen to people in the Democratic Republic of the Congo and Rwanda in response to the world’s second worst Ebola outbreak on record. ✔ Launched a new healthcare incubator, JLABS @ Shanghai, to provide start-up companies access to workspace and R&D infrastructure. These are just three of the many advancements Johnson & Johnson made throughout 2019 on our quest to help drive better health for all. Learn more about these milestone moments as we reflect back on our work throughout the past year—and our aspirations for the years to come.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: For Multiple Sclerosis (MS) Awareness Month, a scientist from the Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson shares how this disease—which affects nearly 1 million people in the U.S., according to the National Multiple Sclerosis Society—can impact nearly every part of the body. Learn more about common symptoms of the disease, from vision problems to trouble walking—and discover how J&J is conducting ongoing research to better understand MS in the hopes of coming up with an improved intervention.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: “Knowing you’re paying it forward gives meaning to what you do.”—Brad Heidrich, Senior Scientist at the Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson. Heidrich’s journey to cancer researcher began at age 13 when he was diagnosed with a rare form of osteosarcoma, a cancer of the bone. His battle with cancer ultimately inspired the person he would become: a Janssen scientist dedicated to working on therapies for blood cancer. This Myeloma Action Month, learn more about Heidrich’s experience and his work helping discover and develop treatments for blood cancers like multiple myeloma.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Since our inception in 1886, Johnson & Johnson has championed women and worked to provide the tools, resources and opportunities to succeed. As we continue to celebrate International Women’s Day, meet five admirable J&J women helping to advance our goal of building a more inclusive and work/life-balanced world, such as Seina Lee, PharmD, M.S., IBD DAS Commercial Strategy Lead, Immunology, Janssen Asia Pacific, who launched an inclusive mentoring program in Singapore to help foster and nurture talent.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: From 1908, when Johnson & Johnson hired its first female scientist, to 2020 when the company shattered its goal of helping 1 million girls through the J&J WiSTEM2D program by over 5 million, J&J has worked to help empower women around the world. This International Women’s Day, learn more about the ways J&J has shown our commitment to women—and meet the next generation of women that J&J and our partners are helping support and inspire in their pursuit of STEM2D studies and careers: http://bit.ly/2v0tYxn:=:https://www.jnj.com/our-heritage/how-johnson-johnson-has-supported-womens-empowerment-since-1886

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: With daylight saving time comes longer days, but it also may mean sleepier mornings as your body adjusts to the time change. From powering off your phone two hours before bed to help avoid the suppression of melatonin to working up a sweat in the morning to help boost energy, discover nine simple ways that you can help make the transition a bit easier.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Did you know that for many years, a glorious series of 12 stained-glass windows featuring Johnson & Johnson employees proudly putting in a day’s work adorned the walls of a building at J&J headquarters? The works of art were commissioned by then Chairman and CEO General Robert Wood Johnson, who believed this was the best medium through which the company could create a lasting memorial to its employees. This Employee Appreciation Day, learn about these unique art pieces and how they are an example of how important J&J has always considered its employees to be from Margaret Gurowitz, Chief Historian, J&J.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: ✔️A breath-controlled video game that can help make surgery less stressful for kids ✔️A baby bottle designed to help eliminate nipple confusion during breastfeeding These are two of the innovative ideas that won the first-ever Johnson & Johnson Nurses Innovate QuickFire Challenge. In honor of International Women's Day on March 8, learn more about these award winning bright ideas and meet two female innovators helping meet today’s challenges and invent tomorrow’s solutions.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: At the helm of the groundbreaking Imbokodo study—which is evaluating an investigational preventive HIV vaccine in sub-Saharan Africa—is professor Glenda Gray, a physician and scientist who has dedicated her life to helping make HIV history. Learn more about Dr. Grey’s innovative work on the study that’s composed exclusively of women and its potential global impact.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: From his time as a young doctor working in Africa at the start of the HIV epidemic to his career at Johnson & Johnson helping inspire colleagues and collaborators to take risks, Dr. Paul Stoffels, Vice Chairman of the Executive Committee and Chief Scientific Officer, J&J, has spent his career working to help accelerate solutions to global health crises such as HIV, tuberculosis, and the recent COVID-19 outbreak. In honor of the 2020 Pasteur Foundation Awards where Dr. Stoffels will receive the inaugural Louis Pasteur Leadership Award in Public Health, watch to learn about his commitment to helping bring innovative solutions to those who need them most.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Tonight, Johnson & Johnson celebrates Dr. Paul Stoffels, Vice Chairman of the Executive Committee & CSO, J&J, as he receives the Louis Pasteur Leadership Award in Public Health for his commitment to helping drive better health for all. Watch to learn more about his impact at J&J and in the world.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Despite the American Cancer Society reporting that U.S. cancer death rates fell more than 2% from 2016 to 2017 for lung, breast, prostate and colorectal cancer, Johnson & Johnson remains devoted to innovating to help improve the prevention, interception and curing of the disease. Learn more about our commitment to this goal as Avrum Spira, M.D., Global Head of the Lung Cancer Initiative at J&J shares how he and his team are working to help reduce lung cancer death rates even further.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Did you know that colorectal cancer is actually the third most common cancer in both men and women, and the second leading cause of cancer-related deaths, according to the American Cancer Society? This National Colorectal Cancer Awareness month, discover the latest science-backed information on who’s most at risk and how to best prevent the disease. Plus, learn how Johnson & Johnson is working to innovate new ways to not only treat the cancer, but also potentially stop the disease before it develops.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: In 1908, after graduating from the University of Minnesota, Edith Von Kuster became the first female scientist at Johnson & Johnson. In this groundbreaking role, Von Kuster joined the company’s scientific department, where she conducted research and development. This Women’s History Month, learn more about Von Kuster’s trailblazing path for women in science—and how she embodies the company’s long history of helping ignite the power of women.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: While it’s estimated there are 6,500 to 7,000 cases of Castleman disease (CD) diagnosed every year in the U.S. alone, they’re difficult to track, since the life-threatening immune system disorder is rare and often misdiagnosed. This Rare Disease Day, help spread awareness about the condition and meet two men who have the disease: David Fajgenbaum, M.D., MBA, M.Sc., a patient and doctor who created a first-of-its-kind, patient-driven registry dedicated to advancing more understanding of the condition, and Carl Guenther, a patient who’s part of the effort.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: From personalized cancer therapies to robotic surgery and new consumer health solutions, Johnson & Johnson is working to advance transformational innovations across a broad spectrum of science and technology. Learn more about the cutting-edge J&J projects with the potential help truly change the lives of people around the world from Paul Stoffels, Vice Chairman of the Executive Committee & Chief Scientific Officer, J&J.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Aldrage B. Cooper, Vice President of Corporate Affairs, Johnson & Johnson, began his long and respected career at the company in 1968. Among his many accomplishments: Championing diversity and inclusion and serving as the first African American mayor of New Brunswick, New Jersey. This Black History Month, learn more about Cooper's legendary impact to both J&J and local and international communities at large.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: At just three years old, Nora the polar bear has already faced a host of challenges. Her journey took her from Ohio to Oregon—and finally to Utah's Hogle Zoo. Here, she received a challenging surgery to repair her broken leg, thanks to a Johnson & Johnson donation of medical supplies. This International Polar Bear Day, learn about Nora’s journey through recovery and how she's helping raise awareness about protecting polar bears from warming sea temperatures. If you’re ever at the Utah's Hogle Zoo, be sure to say hi!

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: What happens when you unite top cardiologists, powerful technology and the deep healthcare expertise of the Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson? You get the team behind the Heartline™ Study. Learn more about the study that aims to determine whether technology can potentially help lead to the earlier detection of atrial fibrillation—and ultimately reduce the likelihood of stroke.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Some 157,000 patients are diagnosed with hospital-acquired pneumonia each year—and thanks to innovative research led by Dian Baker, Ph.D., the solution to preventing the condition could be as simple as better oral care during hospital stays. As part of our longstanding history of supporting nurses, Johnson & Johnson and the American Nurses Association have teamed up to launch the See You Now podcast that features stories from pioneering nurses like Baker. Ahead of her upcoming episode, learn more about this nurse innovator and her game-changing medical discovery.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Johnson & Johnson, in collaboration with Apple, has launched the Heartline™ Study—a virtual research study harnessing wearable technology and cutting-edge apps to help detect atrial fibrillation (AFib). Learn more about the first-of-its-kind study and how it has the potential to impact millions of Americans that are living with AFib and the one third who don’t even know they have it until a serious cardiovascular event, such as a stroke, occurs.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: The American Cancer Society's recent announcement gave cancer experts reason to cheer: According to the organization, the U.S. cancer death rate fell more than 2% from 2016 to 2017 for lung, breast, prostate and colorectal cancer—the largest single-year decline ever recorded. This National Cancer Prevention Month, learn what the new report means for the future of lung cancer prevention from Avrum Spira, M.D., Global Head of the Lung Cancer Initiative (LCI) at Johnson & Johnson. Spira and his team at the LCI are devoted to developing potential solutions for preventing, intercepting and curing the disease to help reduce lung cancer death rates even further.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: ✔️1 million surgical masks donated to help protect vulnerable healthcare workers ✔️1 team of Johnson & Johnson scientists hard at work on a potential preventive vaccine These are just two ways the company has mobilized quickly to help address the current COVID-19 outbreaks. Learn more about the company’s efforts to support those impacted: http://bit.ly/39n6jFO:=:https://www.jnj.com/caring-and-giving/how-johnson-johnson-is-helping-support-coronavirus-relief-efforts

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Did you know an eye exam can help detect more than 270 different medical conditions? Prioritize your eyes by getting an eye exam in 2020—and discover more tips for caring for your eyes from Johnson & Johnson Vision experts.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Collaboration is key to helping find solutions to pandemic threats like COVID-19. At the 2020 Munich Security Conference, Johnson & Johnson joined world leaders to advocate for greater preparedness in helping fight these threats and accelerate solutions to such global health crises. Learn more from Paul Stoffels, M.D., Vice Chairman of the Executive Committee and Chief Scientific Officer, J&J: http://bit.ly/2P5Tjg7:=:https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/mobilizing-resources-collaborations-fight-pandemic-paul-stoffels-md/

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Do you know how often you should wash your face? Answer: Twice a day, according to the scientists behind new Exuviance® products that have been clinically proven to help combat the signs of aging. Take this quiz to test your skincare IQ—and learn science-backed tips for how to help your skin keep its youthful, natural glow.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Which former American president gave a talk at Johnson & Johnson headquarters in New Brunswick, New Jersey, during his reelection campaign? This Presidents' Day, find out the answer from Margaret Gurowitz, Chief Historian, J&J and learn more about the company’s connections to former U.S. presidents, including the day one leader awarded J&J with a medal for a century's worth of innovation.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: “When you go through something like this, you understand the life you have is pretty precious." — Brad Heidrich, Senior Scientist at the Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson. At age 13, Brad was diagnosed with a rare form of osteosarcoma, a cancer of the bone. His battle with cancer ultimately led to unexpected gifts: a deep sense of purpose and a career helping discover and develop treatments for blood cancers. On International Childhood Cancer Day, read about Brad's incredible journey from cancer patient to researcher—and how it keeps him devoted to helping others.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: As a part of our multi-pronged response to the COVID-19 outbreak, top Johnson & Johnson scientists joined experts from around the globe at the World Health Organization (WHO) this week to identify and accelerate the science needed to help stop this global health crisis. Learn how J&J and its partners are working to help address this outbreak: http://bit.ly/39n6jFO:=:https://www.jnj.com/caring-and-giving/how-johnson-johnson-is-helping-support-coronavirus-relief-efforts

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: This Valentine's Day, Margaret Gurowitz, Chief Historian, Johnson & Johnson, shares her most beloved item from the J&J archives: a charm bracelet given to women working in the 1960s and '70s, featuring charms that depicted health innovations developed over the course of the company’s history, such as BAND-AID® Brand adhesive bandages. Learn more about this unique artifact: http://bit.ly/39Dm8sp:=:https://www.jnj.com/our-heritage/johnson-johnson-history-1960-charm-bracelet-employee-gift

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Johnson & Johnson is proud to join forces with the Biomedical Advanced Research and Development Authority and the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services to help accelerate the development of a potential novel coronavirus vaccine. Learn how J&J and its partners are working to help protect communities against the threat of a global COVID-19 pandemic: http://bit.ly/2Hk6IwZ:=:https://www.jnj.com/johnson-johnson-announces-collaboration-with-u-s-department-of-health-human-services-to-accelerate-development-of-a-potential-novel-coronavirus-vaccine

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Despite advances in treating multiple myeloma, the incurable blood cancer is still considered very difficult to manage for the over 30,000 patients diagnosed with the disease in the U.S. each year. That's why Johnson & Johnson remains committed to helping advance the field of multiple myeloma research, teaming up with Legend Biotech to work on a revolutionary new CAR-T therapy that harnesses a patient's own white blood cells to target and kill the cancer. Learn more about this unique collaboration from Sen Zhuang, M.D., Ph.D., Vice President, Oncology Clinical Research, Janssen Research & Development, J&J—and the promise it holds for patients.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: The coronavirus has continued to spread, with over 40,000 confirmed cases and more than 1,000 deaths in China, according to the World Health Organization (WHO). In response to this public health emergency, Johnson & Johnson has mobilized quickly to provide crucial donations—such as one million surgical masks to help protect vulnerable healthcare workers—to those impacted. Learn more about the company’s efforts to date: http://bit.ly/39n6jFO:=:https://www.jnj.com/caring-and-giving/how-johnson-johnson-is-helping-support-coronavirus-relief-efforts

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: One of the brave college students arrested during a lunch counter sit-in in 1961 in Sumter, South Carolina was Tillie Bing Bryant, mom of Wanda Hope, Chief Diversity & Inclusion Officer, Johnson & Johnson. During her time in jail, she wrote about her fight for equality and freedom on a roll of toilet paper—which she passed on to her daughter. This Black History Month, read what it was like for Mrs. Bryant to fight for equal rights in the 1960s—and how her spirit inspires her daughter’s work at Johnson & Johnson every day.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Fact: Lung cancer kills more men and women each year in the U.S. than breast, prostate and colon cancers combined—and up to 20% of those people have never even touched a cigarette. This National Cancer Prevention Month, learn how Johnson & Johnson is pioneering research on how to help stop lung cancer before it can start doing damage, and get advice on steps you can take to up your odds of staying healthy from scientists who've dedicated their research to help defeat the disease.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: True or false: If there's no family history, you don’t have to worry about getting cancer. Answer: False. Genetics only accounts for 5 to 10% of all cancers, according to the National Cancer Institute. This National Cancer Prevention Month, experts share the latest truths on what you really need to know about the disease, including how sleep may play a part in cancer prevention, the connection between oral health and more.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Did you know Johnson & Johnson has actually had quite a few brushes with old Hollywood glamour, like in 1942 when legendary film star Hedy Lamarr hosted a rally at J&J headquarters to help the wartime effort? Ahead of the film industry's biggest night, discover more moments when Hollywood played a starring role in our company's history from Margaret Gurowitz, Chief Historian, J&J.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: True or false: You should avoid using toner if you have dry skin. Answer: False. According to the scientists behind the new Exuviance® products that have been clinically proven to help combat the signs of aging, it's a good idea for everyone to use toner because it helps balance your skin's pH, providing a hydrating boost. Learn more science-backed tips to help keep your skin youthful and glowing in this anti-aging skincare quiz: http://bit.ly/31iI1tV:=:https://www.jnj.com/

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: "Every year in the U.S., over 30,000 patients are diagnosed with multiple myeloma, and over 11,000 patients will die from the disease." — Sen Zhuang, M.D., Ph.D., Vice President, Oncology Clinical Research, Janssen Research & Development, a member of the Johnson & Johnson family of companies. As part of our commitment to advancing the field of multiple myeloma research, J&J and Legend Biotech have teamed up to work on a revolutionary new CAR-T therapy that harnesses a patient's own white blood cells to target and kill the cancer. Learn from Dr. Zhuang about the unique collaboration and how it could potentially impact the thousands of patients diagnosed with multiple myeloma each year.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Did you know 15 to 30% of patients with atrial fibrillation don't experience any symptoms, so they have no idea they even have the potentially life-threatening condition? This American Heart Month, learn some lesser-known facts about heart health that could help keep your heart in top shape from a cardiothoracic surgeon at the Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson—and discover exciting new areas of cardiac care, like a medically certified screening and monitoring app that could measure cardiac rhythm with a smartphone camera.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: A potentially promising treatment for patients living with metastatic urothelial cancer got its start in 1997 when it was discovered that mutations in a particular gene are linked to cancer. Now, 23 years later, the treatment is accessible to people who may benefit most. On World Cancer Day, learn about the treatment’s unique journey from discovery to U.S. Food and Drug Administration approval from the tireless scientists at the Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson who helped make it happen.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: The new TV drama MTV Nishedh, part of a collaboration between Johnson & Johnson and MTV Staying Alive to help educate viewers about tuberculosis (TB) in India, stars Syed Raza Ahmed in the role of a radio producer who experiences a serious TB relapse. Get to know the actor, and learn how he's using his platform to spread awareness about the world's deadliest infectious disease—and help reduce the stigma surrounding TB for viewers across the globe.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: In the quest to identify bold, out-of-the-box ideas in every area of medicine, science and technology to help people live without illness as they age, Johnson & Johnson and the National Academy of Medicine have partnered for the U.S. Healthy Living Catalyst Awards. Learn more about the exciting new competition for healthcare innovators: http://bit.ly/3b6wt1s:=:https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/extending-human-healthspan-realize-world-without-disease-hait/?trackingId=ECqNegPwawFlpQ8W8q3oMw%3D%3D

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: "Yes, I was exhausted, and scared of things I had never thought about before, like tripping—what would happen if I fell, while my chest was being held together by pieces of wire?—but I was determined to get back to activity as fast as possible." — Cat Oyler, Vice President of Global Public Health, Johnson & Johnson. In 2017, Oyler was supposed to have a simple procedure to fix a small hole in her heart, then learned it was actually the size of an egg and required open heart surgery. As American Heart Month begins, read her powerful story of recovery—and learn how her experience inspires her to ensure that her impact on the world is as meaningful as possible.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: True or false: You can’t have oily skin as you get older. Select your guess below, then find out the correct answer by taking this anti-aging skincare quiz—and learn science-backed tips to help your skin stay youthful from the scientists behind new Exuviance® products that have been clinically proven to help combat the signs of aging: http://bit.ly/31iI1tV:=:https://www.jnj.com/health-and-wellness/anti-aging-skincare-quiz

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: ✔️ A potential vaccine for early stage Alzheimer's patients. ✔️ A memory test administered via a tablet or smartphone that could assess a common early sign of the disease through the detection of biomarkers. These are just two uniquely innovative angles scientists at the Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson are exploring to help the 13.8 million people in the United States estimated to have Alzheimer's by 2050. Learn more about J&J's efforts to find better ways to diagnose, treat and prevent the disease—and why scientists believe the future of treatment looks promising.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: As the coronavirus outbreak worsens, Johnson & Johnson has mobilized quickly to develop a potential preventive vaccine for the virus. Learn how J&J and its global partners are uniquely positioned to help meet the needs of this global crisis from our leaders, including Paul Stoffels, M.D., Vice Chairman of the Executive Committee and Chief Scientific Officer, J&J: http://bit.ly/2tP2qL0:=:https://www.jnj.com/latest-news/what-you-need-to-know-about-coronavirus-and-a-potential-johnson-johnson-vaccine

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: In an effort to help aid the coronavirus outbreak in Wuhan, China, Johnson & Johnson has mobilized to develop a potential preventive vaccine that may help protect people against the disease. In just a few short weeks the coronavirus has turned into an outbreak, with over 4,500 confirmed cases in China, according to the World Health Organization (WHO). Learn how scientists at J&J are working in real time to help avoid a global health crisis, as part of our longstanding commitment to develop preventive solutions for those who are most vulnerable: http://bit.ly/2tP2qL0:=:https://www.jnj.com/latest-news/what-you-need-to-know-about-coronavirus-and-a-potential-johnson-johnson-vaccine

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: In response to the recent series of earthquakes in Puerto Rico—including the island’s most destructive quake in a century—Johnson & Johnson is double-matching U.S. and Puerto Rico employees' monetary donations through the company's matching gifts program in an effort to aid affected communities J&J is also proud to share how employees in Guaynabo, San Lorenzo and Manatí mobilized quickly to help distribute personal care supplies, over-the-counter medicines, tents, and food. Learn more about our efforts to help those impacted by the earthquakes, and other key key moments in our long history of giving back in times of crisis.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: One common myth about weight-loss surgery: Only people who have hundreds of pounds to lose can qualify for the procedure. In reality, people may be a candidate if they have a body mass index (BMI) of 35 and one or more weight-related health conditions like type 2 diabetes or hypertension. Learn more about bariatric surgery from medical experts in the field as they help answer common questions, from the different types of bariatric surgeries to whether you can expect to gain any weight back.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Since our inception in 1886, Johnson & Johnson has championed women. Watch as Lauren Moore, Vice President, Global Community Impact, Kathy Wengel, Chief Supply Chain Officer, and Seema Kumar, Vice President of Innovation, Global Health and Policy Communication, J&J, share the importance of propelling women leaders as we continue on the quest toward gender parity in the workplace. Learn more: bit.ly/326ivaK:=:https://youbelong.jnj.com/diverse-workforce

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Are you one of the nearly 70% of Americans who smoke but want to stop? As 2020 gets underway, set yourself up for success with these tips from a behavioral expert in smoking cessation—like how to break down your goal into more easily achievable steps so you can track progress and stay motivated.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: The recent Johnson & Johnson commitment of $250 million to support frontline health workers at the 2020 World Economic Forum Annual Meeting may potentially help drive better health for all. Watch to learn more about the impact of this milestone announcement from our partners at Save the Children, the International Rescue Committee and Amref Health Africa.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Following the recent coronavirus emergence in Wuhan, China, Paul Stoffels, Vice Chairman of the Executive Committee and Chief Scientific Officer, Johnson & Johnson, details how J&J and its partners are working at the 2020 World Economic Forum to mobilize our best scientists to investigate how we can make a difference. Watch to learn more.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: “We’re at an inflection point now. I believe the next five years will see significant advances in the search for a treatment.” — Simon Lovestone, a world-renowned Alzheimer’s expert and the Neurodegeneration Disease Area Lead at Janssen Research & Development, part of the Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson. A potential vaccine for early stage Alzheimer's patients and biomarker tracking are just two uniquely innovative angles researchers are exploring to help diagnose, treat and prevent the disease. Learn more about how J&J and its partners are committed to helping the estimated 5.3 million people over the age of 65 living with the disease in the United States—and the 13.8 million people estimated to have it by 2050.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Did you know that 1 in 4 people will be affected by mental or neurological disorders, according to the World Health Organization (WHO)? Learn how Johnson & Johnson and its partners in both the public and private sector are working to transform how mental health and well-being is understood, treated and prioritized around the world at the 2020 World Economic Forum Annual Meeting.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Meet Syed Raza Ahmed, the star of the new TV drama MTV Nishedh, part of a collaboration between Johnson & Johnson and MTV Staying Alive to help educate viewers about tuberculosis (TB) in India, where half of all TB patients are under the age of 30. His role: Vicky, a happy-go-lucky radio producer whose life is turned around when he experiences a serious TB relapse. Ahead of the MTV Nishedh premiere on January 25, get to know the actor-turned-TB advocate, and learn how he hopes to help spread knowledge about the world's deadliest infectious disease through his work—and help reduce the stigma surrounding TB for viewers worldwide.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Today at the World Economic Forum 2020 Annual Meeting, Johnson & Johnson announced a $250 million commitment to support 1 million nurses, midwives and community health workers by 2030. It's time to step up to champion, empower and train the heroes that care for communities worldwide. Learn more: http://bit.ly/2sP5W7q:=:https://www.weforum.org/events/world-economic-forum-annual-meeting-2020/sessions/press-conference-delivering-on-the-urgent-need-for-frontline-healthcare-workers

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Did you know that Tuberculosis (TB) is the world’s deadliest infectious disease, killing more people in 2018 than HIV and malaria deaths combined? Learn how Johnson & Johnson and its partners are working to help eliminate TB by 2030 through a new workplace initiative aimed at raising awareness and increasing access to prevention, screening, diagnosis, treatment and care at the 2020 World Economic Forum Annual Meeting. Together, this initiative will potentially improve the health of hundreds of millions of lives.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: From a $500 million commitment over the next 5 years in world-class research and delivery programs to the first (BAND-AID®)(RED) campaign launched to support the HIV/AIDS community, Johnson & Johnson is working to help make HIV history. Watch to learn more about our efforts at the 2020 World Economic Forum Annual Meeting from Paul Stoffels, M.D., Vice Chairman of the Executive Committee and Chief Scientific Officer, J&J.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Johnson & Johnson is proud to receive a spot on Fortune’s World’s Most Admired Companies list for the 18th consecutive year, recognized for our innovative spirit and commitment to social responsibility. Learn more about the reasons why J&J is the highest-ranked healthcare company to make the prestigious list.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: This week, Johnson & Johnson joins top innovators in government, business and society at the World Economic Forum Annual Meeting to collaborate on ways we can develop and deliver innovative health solutions. Follow us as we share conversations on the most pressing health challenges like disease eradication and mental health.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: On February 21, 1961, college students at Morris College, a historically black college in Sumter, South Carolina participated in a lunch counter sit-in to protest civil rights for all Americans. One of those students: Tillie Bing Bryant, the mother of Wanda Bryant Hope, Chief Diversity & Inclusion Officer, Johnson & Johnson. She was arrested for participating, and while in jail, chronicled her desire for equal rights on a roll of toilet paper. In the spirit of Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. and the many courageous people like Mrs. Bryant who helped advance a more inclusive world, J&J is proud to encourage our employees to give back and serve the communities where they work and live. This MLK Jr. Day, learn how Mrs. Bryant’s bravery helped inspire Wanda Hope to make a difference—a spirit that she sees every day at J&J: http://bit.ly/2u6td56:=:https://www.jnj.com/personal-stories/a-mothers-inspiration-how-my-moms-brave-actions-helped-shape-my-future

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Like many across the world, Johnson & Johnson has been deeply moved by the scale of the devastating bushfires that have swept Australia. In response, the company is donating a total of $600,000 in financial support to the Australian Red Cross and Vinnies Australia to help aid people in the affected areas, as well as 200,000 units of personal care items through Foodbank Australia. Our thoughts are with those directly impacted by the fires and involved in disaster relief efforts. Learn more about the way J&J is working to help support the country, now and in the coming months.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Can you imagine a world where human DNA is used to help intercept diseases like cancer or Alzheimer’s before they even start? That’s the goal of the UK Biobank Whole Genome Sequencing project, a historic partnership between the Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson, the UK government, the Wellcome Trust and others, which hopes to gain insights about the causes and consequences of certain diseases from the volunteers’ DNA and medical records. Learn more about the largest human genome sequencing project in the world, and its potential to change how we approach disease prevention—and help shed light on why some people may develop certain diseases but others may not.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: “We go after big challenges and try to find the right solutions for people around the world." — Thibaut Mongon, Executive Vice President and Worldwide Chairman of Consumer Health, Johnson & Johnson, on what excites him most about leading the Consumer Health business which includes brands like the ZYRTEC® and Neutrogena®. Learn how Mongon and his team are working to help change the trajectory of personal health through innovative products and solutions, like using a mix of artificial intelligence (AI) and live consumer care representatives on social media platforms—including Facebook—to answer customers’ questions quickly and accurately, in this Q&A.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Johnson & Johnson has announced a pledge of $600,000 in financial support to the Australian Red Cross and Vinnies Australia to help aid people in Australia afflicted by the large-scale fires, as well as a donation of 200,000 units of personal care items through Foodbank Australia. Our thoughts are with those directly affected by the fires, as well as the brave firefighters, community groups and volunteers involved in disaster relief efforts. Learn more about J&J's efforts to support the affected communities in Australia both now and in the coming months.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Did you know that although roughly 1/4 of American adults vowed to shed pounds at the start of 2017, they may have found themselves doing so in the years that followed, too, since almost 50% of people wind up setting the same goals year after year? If you vowed to lose weight this year, these simple, behavior-based tips—like how to associate losing weight with making life more enjoyable and how to make changes to your routine that you can stick to for the long haul—that can help set you up for success in 2020 and beyond.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: 600 billion. That's how many pages of genetic data the UK Biobank Whole Genome Sequencing Project expects it will yield from over 500,000 volunteers participating in the groundbreaking genome sequencing project. The project’s goal: gain insights about the causes and consequences of diseases like cancer and Alzheimer’s from the volunteers' DNA and medical records. Learn about Johnson & Johnson's role in this historic collaboration with the UK government, the Wellcome Trust and others—and why it has the potential to help shed light on why some people may develop certain diseases but others may not.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: ✔️Robotics solutions for orthopedic surgery ✔️A potential new treatment for multiple myeloma that harnesses the power of a patient’s own immune system ✔️Hyper-personalized skincare solutions that offer behavior coaching and artificial intelligence to help each consumer’s unique journey. These are just three cutting-edge projects underway at Johnson & Johnson that could potentially help propel healthcare forward around the globe. Learn more about these inspiring innovations from six visionary leaders at the company.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: The goal of the U.S. Healthy Living Catalyst Awards, a unique collaboration between Johnson & Johnson and the National Academy of Medicine? Identify bold, out-of-the-box ideas in every area of medicine, science and technology to help people live without illness as they age. Learn more about the new, global competition for healthcare innovators and how it can help improve health for all.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: ✔️An oral flu vaccine in the form of a pill ✔️A “universal” flu vaccine that may potentially take away the burden of almost yearly updates ✔️A compound to help cut viral load These are three innovative ideas scientists at the Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson are exploring to help prevent and treat the flu. This flu season, take a deeper look at their commitment to identifying new and improved ways to tackle the virus.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Do you routinely have trouble falling or staying asleep? If so, you're not alone: 35% of Americans report "poor" or "only fair" sleep quality, according to the National Sleep Foundation. If you want to catch more Zs and wake up feeling more refreshed in the new year, discover these five simple tips from top sleep researchers that may help, like taking time to unwind—without your phone—before bed.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: One unexpected place to find fresh inspiration as you kick off the new year at work? Draft emails. Learn why Alex Gorsky, Chairman and CEO of Johnson & Johnson, believes having the courage to hit send could lead to new solutions that help change the world: http://bit.ly/2QtTeUF

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Johnson & Johnson coined the term "immorbidity" to describe a long-lived life without diseases that typically come with age, like Alzheimer's and cardiovascular disease—and it's the inspiration behind the U.S. Healthy Longevity Catalyst Awards, a new global competition in partnership with the National Academy of Medicine. The competition’s goal? Reward innovative ideas in every area of medicine, science and technology that can help people live longer and healthier. Learn more about the exciting competition for healthcare innovators—and the futuristic field of “immorbidity.”

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: ✔️The groundbreaking female-focused Imbokodo study that’s evaluating an investigational preventive HIV vaccine in sub-Saharan Africa, led by Professor Glenda Gray. ✔️Dr. Wayne Drevets’ innovations in treatments for mental health disorders like depression. ✔️Dr. Chiara Magnone, Ph.D., and her use of precision medicine to potentially help treat type 2 diabetes and its related complications. These are just three Johnson & Johnson visionaries who inspired us this past year with their innovative spirit. Get to know more of J&J’s dedicated scientists and researchers who work closely with us on potentially life-changing research.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: In 2019, there were many milestones that helped Johnson & Johnson make this a memorable year for helping improve the health and well-being of people across the globe, from the first (BAND-AID®)(RED) campaign launched to help make HIV history to a newly FDA-approved treatment for metastatic urothelial cancer patients. Take a look back at even more major J&J milestones that helped change the trajectory of health for humanity this past year.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Robotics solutions for orthopedic surgery and a treatment for multiple myeloma that harnesses the power of a patient’s own immune system are just two cutting-edge projects that Johnson & Johnson visionaries are leading with the potential to help truly change the lives of people around the world in 2020. Meet six leaders across the company, and learn what their teams have been working on that could potentially help advance the trajectory of health for humanity for patients across the globe.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Pennsylvania Railroad passengers passing through central New Jersey around December 31, 1915 were likely greeted by an eye-catching electric sign that read “Happy New Year.” Underneath the greeting? The Johnson & Johnson name, letting travelers know they'd reached New Brunswick, NJ, home to the company's main headquarters. This New Year's Eve, learn more about the iconic sign from J&J's Chief Historian Margaret Gurowitz, and discover its role in spreading messages of cheer, patriotism and more: http://bit.ly/2F867x7:=:https://www.jnj.com/our-heritage/unique-1915-happy-new-year-message-from-johnson-johnson

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Are you or your family planning to start a wellness regimen in the new year? To help you achieve your health goals, Johnson & Johnson-affiliated experts share their tips for every month of the year, from staying active and getting better sleep to easy ways to improve your oral hygiene.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: One milestone way Johnson & Johnson helped advance health for humanity in 2019? By providing the first courses of an investigational Ebola vaccine regimen to the Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC) and Rwanda to help support against the current outbreak in the DRC. As we approach the new year, learn more about some of the 2019 J&J breakthroughs that helped advance health worldwide, including the first (BAND-AID®)(RED) Campaign to help make HIV history and a newly FDA-approved treatment for metastatic urothelial cancer patients.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Throughout the storied history of Johnson & Johnson, the company and its employees have mobilized to help communities across the world in times of crisis, including donating medical supplies to U.S. troops during the Spanish-American War in 1898, funding Save the Children US programs to help strengthen the resilience of refugee children and their parents, and supplying 2 tons of products to those affected by the massive Brazilian dam collapse in January 2019. During the season of giving back, learn about more key moments throughout history where the company has helped those in need.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Did you know Johnson & Johnson used to produce holiday-themed gift wrap tape? This holiday season, go back in time with Margaret Gurowitz, Chief Historian, J&J, as she shares the surprising reason why the company branched out to produce decorative tape in the early 1920s, featuring popular holiday motifs like candy canes.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: “Innovation depends on finding great ideas, whether from within our own walls or from around the world, regardless of ethnicity, geography, gender or generation.” —Seema Kumar, Vice President of Innovation, Global Health and Policy Communication, Johnson & Johnson, on the importance of diverse ideas and collaborative thinking to help improve healthcare. Innovators from multicultural backgrounds are invited to share their potentially groundbreaking ideas for the J&J Diversity in Innovation QuickFire Challenge until January 17, 2020. Learn more about the QuickFire Challenge—designed to harness unique experiences and backgrounds to spark potential solutions in an effort to create a better, healthier world—which offers up to $250,000 in grant funding and mentoring to U.S.-based innovators: JLABS.buzz/diversity:=:http://JLABS.buzz/diversity

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: This year was full of inspiring—and potentially life-changing—medical advancements, thanks to ten scientists relentlessly pushing their visions and research forward. Get to know these innovative researchers and learn about their groundbreaking work, from a female-focused study of an investigational preventive HIV vaccine to research into immuno-oncology therapy treatments for cancer.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Still searching to find the perfect stocking stuffers? Check out these 12 adorable—and affordable—Johnson & Johnson gifts for everyone on your list that prove good things come in small packages: http://bit.ly/2PdpM4J:=:https://www.jnj.com/health-and-wellness/stocking-stuffer-ideas-from-johnson-johnson

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: As part of Johnson & Johnson's longstanding commitment to championing nurses, the company launched its first Nurses Innovate QuickFire Challenge this year, inviting nurses across the U.S. to submit ideas for practical innovations that can help transform lives, with the winning innovators receiving up to $100,000 in grants, mentoring from J&J experts, and access to JLABS’ eco-system of healthcare start-ups. Meet the three winners behind bright ideas like a breathing-controlled video game to help children achieve calm before heading into surgery, and join J&J in thanking all the nurses who’ve brought innovation to patient care.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: ✔️Provided the first courses of an investigational Ebola vaccine regimen to the Democratic Republic of the Congo and Rwanda. ✔️Launched the first (BAND-AID®)(RED) campaign to help make HIV History. ✔️Received the first FDA approval for a new treatment for metastatic urothelial cancer patients. These are just a few of the many Johnson & Johnson milestones reached in 2019. As we prepare for the new year, learn more about these latest advancements in our quest to help address unmet health needs around the world.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Not only did Fred Kilmer establish Johnson & Johnson’s Aseptic Department as Director of Scientific Affairs from 1889 to 1934, he also was a master of communication, serving as J&J’s Chief Publicity Officer overseeing advertising and outreach to doctors, pharmacists and the public. On the anniversary of Kilmer’s birth month, learn more about the Renaissance man’s remarkable story and the crucial role he played in building J&J into the scientific powerhouse it is today.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: For most of the first two years of Matthew Houder’s life, he was unable to sit up, crawl, walk or talk, and had to be fed through a tube due to an extreme spine curvature at birth. Then, an orthopedic surgeon at the Children's Hospital of Philadelphia built a plan for the young boy: Build an internal scaffolding to create the space the boy’s curved spine couldn’t provide, using a Johnson & Johnson Medical Devices Company device. Now, he’s a fun brother to three siblings and, like many kids his age, loves YouTube videos. During this season of hope, meet more inspiring patients like Matthew who've triumphed over adversity, thanks in part to J&J's medical devices, programs, and products that are helping change the trajectory of health for humanity worldwide.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Johnson & Johnson is proud to be an exclusive media sponsor of Global Citizen’s Global Citizen Prize, an award show honoring 5 individuals who have made an extraordinary impact in 2019, hosted by John Legend and featuring incredible musical performances. Tune in to the celebrations December 20 at 8/7C on NBC.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Did you know there are trillions of microorganisms living in your gut t called the microbiome? They might just be the key to helping treat inflammatory bowel disease (IBD)-related conditions like Crohn's disease and ulcerative colitis. Meet one scientist, Esi Lamousé-Smith, M.D., Ph.D., Senior Director, Translational Science & Medicine, Immunology, Janssen Research & Development, part of the Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson, exploring the microbiome’s role in IBD, and learn how her team’s research could potentially help change the lives of people with the disease.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: "The women who have volunteered to participate in Imbokodo are the true heroes." — Professor Glenda Gray, chair of the groundbreaking Imbokodo study, which is evaluating an investigational preventative HIV vaccine in sub-Saharan Africa, where young women are twice as likely to be living with HIV than men. In honor of AIDS Awareness Month, meet Professor Gray and learn more about the study—composed exclusively of women—and its potential global impact.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: When 1-year-old Gamai was severely burned in her family's small kitchen in Conakry, Guinea, her parents rushed her to the hospital, only to be told by doctors they didn't have a proper burn unit—and that unless she traveled outside of the country for a complicated skin graft procedure, she would likely spend her life immobile. Enter Mercy Ships, the largest nongovernmental fleet of hospital ships in the world that delivers critical surgical care and trains local healthcare providers so they can help patients on the ground. After a complex operation aboard their Africa Mercy ship, Gamai can now move comfortably—and already has plans to become a doctor when she grows up. On Human Rights Day, learn about Johnson & Johnson's three-decade partnership supporting Mercy Ships’ life-saving work—and how the floating hospital is helping give patients like Gamai hope for a better future.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Looking to make 2020 your healthiest year yet? Whether you may be interested in improving your mind, body, or spirit, the end of the year is the perfect time to take stock and assess where you want to go in the long term. From tips for getting fitter to kickstarting your career or finding more time for passion projects, career, fitness and behavior change experts at J&J share how you can turn vague resolutions into a concrete plan so you can start 2020 primed for purpose—and total package wellness.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: While the cold weather may bring dull, drab and dry hair, skin and nails, there are easy, DIY tips that can help. Learn more as dermatologists share their expert tips for keeping the effects of cold weather at bay—like a natural remedy to slough dry lips and ease a dry scalp—that can each be done in five minutes or less.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: As World War I and the deadly Spanish influenza virus raged on in 1918, one Johnson & Johnson employee named Katherine Hannan decided to step up and put her nursing skills to use, serving as a field nurse for the U.S. Army, and later on, as chief nurse of the Evacuation Hospital for the American Expeditionary Forces, where she and fellow nurses treated wounded soldiers and those suffering from the flu. This National Influenza Vaccination Week, learn more about the intrepid nurse, and how her commitment to giving back, stepping up and helping when help was needed are still leadership qualities that are important at J&J to this day.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Every year in the U.S., over 30,000 patients are diagnosed with multiple myeloma, an incurable blood cancer and nearly all will relapse or develop resistance to treatments. Johnson & Johnson has been a leader in advancing the field of multiple myeloma research to help these patients, and is teaming up with an emerging biotech company on a groundbreaking CAR-T therapy that harnesses a patient's own white blood cells to target and kill the cancer. As J&J presents new data at the American Society of Hematology Annual Meeting & Exposition this week, meet Sen Zhuang, M.D., Ph.D., Vice President, Oncology Clinical Research, Janssen Research & Development, a member of the Johnson & Johnson family of companies, who’s helping develop the therapy, and learn about the challenges of treating multiple myeloma—and how this therapy could potentially impact patients.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: “I have HIV.” — Jens Van Roey, M.D., former Director of Global Clinical Development, Global Public Health, Johnson & Johnson, who in 1988, after running a hospital in the Democratic Republic of the Congo, received a shocking diagnosis that forever changed his life. This AIDS Awareness Month, learn more about Dr. Van Roey’s journey—from his devastating diagnosis and work helping others around the world with the disease to shed their stigma, to his time as a trailblazing HIV/AIDS researcher at J&J.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Learning the basics of developing a mobile application with the help of Johnson & Johnson IT leaders is just one of the many skills high school students gained during this summer’s Girls Who Code seven-week Summer Immersion Program, held at the J&J Raritan campus. Learn more about the immersive program—and our longstanding commitment to ignite the power of women—as two participants reflect on their life-changing experience.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: For the second year in a row, Johnson & Johnson is proud to rank in the top 10% of Disability:IN and American Association of People with Disabilities’s index of Best Places to Work for People with Disabilities. One of the unique ways J&J is working to create an inclusive environment for all employees? Through the Mental Health Diplomats program, which helps people with "hidden" disabilities like depression get the support they need at work. On International Day of Persons with Disabilities, discover more ways J&J is helping inspire a supportive environment for all in our inaugural “You Belong: Diversity & Inclusion Impact Review.” (Note: This image contains models and is being used for illustrative purposes only.)

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Millions of people worldwide live with inflammatory bowel disease (IBD), and yet identifying new IBD treatments is challenging since relatively little is known about how it originates. Enter Esi Lamousé-Smith, M.D., Ph.D., Senior Director, Translational Science & Medicine, Immunology, Janssen Research & Development, part of the Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson, a researcher exploring the microbiome’s role in IBD and how it might just be the key to helping treat conditions such as ulcerative colitis. Meet the researcher and learn what the future of IBD treatment could look like for patients coping with it.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: "I did what many wouldn't—I removed my gloves and touched the patients.” —5B Film’s Alison Paolercio, a nurse who helped pioneer AIDS patient care in the 1980s as part of San Francisco General Hospital’s Ward 5B—the first dedicated AIDS unit in the U.S. This World AIDS Day, meet Alison and others on the quest toward an HIV-free world, including a scientist leading HIV vaccine research at the Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson and an HIV+ advocate whose life work is to educate teens about the disease.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Can you imagine an HIV-free world? It’s a bold vision that drives Dr. Hanneke Schuitemaker, Global Head of Viral Vaccine Discovery and Translational Medicine, Janssen Vaccines & Prevention B.V., forward. Ahead of World AIDS Day, learn more about this pioneering scientist’s 20+ year career researching HIV/AIDS ––and an exciting milestone Johnson & Johnson has reached in our mission to help make HIV history: http://bit.ly/2xWLTTK

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: One Johnson & Johnson invention to be thankful for? BAND-AID® Brand adhesive bandages, which were Invented nearly 100 years ago by a J&J employee to help cooks treat nicks and other cooking related injuries. In the spirit of Thanksgiving, J&J Chief Historian Margaret Gurowitz spotlights a few of the many ways the company has helped revolutionize modern life, from the medicine cabinet to the hospital, that we’re grateful for.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: In 1983, 5B Film's Cliff Morrison did what many other nurses wouldn’t: Come up with a humane way to treat and care for AIDS patients by opening Ward 5B at San Francisco General Hospital, the first dedicated AIDS unit in the U.S. Ahead of World AIDS Day, Johnson & Johnson is proud to share Cliff’s story and champion the nurses on the front lines who are continuing his approach of compassionate care. Learn more about Cliff—and how the legacy of Ward 5B lives on: http://bit.ly/2Zt9YAZ

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Johnson & Johnson is proud to partner with Emmy-nominated actress and transgender activist Laverne Cox and (RED) in the crusade to #makeHIVhistory. In honor of World AIDS Day on December 1, learn about Cox’s passion for HIV/AIDS advocacy, why she joined the (BAND-AID®)RED bandages campaign—and how we can all #bandtogether to help support the HIV/AIDS community: http://bit.ly/2OHF6Fb:=:https://www.jnj.com/personal-stories/laverne-cox-speaks-about-hiv-aids-advocacy-band-aid-red

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: When a team of millennial scientists at J&J all noticed they were experiencing common skin dilemmas such as dullness, dryness, fine lines, and dark spots, they decided to tag-team to develop a skin brightening line tailored to their specific skin needs. The results of the first-ever global collaboration: the new Neutrogena Bright Boost™ skincare line. Meet the four scientists behind the skincare line, and learn about the effects of its powerhouse ingredient.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
