Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: As families across the U.S. prepare to celebrate Thanksgiving, Margaret Gurowitz, Chief Historian, Johnson & Johnson, takes a look back at the historic Laurel Club, an all-female employee group founded in 1907 that embodies two of Johnson & Johnson's proudest traditions: women's leadership and community service. From entertaining wounded soldiers during World War I to raising money to purchase beds for what's now the Robert Wood Johnson University Hospital, learn how the group helped lay the groundwork for J&J’s lasting dedication to helping those in need.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: The upcoming holidays are prime time for decadent, sugary desserts and skipping exercise. While this may be problematic for just about anyone concerned about their health, it’s especially challenging if you have type 2 diabetes. From preparing exercise options when traveling or in cold weather to making an effort to get back on track after a holiday meal, an internist shares expert advice for maintaining your health from Thanksgiving to New Year’s.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: “We believe if more nurses are empowered to impact lives at a bigger and broader scale, the potential for a stronger healthcare system, improved patient outcomes, and a more engaged nursing workforce is tremendous.”— Lynda Benton, Senior Director, Corporate Equity, Johnson & Johnson, on the importance of elevating nurses as innovative changemakers to help improve healthcare. From empowering nurses to actively pursue opportunities in healthcare innovation to calling on nursing schools to add innovation, leadership, and entrepreneurial courses into their curriculums, learn about the many ways that J&J is committed to supporting nurses, as Lynda Benton, Senior Director at J&J and Rebecca Love, President of SONSIEL, reflect on the inaugural Nurse Hackathon: http://bit.ly/2QEl8xS:=:https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/elevating-nurses-innovative-changemakers-ahead-2020-lynda-benton/?published=t

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Did you know you have trillions of microorganisms that co-exist in and on your body called the microbiome—and they can help combat skin conditions such as acne and eczema? This Healthy Skin Month, learn how Johnson & Johnson has been at the forefront of improving skincare, thanks to innovative microbiome research—like an acne-zapping gel that could boost healthy bacteria levels.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: In 2002, Michael Sneed, Executive Vice President, Global Corporate Affairs & Chief Communication Officer, Johnson & Johnson, had been traveling frequently to China for work when he decided to propose the idea of adopting a child from the country to his wife. Soon after, they brought home their daughter Karis from an orphanage—and thanks to J&J's industry-leading support for parents, fulfilled the dream of expanding their family. In celebration of National Adoption Month, learn more about Sneed’s inspiring journey as an adoptive and biological dad—and join us in celebrating families of all shapes and forms at J&J.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Fact: Most people who get lung cancer today are either nonsmokers or have never smoked. This Lung Cancer Awareness Month, learn out how Johnson & Johnson’s Lung Cancer Initiative, led by Dr. Avrum Spira, is harnessing our expertise in large-scale development programs, global clinical trials, and more areas to help make early treatment and prevention a reality.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: What do working dads really want from employers when it comes to balancing their jobs and families? It’s a question that Johnson & Johnson and Working Mother Magazine aimed to solve through their recent survey, which polled almost 2,000 fathers in over 20 industries. Alongside the new research, we’re proud to name Scott Joslin, Director of R&D, J&J Vision Care Inc., as our “Working Dad of the Year” to represent J&J. Learn more about the survey, and how J&J initiatives such as a generous global parental leave policy and a backup childcare benefit make the company a noteworthy place for fathers.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Did you know that globally, the flu kills up to 650,000 people each year, according to World Health Organization (WHO)? It’s why researchers at the Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson are working to discover new and improved ways for preventing and treating the virus. As peak flu season approaches, learn about some of the novel ideas that researchers are exploring, like a partnership with the Biomedical Advanced Research and Development Authority (BARDA) aimed at developing a “universal” flu vaccine.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: From a collaboration between Johnson & Johnson, the American Academy of Pediatrics, and the Chinese Ministry of Health aimed at helping reduce the rate of birth asphyxia in China, to educational programs designed to help strengthen midwifery education and promote research, J&J is working to ensure that babies around the globe come into this world healthy and safe. This Prematurity Awareness Month, learn more about the J&J programs and partnerships helping achieve this goal.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Since 1897, Johnson & Johnson has been a proud champion of nurses, who’ve brought innovation to patient care. Nurses are central to our commitment to helping change the trajectory of health for humanity for everyone, everywhere. In honor of the 2019 SONSIEL Nurse Hackathon—proudly sponsored by J&J—discover the groundbreaking ways J&J is helping unite nurses to foster collaboration, problem-solving, and innovative thinking aimed at tackling healthcare's greatest challenges: http://bit.ly/2VbvUKv:=:https://nursing.jnj.com/

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: At the Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson, scientists are currently conducting a groundbreaking Alzheimer’s clinical trial for 500 people between the ages of 60 and 85 with one important goal: Develop cognitive tests so sensitive and specific that they can detect Alzheimer’s before patients even know they have it. This National Alzheimer's Awareness Month, meet Gary Romano, Head of Development, Alzheimer’s Disease and Neurology at Janssen, and learn why he believes better assessment tools could give more people the opportunity to live well into old age before they’re severely impaired by the disease.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Wintertime means everyone could use a little extra immune support, especially kids. For parents, it can be a frustrating search to find the best, most wholesome products to keep kids healthy. As the temperature drops, read this pediatrician's tips for helping keep pint-sized noses, throats and immune systems in tip-top shape.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Did you know studies in twins show that when one twin develops type 2 diabetes, the other twin has a three in four risk of also developing it, according to the American Diabetes Association? The good news: your DNA doesn’t have to determine your medical future. This World Diabetes Day, learn from experts how you can help lower your chances of developing diabetes and other conditions with strong genetic ties, like heart disease—even if they don’t run in your family tree.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: “Robots have the potential to make optimal outcomes available to everyone.” — Frederic Moll, M.D., Chief Development Officer, Johnson & Johnson Medical Devices Companies (JJMDC), and founder and former CEO of Auris Health, a medical robotics company that’s now part of JJMDC. After a trailblazing career in surgical robotics, "the father of robotic surgery" has taken on a new challenge: helping reinvent lung cancer care. This Lung Cancer Awareness Month, meet the pioneer and learn how his latest innovation, the Monarch™ Platform—a compact machine with two outstretched armlike instruments—may one day be able to diagnose and treat lung cancer at the same time.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Shortly after Johnson & Johnson employee Fernando Salinas began volunteering at an orphanage near his home in Brazil, he adopted Ilio, a young boy who he later discovered had AIDS. This National Adoption Month, learn more about Fernando’s life-changing decision in this powerful story of hope, perseverance, and unconditional fatherly love.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: “Listening and being exposed to different ideas and perspectives taught me a lot about decision-making, as well as the importance of creating an environment where everyone is valued and all ideas are heard.” — Alex Gorsky, Chairman and CEO, Johnson & Johnson, on one of the most valuable lessons he learned during his time in the U.S. Army. On Veteran’s Day, meet the former Captain of the U.S. army and other inspiring J&J employees, and learn how their time in the armed forces helped shape their personal and professional lives.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: ✔️ Paying service members their full salary, in addition to what the military pays, while deployed ✔️ Paid time off after military leave to help employees acclimate to life back home These are just two of the many ways Johnson & Johnson has continued our longstanding commitment to support military service members. In honor of Veteran’s Day, read this personal story from a Janssen employee and member of the U.S. U.S. Navy Reserve as he reflects on the impact our generous policies had on him and his family.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: In 1995, 37% of all computer scientists were women, but today that number has fallen to only 24%. As part of Johnson & Johnson’s longstanding commitment to ignite the power of women—and inspire the next generation of women in STEM—J&J partnered with Girls Who Code's Summer Immersion Program at the company’s Raritan campus in New Jersey this summer. This Code Day—which brings together STEM students around the world—meet two program participants and learn why they consider the experience life-changing: http://bit.ly/2WWlIIb:=:https://www.jnj.com/personal-stories/johnson-johnson-hosts-girls-who-code-for-summer-immersion-program

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Did you know that each year, more people in the U.S. die from lung cancer than from breast, colon, and prostate cancer combined? That's due, in large part, to the fact that lung cancer is usually detected and treated too late. A recent study co-authored by a team of scientists, including those from the Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson and the Lung Cancer Initiative at Johnson & Johnson, found that researchers may be one step closer to diagnosing lung cancer earlier. This Lung Cancer Awareness Month, learn about the researchers' findings—including how biomarkers related to the immune system may be able to help diagnose and treat patients at the earliest stage of the disease.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Did you know that Johnson & Johnson offers innovative employee benefits designed to help better meet the individual needs of our workforce? From free mental health counseling for employees and their family members to full-service health clinics staffed with doctors and nurses at 100 locations across the globe, learn more about the groundbreaking benefits that J&J has implemented to help our employees take control of every aspect of their health.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: "I had an epiphany: I could help create better primary care for thousands of patients if I could help medical students and healthcare workers in remote areas receive a more comprehensive education." — Rayan Mamoon, a physician, Johnson & Johnson One Young World Scholarship recipient, and founder of Courses Cross Borders, which provides affordable classes and training sessions to healthcare workers and students living in rural and conflict settings in Sudan. Meet the inspiring young doctor, and learn how her unique program is helping make life better for the people of her country.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Do you dread getting the flu shot because of the needle? If so, you'll be happy to learn that scientists at the Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson, in partnership with biotech company Vaxart, are working to develop an oral flu vaccine in the form of a pill—and that's just one of the flu innovations J&J researchers and their partners are currently exploring. As peak flu season approaches, discover other new and improved ways J&J researchers are rethinking how we prevent and treat the flu virus.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: "With type 2 diabetes and its related complications, there’s often a one-size-fits-all treatment given to patients, even though not everyone responds in the exact same way. Our mission is to change that." — Chiara Magnone, Ph.D., Vice President, Metabolic Complications, Janssen Research & Development, the Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson, and Director of a Boston research center for preventing and treating diabetes-related diseases. This National Diabetes Month, learn about Dr. Magnone’s innovative work to help the millions of patients living with the disease, like researching ways to encourage kidneys to regrow healthy cells and replace older, damaged ones.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Bladder cancer is the 6th most common cancer, yet treatment options for metastatic bladder cancer are limited. But a groundbreaking treatment from the Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson holds promise for some people living with an aggressive form of the disease. This Bladder Health Awareness Month, learn more about bladder cancer and the treatment’s 22-year journey from discovery to patients who may benefit most.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Fact: Some 20% of people diagnosed with lung cancer have never touched a cigarette. And with an 18% five-year survival rate, the disease is also difficult to catch early, as tumors usually only become symptomatic when they grow outside the lung. This Lung Cancer Awareness Month, learn from scientists who've spent their careers researching the disease how to protect yourself, and discover the latest pioneering research to help catch it in its earliest stages—and potentially prevent the disease altogether.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: The Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC) is experiencing the world’s second worst outbreak on record, with over 3,000 confirmed cases and 2,000 deaths as of October 2019. Johnson & Johnson announces that Janssen will donate up to 500,000 regimens of its investigational Ebola vaccine in support of the DRC’s response to help protect its citizens against the outbreak. Learn about our efforts to tackle the crisis from Paul Stoffels, M.D., Chief Scientific Officer, Johnson & Johnson—and discover how we’re actively working to help deliver the next generation of breakthroughs to address infectious disease threats.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Lisa Deck was 21 years old and just days before her college graduation when she experienced a severe headache. Her doctors chalked up her symptoms to stress, but days later new symptoms arose: numbness in her face and left leg, plus confusion and trouble talking. Her doctor confirmed she’d had her first stroke. Three more strokes followed, plus a double brain bypass and a diagnosis of moyamoya disease—a rare, progressive disorder caused by blocked arteries at the base of the brain. On World Stroke Day, read Lisa’s inspiring story, and learn how she’s raising her family and helping other female stroke survivors along the way.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Fact: Over one million people in the United States undergo total joint replacement each year. If you're one of the many that are considering, preparing for, or recovering from orthopedic surgery, this expert advice from Certified Family Nurse Practitioner Shandy Welch—who has over 20 years of experience working with orthopedic surgeons—may help alleviate anxiety and set you up for a successful recovery.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Through collaboration, accelerated tuberculosis (TB) innovation, and a patient-first approach, Johnson & Johnson and its strategic partners are committed to helping eliminate TB—the world's deadliest infectious disease—by 2030. Learn more about the latest step J&J has taken in its 10-year initiative—a decade-long commitment to helping achieve a world without TB—and how this commitment will help improve the health and well-being of people around the world.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: From a $10 million pledge to UNICEF aimed at empowering frontline health workers through education, to a commitment to help the United Nations meet its 2030 Sustainable Development Goals, Johnson & Johnson is proud to support the U.N.'s mission to improve the health of people around the world. This U.N. Day, learn how J&J is working to help change the trajectory of health for humanity across the globe.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: What are some of the ways Johnson & Johnosn is working to create an inclusive environment for people with disabilities? ✔️A Mental Health Diplomats program that helps people with "hidden" disabilities like depression get support at work. ✔️An Alliance for Diverse Abilities employee resource group that strives to create an enabling culture for people with diverse abilities, as well as their caregivers and advocates. These initiatives are just two of the reasons why J&J was named one of the Best Places to Work for People with Disabilities in 2018 by the Disability:IN and the American Association of People with Disabilities. This National Disability Employment Awareness Month, learn how J&J is committed to ensuring that all employees feel like they belong and can perform at their best.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: "When I was doing rounds at a hospital in Sudan, I frequently witnessed healthcare discrimination. Patients with fewer means were given less access to the best care. It was blatant health inequity. All I could think was: What can I do for these people?" — Rayan Mamoon, a 24-year-old Sudanese doctor, minority health rights activist, researcher, social entrepreneur, and recipient of the Johnson & Johnson One Young World Scholarship, which was created to nurture young leaders across the globe to change the trajectory of health for humanity. As the One Young World youth leadership summit kicks off today in London, meet Dr. Mamoom, and learn how the inspiring leader’s Courses Cross Borders program is providing affordable classes and training sessions to healthcare workers and students living in rural and conflict settings in Sudan.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: By the time Marisa Troy met Frank Garufi six years ago at a gathering for inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) patients and advocates, she'd had 15 open abdominal surgeries for ulcerative colitis, and, meanwhile, his son had been battling Crohn’s disease since he was a toddler, enduring treatments and painful symptoms. And yet, despite the challenges of living with chronic illness, Marisa and Frank found love—and strength—in each other. Meet the newly engaged couple, and learn how they overcame IBD's challenging circumstances to build a happy future and advocate for others living with IBD.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: “It was designed to be multifunctional—to have everything in one moisturizer, including sun protection, which makes it perfect for my overscheduled millennial life.” —Anna Trondoli, 31, Senior Scientist, Skin Health, Johnson & Johnson Brazil, who helped create the new Neutrogena Bright Boost™ Moisturizer with Broad Spectrum SPF 30. Meet Anna and the millennial team behind the skincare line designed for millennials, and learn how they brought their ideas to life in the first-ever global collaboration: http://bit.ly/2oYiyXG:=:https://www.jnj.com/innovation/neutrogena-bright-boost-millennial-skincare-with-neoglucosamine

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: "Autism is considered an 'invisible' disability because the signs and symptoms are not physical and not always obvious. Yet someone with autism may also need additional help or accommodation—just as those with visible disabilities sometimes do." — Angela Andrews, Data Integrity Manager at the Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson, on advocating for others just like her. As Invisible Disabilities Week comes to an end, meet Angela and learn why having a neurodiverse workplace like that at Johnson & Johnson can be a formula for success.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: "We go after big challenges and try to find the right solutions for people around the world." —Thibaut Mongon, Executive Vice President and Worldwide Chairman of Consumer Health, Johnson & Johnson, on what excites him most about leading the Consumer Health business which includes brands like the allergy medication ZYRTEC® and Neutrogena®, the #1 recommended skincare brand by dermatologists. Learn how Mongon and his team are working to help change the trajectory of personal health through innovative products and solutions, like using a mix of artificial intelligence (AI) and live consumer care representatives on social media platforms—including Facebook—to answer customers’ questions quickly and accurately, in this Q&A.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: "Doctors said he wouldn’t have made it if they’d waited one more week to start treatment." — Kristine, the mom of Jackson, who survived a high fever and a collapsed lung at two months old—followed by a shocking tuberculosis (TB) diagnosis. Discover Jackson and Kristine's powerful story—from Jackson’s 18 months of treatments to the family’s TB advocacy work across the country—and help spread awareness about the disease that can impact anyone, anywhere.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: “I'm fascinated about science and cosmetics.” — Carine Hardy, 29, Senior Scientist, Skin Health, Johnson & Johnson Consumer Holdings France, one of the four millennial scientists who helped create Neutrogena Bright Boost™, the skincare line designed to meet the unique skin needs of millennial women everywhere. Meet Carine and the three other millennial J&J scientists behind the first-ever global collaboration, and learn how their personal skincare dilemmas helped inspire the line: http://bit.ly/2oYiyXG:=:https://www.jnj.com/innovation/neutrogena-bright-boost-millennial-skincare-with-neoglucosamine

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Fact: There are 700 different species of bacteria in your mouth, and every time you drink a glass of water, you swallow millions of bacteria. This National Dental Hygiene Month, three scientists share how these bacteria in your mouth may impact your overall health—and could also someday change the way we think about dental care altogether.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Are you one of the more than one million people who get a total joint replacement each year? Or are you considering having joint surgery? If so, you’ll want to save these expert tips from Shandy Welch, a certified Family Nurse Practitioner with over 20 years of experience working with orthopedic surgeons. This World Arthritis Day, Shandy shares insider advice on what to do if you’re considering, preparing for, or recovering from orthopedic surgery—from finding the right specialist to how to retrofit your home for recovery.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: At Johnson & Johnson, we are committed to building a diverse and inclusive workforce that can help unite us all toward our common goal: changing the trajectory of health for humanity. Learn about the outcomes-based approaches and strategies—such as the use of artificial intelligence to increase qualified applicants and gender diversity—in place at J&J that help us advance a culture of belonging, as Wanda Hope, Chief Diversity and Inclusion Officer, J&J, reflects on the launch of our first-ever “You Belong: Diversity & Inclusion Impact Review”: http://bit.ly/33f17ki

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Among the most common myths about weight-loss surgery: It’s only for people who have hundreds of pounds to lose, and people who opt for the procedure don’t want to diet and exercise. On World Obesity Day, find out answers to common questions as medical experts share the facts about bariatric surgery, from what BMI you really need to have to qualify for the procedure, to the changes in eating involved in recovery.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: “Our hope is that diseases of the mind will someday be viewed like any other illness, where there is no shame, just compassion." — Husseini Manji, M.D., Global Therapeutic Head for Neuroscience, Janssen Research & Development, the Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson. J&J remains committed to helping lead the charge in creating new treatments for patients with mental illnesses like treatment-resistant depression—and changing the stigma often associated with them. This World Mental Health Day, learn how J&J has embraced innovation to help improve the lives of people who suffer from mental illness through initiatives, such as a coalition to help address mental health in the workplace and a pilot program helping train healthcare workers in Rwanda.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Want to know which foods can help ward off age-related vision problems, like cataracts and macular degeneration? Or how often you should get your eyes checked? On World Sight Day, Johnson & Johnson Vision’s optometry experts share the answers to these questions, and even more ways you can be proactive about protecting your eyes from vision loss and impairment.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: "I might have a honeymoon period where an antidepressant works for a while, but then it stops helping. So I try something new. And then try something else." — Imade Nibokun Borha, who's among the one-third of adults with major depressive disorder that also battle symptoms ranging from sadness to suicidal thoughts which traditional treatments aren't able to resolve. During Mental Illness Awareness Week, help #EndtheStigma and read Imade’s brave story to learn about her struggles with mental health—and the silver lining she's found through her diagnosis.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: “We worked as a global team to exchange experiences, and regional and cultural preferences to make products that would be suitable for women all over the world with different skin types.” — Anna Trondoli, 31, Senior Scientist, Skin Health, Johnson & Johnson do Brasil Industria E Comercio de Produtos Para Saude Ltda., and part of the millennial team who helped create the Neutrogena Bright Boost™ skincare line. Learn about the first-ever global collaboration to meet the specific skin needs of people in their late 20s and 30s—and discover the skincare line's powerhouse ingredient Neoglucosamine® that can help encourage cell turnover and improve the look of dark spots for a more even skin tone: http://bit.ly/2oYiyXG:=:https://www.jnj.com/innovation/neutrogena-bright-boost-millennial-skincare-with-neoglucosamine

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: “He's our little miracle.” — Kristine, whose son Jackson was initially misdiagnosed with pneumonia as a two-month-old after running a high fever. To her shock, doctors later realized the infant had tuberculosis (TB). Jackson's one of the approximately one million children who develop TB every year—a disease that can impact anyone, anywhere—and kids are more likely to develop more severe, life-threatening forms of the disease. For Child Health Day, learn about his journey from a patient to an advocate for TB awareness alongside global leaders—and help Jackson, along with his dedicated mom, raise awareness about TB.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: “Diversity and inclusion at Johnson & Johnson is not just a commitment—it’s the reality of how we must live and work.” — Michael Sneed, Executive Vice President, Global Corporate Affairs & Chief Communication Officer, Johnson & Johnson, on our mission to build a workplace where everyone feels they belong. One of the ways we’re building a culture of belonging? Establishing programs that promote a diverse workforce for the future, like Re-Ignite, which aims to help STEM2D professionals return to work after an extended break. Discover more ways J&J is working to accelerate our diversity and inclusion mission globally in our inaugural “You Belong: D&I Impact Review.”

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: At Johnson & Johnson, diversity and inclusion (D&I) is more than just a corporate buzz phrase—it’s a business imperative that enables us to change the trajectory of health for humanity. How? Here’s a couple of ways we’re working to advance our D&I mission... ✔️Embedding D&I into everything we do to help our people lead inclusively ✔️Applying innovative strategies to diversify our workforce and better serve our patients, customers, and communities ...and more. Discover all of the innovative ways J&J is working to harness the power of our diverse workforce to help change the trajectory of human health by downloading our first-ever “You Belong: Diversity & Inclusion Impact Review.”

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Did you know that Johnson & Johnson has advertised its sterile surgical products in Spanish since the 1880s? Or, that by 1898 it formed its own Spanish Language Department to translate ads and other materials into Spanish? In honor of National Hispanic Heritage Month, learn about J&J’s long history of supporting our Spanish-speaking patients, medical community, and customers.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Studies show that tea can help inhibit cavities, banish bad breath and prevent gum disease, which makes the pH neutral beverage a true oral powerhouse and the the innovation behind qii. Created by DoseBiome, a JLABS incubatee, the tasty beverage is designed, to maintain a healthy mouth by keeping acid and disease-causing microbes at bay. For National Dental Hygiene Month, learn how the oral health drink is brewed to optimize tea’s health-boosting extracts—and why it’s at the forefront of promising field of microbiome research.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Today, Johnson & Johnson is proud to announce it will invest $500 million over the next four years in world-class research and delivery programs to accelerate efforts to eliminate HIV and end tuberculosis by 2030. Learn how together with governments and strategic partners we can help make HIV history and end tuberculosis: jnj.com/HIV

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Neurodegenerative diseases like Parkinson’s or Huntington’s are often-fatal conditions. Franz-Ulrich Hartl, M.D., and Arthur Horwich, M.D., have tirelessly researched the science behind these diseases, leading to revolutionary insights that could prove important in creating new treatments to fight these illnesses. This year’s winners of the Dr. Paul Janssen Award for Biomedical Research embody the legacy of Dr. Paul, the founder of the Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson. As they're awarded the 2019 Dr. Paul Janssen Award for Biomedical Research today, learn about their groundbreaking work—and why it has the potential to make a lasting impact on human health.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: "I left Bangladesh feeling inspired and filled with hope for what’s to come from our continued partnership." —Peter Fasolo, Executive Vice President and Chief Human Resources Officer, Johnson & Johnson. In honor of Children's Health Month, read Peter's inspiring account of J&J's work with Save the Children US in Bangladesh to build a healthy future for children, and learn about the programs helping improve newborn care in slums and mental health care for kids in need.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: “Now, in my thirties, I felt that my skin was more dull and dry. My career goal was to develop a product that all women can benefit from.” —Diyana Sudarsono, Senior Scientist, Skin Health, Johnson & Johnson Pte. Ltd. (Singapore), a scientist who helped create the Neutrogena Bright Boost™ Gel Cream, part of the new skin brightening line of products made for millennials, by millennials, to meet their specific skin needs. Meet Diyana and the global team of scientists behind the new skin care line, and learn how its powerhouse ingredient Neoglucosamine® helped improve skin brightness for 93% of people who tested it: http://bit.ly/2oYiyXG:=:https://www.jnj.com/innovation/neutrogena-bright-boost-millennial-skincare-with-neoglucosamine

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Can you imagine a biosensor tattoo that monitors a diabetic patient's blood sugar by changing from black to pink? One of the six Johnson & Johnson's 2019 WiSTEM2D Scholar Award winners did—and received a $150,000 grant and mentorship from leaders at J&J for her groundbreaking idea. If you're a woman studying science, technology, engineering, math, manufacturing and design at the graduate level who has an innovative idea, the deadline to submit an application for the 2020 Johnson & Johnson WiSTEM2D Scholar Award is soon approaching. Apply by October 3 here: https://bit.ly/2KSo8TK:=:https://www.jnj.com/johnson-johnson-now-accepting-global-applications-for-2020-women-in-stem2d-scholars-award

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Global Citizen Festival may be over, but the fight to make HIV history continues. Watch Michael Sneed, Executive Vice President, Global Corporate Affairs & Chief Communication Officer, Johnson & Johnson, thank nurses Cliff Morrison and Alison Moed of 5B Film for helping revolutionize AIDS patient care. Learn how they did it: http://bit.ly/2mGani2:=:https://www.jnj.com/personal-stories/ward-5b-how-one-nurse-revolutionized-patient-care-during-the-aids-crisis

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Do you get cholesterol and blood pressure checked regularly? Fit in exercise every day? Limit trans fats in your diet? If these are all part of your routine, you're taking the right steps to protect yourself against diseases like hypertension—but there may be additional ways you can ensure your ticker stays in shape. On World Heart Day, learn how you can protect your heart—as well as advances in cardiac care, like new ways to detect atrial fibrillation—from cardiothoracic surgeon Charles R. Bridges, M.D., Sc.D., Global Chief Technology Officer, Pulmonary Hypertension Therapeutic Area, R&D, part of the Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: “We will soon start the Mosaico trial, the first study of its kind for our investigational HIV-1 preventative vaccine.” — Paul Stoffels, M.D., Vice Chairman of the Executive Committee and Chief Scientific Officer, on the exciting new milestone reached in our mission to help make HIV history announced at the 2019 Global Citizen Festival in NYC. Learn how our first-ever trial of an HIV vaccine in the men who have sex with men (MSM) and transgender populations is poised to make a global impact from Dr. Hanneke Schuitemaker, VP & Global Head of Viral Vaccine Discovery and Translational Medicine, Janssen Vaccines & Prevention B.V.: http://bit.ly/2Z3ZtjP:=:https://www.jnj.com/latest-news/the-quest-for-a-global-preventive-hiv-vaccine-reaches-a-new-milestone

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: TODAY: Johnson & Johnson proudly presents the Global Citizen Festival live stream on Twitter and YouTube. Tune in NOW to catch Queen + Adam Lambert, Pharrell Williams, Alicia Keys, and more: http://bit.ly/2mw87Kb:=:https://music.youtube.com/watch?v=81LliO0EYeU&list=RDAMVM81LliO0EYeU

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: "I did what many wouldn't—I removed my gloves and touched the patients.” — 5B Film’s Alison Paolercio, a nurse who worked at San Francisco General Hospital’s Ward 5B—the first dedicated AIDS unit in the U.S—and helped humanize AIDS patient care during the height of the epidemic in the 1980s. Ahead of today's Global Citizen Festival, read about Alison's courageous story and meet more inspiring HIV patient advocates and researchers working to #MakeHIVHistory—and tune-in to the live stream starting at 4 p.m. ET for an exciting announcement about our investigational HIV vaccine.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: ✔️Foster an innovative mindset through initiatives such as the Johnson & Johnson Innovation Centers which provide resources, financial support and expertise to scientists, entrepreneurs and emerging companies. ✔️Encourage employees to expand their horizons by participating in our Talent for Good programs, which allow employees to take paid leave to gain new perspectives volunteering across the world. These are just a few reasons why J&J was recognized in Fast Company's inaugural Best Workplaces for Innovators list. Learn more about the ways we enable innovation to thrive across every aspect of our business—and how we’re fueling the future of human health from Peter Fasolo, our Chief Human Resources Officer.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: “As a nurse, I saw that in healthcare boundaries were everywhere. There was this huge fear and hysteria. But then we took off our gloves. We took off our gloves to remove a boundary, because a simple touch of the hand creates connection on a human level.” — 5B Film’s Cliff Morrison, who helped humanize AIDS care in the 1980s. Ahead of the Global Citizen Festival on September 28—where Johnson & Johnson will share an exciting announcement about our investigational HIV vaccine trial—meet more inspiring HIV researchers and patient advocates working to #MakeHIVHistory: http://bit.ly/2mB3Zbk:=:https://www.jnj.com/innovation/meet-4-people-who-are-working-to-help-make-hiv-history

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Johnson & Johnson is proud to earn the #1 ranking on Working Mother Magazine's 100 Best Companies list—our 34th consecutive year as a "Best Company"—in part for the benefits we offer for working families, like generous parental leave, surrogacy and adoption support, and breast milk shipping for nursing moms. Alongside this recognition, we’re proud to also name Laura Bueno de Greco, Senior Brand Manager, Consumer Oral Health – Listerine ® Innovation as our “Working Mother of the Year” to represent J&J. Learn more about this honor, and join us in celebrating all the working moms and dads for their successes at home and in the workplace.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Experts predict that more than 60% of the polar bear population could disappear by 2050 due to warming sea temperatures. In honor of Climate Week, meet an impressive polar bear named Nora who survived a big move and a challenging surgery, and learn how J&J helped her heal from a broken leg this year—and if you’re ever at the Utah's Hogle Zoo, be sure to say hi to her!

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Are you excited for television's big awards show tonight? Go back in time for a history lesson on the early days of TV and learn how Johnson & Johnson pioneered TV ads in 1955 as one of the first major sponsors for the kids' show "The Adventures of Robin Hood"—and learn about the fun product J&J created especially to promote it.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: True or false: Baby shampoo is all you need to thoroughly clean kids' hair. False. Baby shampoo may not completely clean longer, thicker kids’ hair—and this is just one reason why the Johnson's® Kids Hair Care line for young kids’ unique hair needs was created. Take our quiz to find out how much you really know about caring for little ones’ hair—like how frequently to shampoo, the best natural ingredient to enhance curls, and more.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: When Brad Heidrich was 13, he felt a lacerating pain cut through his right knee while crouching down at his school locker. It turned out to be osteosarcoma, a rare form of bone cancer.. The disease delivered an unexpected gift: a deep sense of purpose that inspired Brad to become a Senior Scientist at the Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson. In honor of Blood Cancer Awareness Month, learn about his incredible story and how he's working to develop treatments for blood cancers like acute myeloid leukemia, diffuse large B-cell lymphoma and multiple myeloma.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: "It's not just about women pushing for women—it’s about setting the imperative of a gender-diverse workforce and striving to better reflect the markets we serve." — Luly de Samper, head of Johnson & Johnson's Women’s Leadership & Inclusion in Latin America. In honor of Hispanic Heritage Month, learn about de Samper’s mission to advance women’s leadership in Spanish-speaking countries, and how she’s helping nurture groundbreaking female leaders in Argentina, Colombia and Mexico—where over half of J&J’s medical devices leadership team is female.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Today, the Johnson & Johnson Executive Committee and colleagues helped commemorate the 75th anniversary of our Initial Public Offering by ringing the New York Stock Exchange Opening Bell—marking our continued commitment to improving health for all. Watch as we celebrate this milestone moment.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Since our founding with 14 employees to becoming the world’s largest broad-based healthcare company, Johnson & Johnson has been helping to change the trajectory of human health since becoming a public company in September 1944. Today, Alex Gorsky, Chairman and CEO, and Joe Wolk, Executive Vice President, CFO, J&J, help commemorate this milestone moment by ringing the New York Stock Exchange’s opening bell. Watch to learn more about our journey and continued evolution.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: "We are constantly innovating by investing in our people and in technology to meet the needs of patients, consumers and customers." — Kathy Wengel, Chief Global Supply Chain Officer, Johnson & Johnson, who was recently named the recipient of the 2019 Council of Supply Chain Management Professionals Distinguished Service Award, the highest honor in supply chain, and inducted into to the Supply Chain Hall of Fame. Join J&J in congratulating Kathy Wengel, and learn about some of the innovative ways our supply chain is addressing global issues like plastic waste, improving processes to deliver better value to all and building diverse global teams across the organization to help keep the large scale operation humming—and evolving.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: A portable, solar-powered phototherapy crib to help treat jaundice. A mobile phone-based hearing test that works in four minutes. A mosquito repellent soap that helps combat malaria. What do these inventions have in common? They have potential to tackle major healthcare problems across Africa—and they're three of the six innovations that won Johnson & Johnson's recent Africa Innovation Challenge. Learn about the winning start-ups—and the inspiring creators—that could help improve health in African communities where it’s needed most.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: This Baby Safety Month, take a look at some of Johnson & Johnson's innovations that have helped parents safely and more conveniently care for their little ones since 1894, from Johnson's® Baby Lotion that debuted in 1944 to help prevent diaper and heat rash, to Johnson's® CottonTouch™ Newborn Face & Body Lotion today that can help make bath time less stressful for parent and baby.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: In Bangladesh, millions of people live in urban slums—which creates a notably high rate of newborn mortality. That's why Johnson & Johnson has partnered with Save the Children US to help local communities in the country face its newborn mortality rate and improve newborn care in slums. In honor of our just-announced $5 million pledge to the organization’s Centennial Commitment, read an inspiring firsthand account from Peter Fasolo, Executive Vice President and Chief Human Resources Officer, J&J, on the extraordinary impact our partnership with Save the Children can have on Bangladeshi communities experiencing the crisis, and learn how we’re partnering to help sick newborns born into poverty thrive.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: "Prostate cancer is very complicated, and while there have been advances, there’s still a huge unmet need in terms of treatment options. This is why we work so hard, and this is what motivates me to help drive new advancements."— Margaret Yu, M.D., Vice President, Disease Area Leader, Prostate Cancer, Janssen Research & Development, one of the Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson. For Prostate Cancer Awareness Month, learn from Dr. Yu about the risk factors and treatment options for prostate cancer, like hormone therapies that can help delay the spreading of the disease in some patients.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: “What’s new?” Paul Janssen, founder of Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson, relentlessly asked this question as he made the rounds of the Janssen research labs, which merged with J&J in 1962. His pursuit of innovation inspired many groundbreaking treatments used today, like the first new treatment for tuberculosis in more than 40 years. Today, on what would be Dr. Janssen's 93rd birthday, learn about this remarkable scientist and his lasting contribution to the company––and medicine.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: "It's really important to do studies to find out how to appropriately use these medicines in children of different ages, and that’s one of the main things Johnson & Johnson is committed to doing through CHILD." —Samuel Maldonado, M.D., Head of Pediatric Drug Development and Vice President, Child Health Innovation Leadership Department (CHILD), Johnson & Johnson. For Baby Safety Month, find out how CHILD is helping drive the creation of new policies and safer medical treatments for kids of all ages—like convening a consortium of experts to better understand neonatal diseases, and research into fast-dissolving tablets and tiny pills that are easier for kids to swallow.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Each day, 20 veterans die from suicide in the U.S.—and their suicide rates have gone up since 2001, particularly in women. This World Suicide Prevention Day, take a closer look at the crisis, and find out how you can help raise awareness and help make a difference in the life of a veteran through simple actions, such as sending a text to check in or sending a care package to help lessen the person’s load. If you're in crisis and need immediate help: • Call the Veterans Crisis Line seven days a week, 365 days a year at 800-273-8255 and press 1 • Visit VeteransCrisisLine.net • Or send a text to 838255

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Get to know the winners of this year's Johnson & Johnson WiSTEM2D Scholars Award—launched to help advance the careers of women in science, technology, engineering, math, manufacturing and design at the graduate level—and discover their amazing inventions, including tattoos that can monitor metabolism, and a gel that could speed up wound healing. Are you a woman working in STEM working to change the world—or know one who is? Applications for the 2020 Johnson & Johnson WiSTEM2D Scholar Award are open now! Apply here for a chance to win a $150,000 grant and 3 years of mentorship from leaders at J&J: https://bit.ly/2KSo8TK:=:https://www.jnj.com/johnson-johnson-now-accepting-global-applications-for-2020-women-in-stem2d-scholars-award

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: In the 1940s, Johnson & Johnson ran one of the most fashionable marketing campaigns in the company’s 130-plus-year history for its iconic Modess sanitary napkins. As New York Fashion Week gets underway, take a look at our fashionable ads shot by fashion photographers Cecil Beaton, Ruzzie Green and Valentino Sarra, featuring fabulous couture designs from Charles James and Christian Dior!

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: If you’ve ever considered LASIK to correct nearsightedness, farsightedness, and astigmatism, you may have heard a lot of myths about the procedure. Get the facts about LASIK from expert eye surgeons—like what you can expect before, during, and after the procedure—and learn about a highly personalized form of the treatment that maps a patient’s unique “optical fingerprint.” LASIK potential side effects include eye dryness, halos, glare, starbursts, ghost images, vision loss and other visual symptoms. For important safety information: http://bit.ly/2Zkcia4:=:https://www.jjvision.com/sites/default/files/media_center/iDESIGN_Refractive_Studio_Patient_All_Indications_ISI.PDF

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: "My hope is that, by sharing my story, I can help other men realize it’s OK to talk about their diagnosis of prostate cancer, and ask for help when trying to figure out their way forward." — Ron Scolamiero, husband, father, grandfather and prostate cancer survivor. Help spread awareness for Prostate Cancer Awareness Month, and learn about Ron's nearly two-decade journey living with advanced prostate cancer and how he is working to help other men face the disease.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Almost all maternal deaths occur in developing countries—many of which are caused by issues that could be detected with an ultrasound during pregnancy. Ultrasounds, however, are frequently unavailable in rural African clinics. Enter mScan, a low-cost mobile ultrasound scanner that connects to a tablet, that could help improve maternal mortality in Africa. mScan is one of the inventions from the six local African entrepreneurs that won Johnson & Johnson's second Africa Innovation Challenge and will receive up to $50,000 in funding, plus mentoring from J&J leaders. Meet the winners, discover their potentially life-saving solutions for their communities' biggest health problems, like maternal mortality—and learn how they're innovating everything from ultrasounds to baby cribs.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Calling all women in STEM working to help change the world: The Johnson & Johnson WiSTEM2D Scholar Award application period is officially open. Apply now for a chance to win a $150,000 grant and 3 years of mentorship from leaders at J&J: https://bit.ly/2KSo8TK:=:https://www.jnj.com/johnson-johnson-now-accepting-global-applications-for-2020-women-in-stem2d-scholars-award

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: When patients consider participating in a clinical trial—whether it's for a lifesaving cancer medication or a high-tech medical device—they're often deterred by factors like travel, extensive questionnaires, or lengthy medical assessments. And those are just the patients who can access a clinical trial. That's why Johnson & Johnson is helping revamp and diversify clinical research participation for patients in over 40 countries. Learn about our patient-first innovations, from electronic drug labels that can inform patients in real time of changes they need to make in their regimens, to launching four new landmark pediatric studies examining treatments for brittle bone disease and a rare inflammatory disorder.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Johnson & Johnson is excited to announce that 5B Film, proudly commissioned by J&J, is now available to stream on Verizon. Before you watch it, meet one of the courageous nurses featured in “5B” who helped revolutionize AIDS patients’ care during the 1980s AIDS crisis—and learn how this legacy lives on today: http://bit.ly/2Zt9YAZ:=:https://www.jnj.com/personal-stories/ward-5b-how-one-nurse-revolutionized-patient-care-during-the-aids-crisis

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: In the early 1900s, the number of women getting science degrees was so small that it's difficult to measure their numbers from that time. But Edith Von Kuster defied the statistics to graduate with a chemistry degree from the University of Minnesota in 1907—and then become Johnson & Johnson’s first female scientist in 1908. On Women's Equality Day, learn about her trailblazing path for women in science—and how she embodies the company’s long history of supporting women’s equality.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Do you know that 8 of Johnson & Johnson's first 14 employees were women? And that in 1908, J&J hired its first female scientist—a rarity for that time? They’re just a few of the many ways J&J has supported women throughout our long history. In honor of Women's Equality Day tomorrow, take a look back at how we’ve championed women, both in and outside of the company’s walls.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: A biosensor tattoo that could help diabetics keep tabs on their blood sugar. A wearable chip that could help diagnose a range of diseases. These are just a few big ideas from six female university researchers poised to change the world with their inventions. Ahead of Women's Equality Day, discover their inventions and learn how they’re furthering women’s careers in science, technology, engineering, math, manufacturing and design.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: A new school season is here, and the transition can be especially tough for kids and teens with autism, as well as their parents. Learn tips from autism specialists to help make the process as smooth and stress-free as possible for students of all ages with autism—like creating a simple document for elementary school teachers that outlines a child’s likes, dislikes and communication style, or arranging a lunch buddy for middle school kids.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: "Our ultimate goal is to deliver a 'global vaccine' that can help protect vulnerable and diverse populations at risk of infection all over the world." — Maria Grazia Pau, Senior Director, Compound Development and Team Leader, HIV Vaccine Programs, the Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson. Learn how J&J scientists are aiming to achieve this goal through an innovative mosaic vaccine technique, from its origins in the lab to the newly launched Mosaico trial.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Have you ever worn contact lenses past their recommended usage period? Or fallen asleep without taking them out first? Or exposed them to water while showering or swimming? If so, you can probably stand to brush up on how to best care for your contact lenses. This Contact Lens Health Week, learn from eye experts how to keep your eyes healthy and reduce your risk of infection.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: "Corporations have an opportunity—and an obligation—to drive positive change on behalf of our employees, our communities, and society.” — Alex Gorsky, Chairman & CEO, Johnson & Johnson, on why the Business Roundtable’s new Statement on the Purpose of a Corporation matters. Learn more about the work that went into updating the statement—and the impact it is expected to have: http://bit.ly/2Nf7VKa (Photo by Kevin Allen, Business Roundtable)

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Alex Gorsky, Chairman & CEO, Johnson & Johnson, and members of the Business Roundtable Corporate Governance Committee have released their revised Statement on the Purpose of a Corporation. Read more about the work the Committee did to update this statement for the 21st century—and the impact Alex expects it to have—in this month’s Fortune cover story: http://bit.ly/2P1MzCp

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: By day, Marthe-Sandrine Mpollo, MSc, Ph.D. (right), works at Johnson & Johnson as a scientific point of contact for dermatology healthcare providers. By night, she's working on NaYa, a mobile fintech app to help improve low- and middle-income populations’ access to affordable, quality healthcare. In honor of World Humanitarian Day, we’re recognizing women like Marthe-Sandrine who are helping make the world a better place. Meet more women at J&J who inspire others to give back.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: “People are doing their own research online. And a lot of what you find there is negative, or incorrect.” – Heidi Larson, Ph.D., anthropologist and Director of The Vaccine Confidence Project, on why there is distrust of vaccines today. During National Immunization Awareness Month, learn how Dr. Larson is working to help alleviate the public’s fears and concerns about vaccines–and ultimately protect the future.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Whether your child is an athlete or just having fun on the playground, sports- and recreation-related brain injuries in children, including concussions, are on the rise, according to the CDC. Ahead of the back-to-school season, Edwin Kuffner, M.D., Chief Medical Officer, Johnson & Johnson, Consumer Inc., shares what symptoms parents should look out for and what to do if they suspect a concussion.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: True or false: Young kids’ hair has unique needs that differ from a baby’s hair needs. True! It’s why Johnson's® has launched a new Johnson's® Kids Hair Care line, featuring products designed with young kids’ hair unique characteristics in mind. Take this quiz to see how much you know about caring for kids’ hair—and learn how often you need to shampoo, tackling stubborn tangles, and more.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Nurses Lauren Wright, Ph.D.(c), and Tram Pham, RN, first bonded over their shared passion for preventive wellness—a bond that later inspired them to create a line of bottles designed to empower stressed out moms by helping eliminate nipple confusion during breastfeeding. In honor of National Breastfeeding Month, learn how these nurse inventors used 3-D scanners to design the innovative bottles—and win Johnson & Johnson’s first Nurses Innovate QuickFire Challenge.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: August marks the one-year anniversary of Mercy Ships arriving in Guinea, Africa. Since then, the floating hospital has performed 2,442 surgeries, trained over 1,000 medical course participants—and celebrated countless moments of joy. Learn more about our 25-year partnership with Mercy Ships and how Johnson & Johnson helps support the “floating hospital” by providing hygiene kits and surgical products needed to help with burn care, tumor removal, cleft lip and palate repair, and more: http://bit.ly/2Tfp5bw:=:https://www.jnj.com/caring-and-giving/mercy-ships-floating-hospital-providing-healthcare-to-developing-countries

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: First aid kit ✔ Sunscreen ✔ Allergy medication ✔ These are just some of the Johnson & Johnson innovations that have also helped make vacationing easier since 1887. Take a look at more J&J inventions that go hand in hand with safe summer fun—and see if any made your packing list!

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: "As an Indigenous midwife, I help ensure the survival of the Nation." — Lesley Paulette, a registered midwife of Mohawk descent practicing in Canada's Northwest Territories. On International Day of the World's Indigenous Peoples, meet Lesley—and discover how she helps renew the strength of the Nation by empowering patients to incorporate meaningful spiritual practices, like smudging the birthing room with an herb to create a sacred space, as part of the birthing experience.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: “That's a bad rash. I’ve got a great moisturizer I can recommend.” This is a comment people living with psoriasis—which typically appears as a scaly red rash on skin—often receive. While typically well-meaning, comments like this reflect common misconceptions about the prevalent autoimmune disease. For Psoriasis Awareness Month, meet four people living with psoriasis and learn what they wish others knew about the condition—chief being that it's not contagious.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Do you know how often you should really wash your child’s hair? Or which nourishing oil that can help kids with dry, brittle hair? Take our quiz to learn the answers to these questions and more, and learn how the new Johnson's® Kids Hair Care line is designed to tackle all types of children's hair without over-stripping or exposing them to harsh ingredients often found in adult hair products.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: "Some people who suspect they might have the disease don’t even want to be diagnosed until there’s an effective cure." — Heather Davis, Ph.D., Vice President, Hepatitis Research and Development Leader, Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson. For 20 years, Davis has been studying hepatitis B—which affects nearly 300 million people worldwide—and leading efforts to help eliminate it as a public health threat by 2030. Learn about her and her team’s promising clinical trial that acts on different parts of the virus’ life cycle—and why it could put an end to the necessity for lifelong maintenance drugs.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Meet Wayne Drevets, M.D., Scientific Vice President and Disease Area Leader, Mood Disorders, Neuroscience Therapeutic Area, part of the Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson, a neuroscience research innovation leader on a mission to help improve treatments for everything from bipolar illness to treatment-resistant depression. Learn about the groundbreaking work his team is leading—and the moving personal reason why he’s so focused on helping people living with depression.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: For National Eye Exam Month, Johnson & Johnson Vision experts share how to care for your eyes year-round. Find out how to choose an eye doctor, how often to get a checkup, and more.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: The end-of-summer countdown to back-to-school season has begun—a transition that can be especially tough for kids with autism. One way to make it easier for children in elementary school? Work with your child’s teacher to set up a safe space where they can go if they feel overwhelmed or tired. Read more tips from three experts that can help make the process smoother for elementary to high school students with autism.

Page.Name: Johnson & Johnson
Page.Description: Like us to see how we're solving the world's toughest health challenges.
Message: Did you know many summer getaway essentials used today, like the first aid kit, started out as Johnson & Johnson innovations? On Flashback Friday, take a look at all the ways J&J has helped make vacationing easier—and safer—since 1887.
